showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely Disgusting Hygiene Standards;

If I could give zero stars, I would. The bathroom and shower facilities at Scott Hall Leisure Centre are hands down some of the filthiest I‚Äôve ever seen in a public building. The smell hits you before you even walk through the door ‚Äì like a mixture of damp, mold, and sewage that‚Äôs been left to fester for weeks.

The showers are caked in grime, with tiles that look like they haven‚Äôt seen proper cleaning in months. Mold is visibly growing in the corners, the drains are clogged and overflowing, and the water pressure is laughably poor. You leave feeling dirtier than when you went in.

The toilets are just as bad ‚Äì broken seats, tissue scattered across the floor, and sinks that are either blocked or covered in some mystery residue. It‚Äôs clear no one is checking or maintaining these facilities regularly. For a leisure centre that charges membership fees, the state of the hygiene here is an absolute disgrace.

I honestly wouldn‚Äôt recommend using the bathrooms or showers here unless you want to risk catching something. Until management decides to take hygiene seriously, I‚Äôd advise anyone considering this place to look elsewhere.
showerReviews.author: Global

showerReviews.reviewText: We had our swimming assessment,  instructor very ignoring not friendly at all, when my 7 yrs old and 5 yrs old daughter entered, we heard an instructor to be shouting at the children by not doing something right.. my 7 yrs old since then refusing to change facilities,  we just moved opposite to the centre which would helped us, also the receptionist was very rude. When I asked some help her answer was you can do that online.... thanks but then why to have receptionist for?? For me customer service means more than anything,  so we will continue to travel to our old place where staff is 10/10, hot water and clean environment.

locations.address: ÓÉàQuarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
An affordable centre for swimming with good facilities. The only issue is the lack of management of the people that book lane swimming.
Half of the people attending can barely swim or swim way too fast in the slow lane, making it difficult for others to maintain a steady pace. Others swim half a length and then stand in the middle of the pool trying to catch their breath, essentially becoming a human obstacle fir everyone to swim around. As well as this, there are others who just sit chatting in the shallow end, creating another awkward obstacle.
It would be nice if lifeguards or other staff members could try to manage these issues to make it a nice experience for those trying to swim.
showerReviews.author: Oli Sprange

showerReviews.reviewText:
I could not recommend this gym highly enough. I‚Äôve been a member now for nearly a year and initially signed up with some trepidation. As someone who is relatively unfit and plus size joining a new gym can be daunting. I‚Äôm very grateful to say I‚Äôve  once been  pressured into signing up for PT (which has been an uncomfortable occurrence in past gyms) nor once been made to feel uncomfortable or out of place by either the staff or fellow facility users.

The gym, changing rooms, pool and showers are spotlessly clean and well maintained and organised. There‚Äôs always a friendly face or someone willing to help or answer any questions. I‚Äôve recently started attending some of the classes which I‚Äôve not been brave enough to do in other gyms: water aerobics, Pilates and today my first kettle bells class. Each class allows for a beginner friendly option and the instructors have been so supportive and encouraging. I‚Äôve felt confident and comfortable from the off with every activity I‚Äôve engaged in here. Thanks all, you‚Äôre all doing a wonderful job!
showerReviews.author: Amanda Joy-Iaquinandi

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been attending this leisure centre for over a year now, and I‚Äôm really disappointed that the same issues still haven‚Äôt been fixed ‚Äî especially this out-of-order hairdryer. It‚Äôs been broken for months (if not longer), and even now that it‚Äôs winter, nothing has been done about it.
It‚Äôs frustrating for regular swimmers and students who rely on basic facilities like this after sessions, especially when it‚Äôs cold. It gives the impression that the centre is more interested in making as much money as possible while spending the least they can on maintenance and customer care.
After a year of the same problem, it‚Äôs clear that customer comfort and health aren‚Äôt being prioritised. Really disappointing from a place run by the council that should be looking after the community.
showerReviews.author: karzan rahman

showerReviews.reviewText: Absolutely horrific, left traumatized‚Ä¶‚Ä¶as a young child I used to enjoy swimming here, innocent, pure, and carefree, until‚Ä¶.about four months ago. Enjoying my leisurely swim, briskly in the water I discovered small floating particles enveloping my goggles, slowly raising my head above the surface I glanced at small human vacating the area, I thought to myself, why were the little beings leaving the pool and what was I being left there, treading water, befuzzled in particles, to my disgust, the child needed to relieve itself in the very water I was swimming in, went home that day, still shock, convincing myself I was making it up, maybe it was just dirt, but all that hope left me when I woke up the next morning with pink eye. That whole experience has left me never want to step into that center again. I don‚Äôt recommend, but everything else other than the tank of terror is good :) never ever swim after a baby session unless you want to live with flashbacks and nightmares. Tennis courts are good üëçüòù
showerReviews.author: Thea

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently visited the local swimming leisure centre and had an overall enjoyable experience.

The staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating, making the visit pleasant from the start. The centre offers a variety of activities suitable for all ages, ensuring that everyone can find something fun to do.

The large pool was particularly impressive‚Äîspacious and well-maintained, providing ample room for swimming and relaxing. However, I did find the small pool to be a bit disappointing. It was colder than expected and not as clean as it could be, which detracted slightly from the overall experience.

Despite this minor setback, the centre's positive aspects far outweighed the negatives. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and friendly place to swim.
showerReviews.author: Sophie Clark

locations.title: John Smeaton Leisure Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàSmeaton Approach, Barwick Rd, Leeds LS15 8TA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time for a swim today.  The centre seemed clean and tge reception lady was helpfull.  Unfortunately the male changing area, toilets and shared changing areas were disgusting with an overwhelming smell of urine which I'm sure was trailed over the floors.   I nearly didn't swim but decided to try the pool.  The pool seemed OK but I could see people walking on this floor straight into the pool.   I decided not to shower post swim and showered at home.  Put all my clothes in washer and even disinfected my footware.
I advised reception staff and they said they would investigate.  I think it is just years of use.
Leeds council- this centre need a serious deep clean or alternatively a full renovation of the changing areas.
I will not be using this centre again.
showerReviews.author: Mark

showerReviews.reviewText:
My daughter and I was attending the centre to use the pool 19/7/25. Unfortunately, the wait in the queue was nearly 20 minutes, as there was only one person on the desk. The queue  stretched out the doors & slightly round the corner, & it was bucketing it down. Aside from that, we had a great time. We were in for about 14:30pm for an hour. There was a member of staff in the changing room, a very kind lady who gave us a coin for the lockers, she was very kind to my daughter & quite welcoming.

A kind attitude & good mannerisms go a long way, so we were grateful.  Will looking forwards to returning.
showerReviews.author: P Gibbs

showerReviews.reviewText:
My daughter and I was attending the centre to use the pool 19/7/25. Unfortunately, the wait in the queue was nearly 20 minutes, as there was only one person on the desk. The queue  stretched out the doors & slightly round the corner, & it was bucketing it down. Aside from that, we had a great time. We were in for about 14:30pm for an hour. There was a member of staff in the changing room, a very kind lady who gave us a coin for the lockers, she was very kind to my daughter & quite welcoming.

A kind attitude & good mannerisms go a long way, so we were grateful.  Will looking forwards to returning.
showerReviews.author: P Gibbs

showerReviews.reviewText:
Easy to access leisure centre with its own car parking.
A wide variety of gym equipment and facilities are available.
There are outdoor pitches and indoor courts. There is also a swimming pool.
The staff are very helpful and the prices are reasonable.
A couple of vending machines and a small table in the entrance area are available, but I am certain a cafe would be welcomed by the leisure centre's users and those who are waiting for them.
The facilities are clean and modern, but some improvements could be made.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Brilliant for playing Badminton. Great court's and lighting.

The only thing that lets this place down is the changing room.
Each week I have to rinse the floor in the shower. The shower heads have never been looked at, even when I reported that there's more water spraying the wall rather than me.
At one point there was mud on the wall and it was there over 3 weeks, until I reported it to reception. The receptionist came to have a look and that's when I showed him the shower head.
6 weeks later the shower still leaks and the cleaner still doesn't clean properly but it is better.
showerReviews.author: Lisa Lambert

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good: little cafe, decent but small gym, everything quite new and clean.
Bad: Do NOT go if you are a serious swimmer‚Ä¶ only four lanes, no 5m marker for backstrokers, clock is barely visible, fast lane filled with people who‚Ä¶ aren‚Äôt that fast, let‚Äôs say. No communal changing so you either have to lock all your stuff up while you shower (faff) or leave it unattended in a cubicle, only one hook and no shelf in the showers, and the water comes out scalding hot. It‚Äôs actually ridiculous how hot that water is. Then it‚Äôs about a fifteen minute walk from the showers to the nearest mirror, so if you like to moisturise and comb your hair after you get out, again you‚Äôve got to lock up your stuff, leave it unattended, or wait until you‚Äôre on your way out. Finally the lockers are just not big enough. I have to put my bag in sideways üòÇ

It‚Äôs a shame as this is my local centre and it has loads of potential‚Ä¶ just these little things make it a bad place to swim.
showerReviews.author: Bobby

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very pleasant staff that I spoke to. The whole place appears clean and tidy.
The pool was nice and warm and the changing areas appear to have underfloor heating, which is great when you get out of the pool. The showers were also a good temperature, and lasted a reasonable amount of time.
Plenty staff cleaning the locker area, regularly.
I believe the car park was free for 3 hours.
As of February 25, they're taking cash, which is a big bonus, as I'd much rather pay cash. Most leisure centres around here have gone cashless.
I'll define going back here, even though it's not the closest leisure centre to me.
I assume this is run by Leeds City Council - Great job! Miles better than any of the Kirklees facilities.
showerReviews.author: Ewok Tribesman

locations.title: John Charles Centre for Sport
locations.address: ÓÉàMiddleton Grove, Belle Isle, Leeds LS11 5DJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
First Swimming session at this location... All I can say is that it wasn't a pleasant one.

Issue 1 -
There was a strong, unpleasant smell in the changing rooms as if there was a backlog in the toilet.

Issue 2 -
The layout of the changing facilities were badly designed and confusing. There is female toilets next to male changing and male toilets next to female, where is the logic in that?

There should be completely separate changing rooms/toilets for male and female or make it gender neutral with cubicles for showers and toilets.

Issue 3 -
Changing facilities do not include mirrors or sinks to use after the swim. Those who wish to do their hair and make yourself presentable before leaving only have mirrors in the main corridor. You have to go back and forth to your locker to get ready.

Issue 4 -
The showers are not a constant temperature, it runs hot and cold.

The who layout of this facility does not flow, it's a bad design.

However, all that being said, the actual pool itself is very good.
showerReviews.author: Ian Major

This is a nice place for many physical exercises and activities.
I go there regularly for playing and sport activities.
The cost for membership is quite high for external people. The EDGE needs to come up with a different plan. People really struggle to pay for its facilities and they don't use all of them. For me, the next plan should be to have a membership plan for each facility and keep adding on top of them.
They have a gym and many other facilities for example, squash, swimming, basketball, badminton, indoor football, cricket, climbing etc. booking required for any of these ones.
They also gave a nice place for socializing and if you wish to sit and chit chat.
Parking is a big issue! And it is paid. Although, it is a big parking area, it is also used by Leeds University people and hence super busy all the time and hard to find a parking space. Because of the parking cost, it makes the visit even more expensive for external visitors. Other than that, it has wheelchair accessibility. 6 electric cars charging socket and all functioning. If you are lucky you might find one of them free.
People are nice and friendly. They do have gym or swimming trainers as well.
showerReviews.author: Jasse Parker

showerReviews.reviewText:
The reception staff at the Edge are always very good, welcoming and helpful.
However on a different note after swimming yesterday morning for the 7:30 am session (7/9/25), and experiencing the revised lane set out it was a very dissatisfying lane swim.  The 7:30 - 8:30 am Saturday and Sunday swims are supposed to be a lane swim with lanes to segregate swimmers of different abilities.  However the removal of 3 lane ropes renders most of the pool as a free for all.  And when the students come back and the pool gets busier then lane swimming will be a waste of time.  And bearing in mind some very fast swimmers use these sessions there could be some very bad collisions.  And to make matters worse, the already limited 1 hour swim (and that‚Äôs when swimmers are allowed in on time), has now being been shaved to 55 minutes, which is to enable the children‚Äôs swimming lessons to start earlier, bearing in mind these swimming lessons go on for several hours.  Another annoying aspect, particularly with the Saturday swim is that the end lane during the 1 adult swim is hired out for private lane hire / swimming lessons, mainly for young children, often just 1 child in the end lane, which happens to be the widest lane in the pool.  So pool space is already limited for the relatively time limited adult swim as it is.  All I can say is that management should seriously consider installing all the lane ropes again, reinstating it as a 1 hour session, with the pool roller shutter door open on time and incorporating the private lane hire into the children‚Äôs swimming lessons program.  Ideally the adult 1 hour swim should be extended to 90 mins, with a 7 am start time.
showerReviews.author: MATTHEW WHITE

showerReviews.reviewText:
What an utter farce this facility (pool) has become!
I have to question if the people making the decisions regarding the operation of the pool have spent a significant enough period on deck to make the ludicrous choices we as paying consumers are having to deal with?!

Why you ask.......
(Relates particularly to the 0730-0830 Saturday and Sunday sessions).

A period of time where you would wonder if the Full compliment of staff would arrive on time to open the pool!

Numerous pool system failures meaning the pool was never ready for the session to begin, but always for the lessons starting after!

Sometimes only being let in to the building barely minutes before the session is due to start, so loosing time in the water you are paying for as you are still getting changed.

If you are in early enough to change, being let on poolside after the session has already started.

Extremely poor lane management (it will get worse later in this review!!!!). As slow or poor swimmers are regularly allowed to just jump in a lane doing head up breaststroke where people are swimming at incredible pace, leaving the faster swimmers to have to police.

And now we get to the really really "good" bits!

Turn up to Sunday session and thr pool that is usually 1.2m deep in the shallow end is now 0.9m. May no seem like a great issue to some, bit when you are as tall as I am it means you can't push off properly and have to severely alter  your pull to not take the skin off you fingers.

Admittedly this did seem to be resolved after speaking to staff for following weeks at the expense of 5 minutes being taken off the session for staff to raise the pool for lessons.
However no resulting % reduction in price paid or starting the session 5 minutes earlier to make up!

And now the biggest debacle of the lot - the current, what I can only hope is experiment with the lane set up to again better accommodate the set up for the lessons following the session!

Historically one double lane and the rest of the pool in standard lane set up.
Now, this ridiculous set up of 2 double lanes sometimes labeled "fast". Trust me no fast lane swimmer wants to swim in a lane like that.
But this has just caused more disruption.  People are swimming in no order in those lanes and they regularly dive out of those lanes into the singles lanes that are swimming in order and get in the way!
I have in the past 3/4 weeks I have hurt my back avoiding a slower swimmer that should never have been in the lane as they floundered on the wall as I turned. This very morning I was unable to swim at the speed I wanted due to being invaded by someone who was not in the appropriate lane. (Poor lane management again).
This stupid set up if it continues will lead to accidents if it continues and swimmers I know currently not attending turning up.
If I or those I swim with hit someone at full pace because they've jumped in the way, they will probably have to be rescued.  People in the massed lanes swimming in no order will collide and I've regularly noticed how bad it is getting. Any extra attendance pressure with only make this worse!

Clearly no attention has been paid to who swims over a significant period. People swimming at that time.on a weekend are serious swimmers, not there to mess around and want proper lanes, not what is currently in place.

Since returning from covid, prices have risen, service has dropped and now to comically poor levels!.

I can say this not just as any other member of the public but a club and lane swimmer, former lifeguard and pool staff and just generally someone with common sense.
What was probably the best pool to lane swim/train in within Leeds has become, quite frankly a joke!

Maybe start listening to your customers and give us what we want, not what you think !
showerReviews.author: James Barwick

showerReviews.reviewText:
Please keep your attention at Juniors membership here. Under 16 Juniors, if you pay for your child here straight for the whole year, it comes two months cheaper as the direct debit  payment. It is only ¬£159.80 for a full year( gym, classes, and swimming included). Fantastic price. Fantastic present for your family. There are a lot of parking spaces. Monthly direct debit will be ¬£15.90 per month. It comes you save for yourself 2 MONTH FREE. Student direct debit will be ¬£20/ per month(12 x ¬£20=240. But straight for the all year payment will be only ¬£200( gym, classes and swimming).
Strongly recommend to look over this agreement. Unbelievable service, big building, cafe, and tables area for parents where you can use your laptop. You are really welcome. For more information, call them on a landline. Very good coaches. 1 minute walk from tennis centre and gym.
But you really shouldn‚Äôt go to the bar here ‚Äî the service is terrible and the sandwiches are awful. This caf√© is at the main entrance to the water park.

locations.title: Nuffield Health Leeds Fitness & Wellbeing Gym
locations.address: ÓÉàUnit 21, The Light, The Headrow, Leeds LS1 8TL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Here‚Äôs a polished version of your Google review. It keeps your original points but improves flow, grammar, and impact while maintaining an authentic personal tone:

---

Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ (1 star)
I visited Nuffield Health Gym in Leeds yesterday using a guest pass from my partner, who is a member, and I have to say I was not impressed.

The gym floor was uncomfortably warm as there was no air conditioning. The treadmill I used clearly showed its age‚Äîit reset itself twice during my run and even had an old-style iPod connector, which says a lot about how outdated some of the equipment is. While there were some brand new spin bikes, it seems not all machines have been upgraded.

We then went to the pool area and tried the steam room, but it had an awful, pungent smell that made it unpleasant to stay in. The sauna was also overcrowded, making it difficult to relax.

For a gym that charges ¬£65 per month, I expected far better facilities and standards. The equipment needs investment and the steam room‚Äôs hygiene urgently needs attention. I definitely wouldn‚Äôt recommend this gym and won‚Äôt be returning.
showerReviews.author: Carl Reviews

We've made so much progress, and we're especially grateful to our current instructor, Anna, for helping us get to a point where we can actually swim. The 2-to-1 lesson format is an excellent value. If you're thinking about learning to swim, I can't recommend Nuffield enough!

locations.title: The Gym Group Leeds Meanwood
locations.address: ÓÉàFormer Magnet Unit, Meanwood Rd, Leeds LS6 4AY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A huge gym with lots of equipment that was relatively quiet when I visited.

The open-plan binary changing rooms are like a 1960's bording school and are not inclusive or in-keeping with the times. Most of the men's showers were out of order.

My main gripe is that there are no wet wipes or sprays to clean the equipment with after use. Surely this is an essential element in any gym! Even before 2020, I'd never seen a gym that didn't provide wipes, and in our post-lockdown era you'd think that people might have learned a few things about basic, essential hygiene!
showerReviews.author: Daniel Grant

Management seems unfit to handle the upkeep and cleanliness of the facility. I would strongly advise avoiding this place until proper maintenance and hygiene standards are implemented.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I returned after some time off for health reasons and wow, has this place gone downhill.

- Aircon hardly works/is off
- Probably around 2/3 of the lockers are broken.
- Some machines and hand dryer broke
- Poo on the toilet seat... There has always been visible faeces in at least one toilet every time I've used them.
- Toilet roll dispenser broken in the other non poop toilet
- You have to search for free weights as they're never on the rack (I imagine this can't be helped given staffing levels)
- The place smells bad.

If you don't mind the above factors, I can tell you that if you go off peak and don't mind searching for weights, they usually have enough to go around. The cardio machines usually work. I work in healthcare and value a clean area to work out in, but if you don't mind dirty then this is an affordable option and doesn't have the children running around like The Gym on Meanwood road.

I'm going to look for a new gym however.
showerReviews.author: SJ Har

Hi,
I'm extremely happy with the ladies' section at Leedd Reagent Street Gym ‚Äî it's a great space. However, I‚Äôm quite unhappy that a male cleaner is present in the ladies‚Äô area. I specifically chose this gym because I expected privacy while changing or showering.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pros: open 24hrs, which is great for people who can't attend gym during the day, you can go anytime you want, It's quiet during late hours, toilets, showers, water protein bars, drinks and energy drinks available, if your familiar with the equipment you hardly have to wait for someone to finish depending on your workouts.
Cons: I would highly advise wearing verruca socks when using the showers also if you are barefoot lay a spare towel on the floor, if not and you can manage shower at home especially if you are training after hours.
IMPORTANT: they should have fire & emergency escape instructions front & center on the app it's self with instructions for first aid. They do have it when you walk right in before you start, so pay attention to the signs.
showerReviews.author: Jean Steward

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been a member since Oct 24, for a low-price gym the facilities are really good. It‚Äôs clean and spacious, as with any gym it does get busy early evening but there‚Äôs enough equipment to not be waiting around.
The staff are really welcoming and helpful too, shout out to Adam, Marcin and the team. I‚Äôd give it 5/5 if they fixed the EV chargers and the refreshed the lockers downstairs.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been a member for a couple of years, but lately I‚Äôm seriously considering switching gyms‚Äînot because of the facility or the staff, but because of the people.

‚Ä¢	Phone talkers on machines: Recently, I‚Äôve seen more people who chat endlessly on their phones while sitting on equipment. It‚Äôs fine to take a call, but it‚Äôs a problem when they hog the machines. One woman once sat on the leg extensions for a full 50 minutes, completely blocking my workout. This isn‚Äôt an isolated incident‚Äîit‚Äôs becoming a regular occurrence.

‚Ä¢	Creepy male behaviour: There are also men who act as if they‚Äôve never seen a woman before‚Äîstaring for long, uncomfortable stretches and even craning their necks in a way that‚Äôs just gross. Ladies, if someone makes you feel uneasy, feel free to stare back or call them out. It might stop the behavior, but it‚Äôs still unacceptable. I‚Äôm not an easily bothered woman, but these actions cross the line.

‚Ä¢	Horrible Hygiene: The overall smell in the gym has deteriorated. It should be mandatory for people to freshen up before entering a public space like this.

‚Ä¢	No Cleanup: Lastly, many people don‚Äôt bother cleaning up after using their machines, which makes the gym environment even less pleasant.

Overall, it‚Äôs frustrating to see a decline in the culture of the gym.
showerReviews.author: G V

locations.address: ÓÉàRetail Unit 6, 100 Wellington St, Leeds LS1 4LT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice little gym. Friendly greeting from the member of staff on the reception. It was my first time visiting using the Hussle pass while in the city. He happily showed me where the changing time and lockers were and explained where things were.
Fully packed with machines but got busy and more difficult to get on the machines later. I went at just after 4pm and was quiet at first but by the time I left and hour or so later all the running machines were busy and the rest of the free weights and machines were busy. Overall I'd go again as it covered all I needed but expect that it may get busy at peak times.
showerReviews.author: Joe Webb

Fantastic gym! Easy parking. The staff are really friendly and helpful. The PTs are very talented with a great variety of classes to suit all styles.

I'm a powerlifter and it has everything I need to train. 6 squat racks, 3 deadlift platforms. A variety of barbells. Lots of plates including fractional plates. The machines for accessories are fantastic and the room where I stretch is so calming. I did all my training leading up to my recent national powerlifting competition here and still managed to podium.

The changing rooms are individual rooms with toilets and showers.

All done to a high standard!

The equipment is modern & provides everything you need in a gym.
The place is very clean and requires members to clean equipment after each use.
The fitness classes are fun and gives the opportunity for socialising & making new friends.
I don't use the pool as I'm a rubbish swimmer but the pool is what you'd expect from a swimming baths. Loads of swimming slots for adult only swims.

showerReviews.reviewText: I went to the first non-clothed session and really enjoyed it. The sauna itself looks very professional and was definitely warm enough. The changing rooms are a bit more rough and ready but worked perfectly fine. There were some sliders available which was great as we forgot to bring our flipflops. Everyone inside the sauna was very respectful and Adrian who ran the reception was friendly and helpful. The cold plunge and cold showers very much worked as intended and there is a portaloo available too. Water was also provided outside the sauna for drinking and there were felt hats that could be used to stop your head getting too warm in the sauna. Given they've only just opened I'm excited to see this grow and for more to be developed for the business.
showerReviews.author: Alice

showerReviews.reviewText: I went to the first non-clothed session and really enjoyed it. The sauna itself looks very professional and was definitely warm enough. The changing rooms are a bit more rough and ready but worked perfectly fine. There were some sliders available which was great as we forgot to bring our flipflops. Everyone inside the sauna was very respectful and Adrian who ran the reception was friendly and helpful. The cold plunge and cold showers very much worked as intended and there is a portaloo available too. Water was also provided outside the sauna for drinking and there were felt hats that could be used to stop your head getting too warm in the sauna. Given they've only just opened I'm excited to see this grow and for more to be developed for the business.
showerReviews.author: Alice

showerReviews.reviewText: The attention to detail and craftsmanship of the sauna is next level, the stained glass windows provide a beautiful light level on dark nights. The same level of thought and attention can be seen with the rest of the site. The outside cold showers where a much appreciated addition to quickly cool down before heading back into the sauna. There is also a plunge pool, plenty of changing rooms and a great communal area with fire pit. Cant wait to go back

showerReviews.reviewText: I have found the whole experience underwhelming. The showers had cold water. The shower wash units were empty. I had to ask for them to filled and when I mentioned the showers being cold, the receptionist shrugged his shoulders and said nothing he can do, get used to it. This to me suggests the showers very hardly get used which in turn suggests the shower gel units haven't been filled a very long while. I did not see anyone cleaning, the whole time I was there. The play rooms were filthy with used condoms which I can only presume had been left from the previous day or earlier from the day visited. It is a shame that the big talking point throughout the reviews is about cleanliness and hygiene. I would like to visit again but thinking about the latter is putting me off for life üòï

showerReviews.reviewText:
I joined this gym a few months ago after comparing to other gyms in the local area and this was by far the best gym. It has a great variety of classes, a lovely swimming pool, sauna, steam room and cold plunge pool. The gym is fantastic with a huge variety of equipment and free weights.
A special mention goes to personal trainer Eliza. I signed up for some 1-2-1 sessions with her which proved invaluable. Her knowledge is vast and she listened to what I wanted to achieve and designed 3 programs for me to follow for upper, lower and full body strength training. I highly recommend her!
I've found all the staff friendly and the changing facilities are great. too.

I work in healthcare and have qualifications in infection control and found it truly unsanitary. I tried emailing to complain but it‚Äôs a franchise and after five days received an automated AI reply saying thank you for your interest in becoming a trainer. showerReviews.reviewText:
Used to be a good gym but really going downhill. The larger lockers in the men‚Äôs are permanently reserved, same padlocks on each locker no matter what time of day you go.
No gym rules followed at all, people working out in jeans and crocs, and at least half the people take there bags and jackets on the gym floor with them, bags everywhere!
Probably know they can get away with it cause I haven‚Äôt seen a member of staff actually there in months.
Weight area, total mess, prepare to spend half your time looking for the weights you need cause it hasn‚Äôt been organised or put back in order for months now.
In terms of classes, if you have a job, there is no chance of going to classes. Nothing at weekends except one spin class.
Locker room is so dark you can‚Äôt read the numbers on your padlock and the scales in the men‚Äôs locker room has been broken for weeks and weeks.
Really thinking about moving to a new gym

showerReviews.reviewText: I've been a member for several years because its 24hours and its close to home. But post-covid it has gone so downhill. I would never shower / sauna here because the whole place is unclean. I bring my own yoga mat because I've never once seen theirs cleaned. The women's gym is a joke - its actually insulting how uncared for it is. Damaged machines, mirrors, dirty floors. They wont let you use the studio space after 9pm on Fri/Sat - not sure why? Tonight the heating is on over the cardio equipment - its sweltering. It feels like nobody cares and that feeds down to the users who leave the place a mess too. For the ¬£ that must be coming in here I'd at least expect to see it clean :(

showerReviews.reviewText:
RECENTLY RENOVATED SUPER GYM.
This excellent gym has been open for a while, but now they've renovated it with new machines and equipment and it's a MEGA gym now!

They've done away with a Burn Studio and replaced it with an all-new Eleiko Functional Training Rig and Weightlifting Platforms. Gone are all the old cardio machines and brand new Matrix ones installed. They've also added a few new weights machines and redone the exercise studio.

The layout is generally the same, you still get nice changing rooms and saunas, but it's now much better equipped for people who like functional training.

Oh, and it's now open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week - so if you're looking for a low cost gym that you can train anytime, this is the place for you.

WARNING - on first instance, it's not immediately obvious where to park. There are free parking spaces around the gym and an overflow car-park opposite the entrance. But you have to DRIVE PAST the turn in, and turn left into the overflow building to access the covered car park. If you miss it, you have to drive around again, as it's a one way system.
showerReviews.author: Ninh Ly

showerReviews.reviewText:
Revised April 2025

The gym now has now better equipment and free weights than when originally opened, but it still could do with a few more lower weights dumbells, and the none olimpic weights  Just too many people at peak times using them.

Showers are set to warm - a little hot, and these canot be adjusted; there is only 1 cold showers, which could do with more power. Cleaners are still non-existent at certain times, including evenings these days. Thus, it can get very messy upstairs, in the changing rooms but particularly the "toilets!" Around the gym downstairs is fairly clean. Get 2 cleanners in evenings to deal with toilets! - unfortunately some people are animals I guess üòí üòÖ

Some of the equipment, when broken, may still take a while to be fixed, but overall, it is good. Clips at the cable equipment that hold bars, angled bars, etc, can go missing at times, but most are now tampered proof ones... so better! (I still bring my own in case). Good set of olympic and loose weights and platforms. And other equipment treadmills, steps, few bikes, cable machines, etc.

Finally, at peak times, it can be very busy i e. 7-9am and 6-9pm Mon to Fridays! And Sat and Sun 10-12pm.

Nevertheless, in spite of my critique, it is a fairly good gym.
showerReviews.author: Stew B

showerReviews.reviewText:
Joined here earlier this year. Literally the worst gym I have been to. The whole place is off such a weird atmosphere everywhere you go from the changing rooms, gym and pool/sauna area.

The changing rooms are horrible and certain people in there make the simple task of getting changed feel very uncomfortable as it is very small. People behaving in there like it‚Äôs a 3rd world country from coughing and spitting to throwing rubbish all over. I feel sorry for the staff that have to clean it up.

The clientele in there are not what you‚Äôd expect from a high price, premium gym. Lots of wannabe gangsters who again make it feel very uncomfortable in there. The sauna area is a joke. There‚Äôs always a class on there so even if you go during the day your relaxing sauna/ jacuzzi session will be interrupted by crying children or, the swarm of people finishing the water aerobics class that seem to take over everything and think they own the place after their class.

Gym etiquette is some of the worst I have ever seen in a gym. Again the wannabe gangster behaviour carries on up there. Lots of seedy men and good luck finding any of the weights as it seems like it is normal here to get a piece of equipment out and never put it back.

As for the parking, this is something that you will see in lots of other reviews and yes it really is that bad. They have decided to extent the Hotel and have halved the size of the car park without any warning. There was no warning of this for new members and if I had known I wouldn‚Äôt have joined. Even though I only go during the day, it is still impossible to park and like mentioned in other reviews they are actively fining people not it a correct space - their answer to this is giving members access to another car park at the other side of the industrial estate that is also close to overflowing itself which means you have to park right at the other side of it meaning a minimum 5 min walk from there to the gym. This is highly inconvenient especially at this time of year, dark nights, dodgy people around.

My regret is not having a proper look around this gym before joining. If you are reading this review DO NOT join here. They will lock you into a contract and then you are forced to drag yourself to this hell hole in fear of wasting nearly ¬£60 every month.
showerReviews.author: Mark Smith

locations.title: 360 Fit Performance Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàHolbeck Moor Rd, Holbeck, Leeds LS11 9QL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice gym with top-level equipment that‚Äôs really well maintained. The staff are always helpful if you ask, but otherwise let you get on with your training, which I appreciate.

It can get quite busy at times, especially around the cables and dumbbell area after 4-5pm. That's when the facilities themselves feel a little cramped, as I often have to squeeze past people when moving to the next machine. The green turf area is also difficult to use properly for lunges or the sled because of limited space.

If the gym ever decides to expand, I‚Äôd love to see a hack squat machine, seated leg curl, standing calf raise, machine ab crunch, and a larger area for walking lunges so at least one full set can be done without constantly turning around or navigating equipment and people in the way. While there are plenty of alternatives already, these machines are very popular and I‚Äôm sure many members would appreciate them.

A few smaller things could also be improved, some of which i seen in other reviews:

*Far too many members leave plates on equipment, dumbbells lying around, or weights mixed up on the racks. This has gotten noticeably worse over the past year as the gym has become busier. It‚Äôs disappointing to constantly have to put things away after others, and stricter enforcement of these rules would really help.

*Some rubber handles are loose, oversized, or coming off and would benefit from being cut to size or glued back on.

*Adding at least one more of the popular cable attachments (straight bar, EZ bar curl, and shoulder-width row handles) would ease waiting times.

*The toilet showers have visible mould, which could do with a proper bleach clean.

*Weekend opening times could be improved, as it would be great if the gym opened earlier in the mornings like it does on weekdays.

Overall though, it‚Äôs a great gym that I really enjoy training at, and with a few tweaks it could be even better.
showerReviews.author: A

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice gym with top-level equipment that‚Äôs really well maintained. The staff are always helpful if you ask, but otherwise let you get on with your training, which I appreciate.

It can get quite busy at times, especially around the cables and dumbbell area after 4-5pm. That's when the facilities themselves feel a little cramped, as I often have to squeeze past people when moving to the next machine. The green turf area is also difficult to use properly for lunges or the sled because of limited space.

If the gym ever decides to expand, I‚Äôd love to see a hack squat machine, seated leg curl, standing calf raise, machine ab crunch, and a larger area for walking lunges so at least one full set can be done without constantly turning around or navigating equipment and people in the way. While there are plenty of alternatives already, these machines are very popular and I‚Äôm sure many members would appreciate them.

A few smaller things could also be improved, some of which i seen in other reviews:

*Far too many members leave plates on equipment, dumbbells lying around, or weights mixed up on the racks. This has gotten noticeably worse over the past year as the gym has become busier. It‚Äôs disappointing to constantly have to put things away after others, and stricter enforcement of these rules would really help.

*Some rubber handles are loose, oversized, or coming off and would benefit from being cut to size or glued back on.

*Adding at least one more of the popular cable attachments (straight bar, EZ bar curl, and shoulder-width row handles) would ease waiting times.

*The toilet showers have visible mould, which could do with a proper bleach clean.

*Weekend opening times could be improved, as it would be great if the gym opened earlier in the mornings like it does on weekdays.

Overall though, it‚Äôs a great gym that I really enjoy training at, and with a few tweaks it could be even better.
showerReviews.author: A

locations.title: The Gym Group Leeds Headrow
locations.address: ÓÉà2 Level 3, The Core, The Headrow SU4, Leeds LS1 6JD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Gym Leeds Headrow is what you'd expect from a Budget Gym, it seems to be of a similar standard to others in it's niche & I presently train here with my PT (James of Trained By James).

A couple of simple changes need to be made to improve the Customer Experience:

1. Have someone on Duty at the Weekend.
I am getting sick of paying for my PTs time only to be disturbed EVERY SINGLE WEEK by other Members needing assistance. If there is someone on Duty they are not on the Gym Floor.. even if there is no class on.

I pay my Membership and I pay my PT for PT, I don't pay to be interrupted because there's no Gym staff available.

2. The noise levels (I'm referring to the Music) from the Studio during classes need to be lowered.
On several occasions I have been at the other side of the Gym where both I & others can hear the Music pounding away. When you can hear the music through your Headphones this does not make for a pleasant environment.

The Showers are frequently cool with poor water pressure and often there are empty bottles laying around the changing area.
showerReviews.author: Jon Richelieu-Booth

I highly recommend this gym :)

showerReviews.reviewText:
Food is spot on as it always has been every time I've visited, lovely lady in the cafe is always willing to accommodate, even when I'm running in late with 2 minutes left on my clock!
Cafe open till 9, last orders at 8:30pm.
24hr person in the cabin, always a cheery welcome, you get what you give in terms of friendliness!
Showers are hot, need to ask for the key.
Toilets are alright, make sure you cough or something if you're taking a dump or someone will turn the light off! üòÇ

Train runs past every hour but only the one for a minute or so, could do with tarmac road as is gravel/ mud currently and winter/ wet months gets messy.
Otherwise a good place to stop in my opinion and will return!

showerReviews.reviewText: I didn‚Äôt stay in one of their rooms, just stopped off for a 45 minute break, went to the counter, validated my token and was asked if I‚Äôd like to shower or use the toilets and was directed to where I needed to go. Facilities and supplies are plentiful and staff were not only very polite and friendly, but also falling over themselves to help with whatever I asked. Food looked and smelled amazing (I was gutted to be completely devoid of any sort of an appetite during my visit) and was very reasonably priced indeed. I cannot believe that in 4 years of truck driving I‚Äôve never been here before - I‚Äôll definitely be making an effort to stop here again! Can‚Äôt recommend it enough.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Excellent Breakfast at Stokyard

I had a wonderful experience at this restaurant, where I enjoyed one of the best breakfasts ‚Äì the "Stokyard Breakfast." Everything was perfectly cooked and very tasty. I opted for toast and requested no black pudding or milk in my tea, and the staff followed my preferences exactly.

The restaurant also has a bar, but customers should be mindful of the hours, as it is not open all day. I've attached some photos of the restaurant and bar schedule to help plan your visit. The hours are a bit limited, so make sure to check before coming.

For truck drivers, there‚Äôs also a ¬£5 voucher available, which is a nice bonus.

I was also very impressed with the facilities. The showers were hot and extremely clean, as were the toilets.

I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a delicious breakfast and clean facilities, especially if you're just passing through!
showerReviews.author: CƒÉtƒÉlin Anghel

showerReviews.reviewText:

Truckpark - Pretty damned good, except for the broken barriers but things like that happen.
Facilities - Generally pretty good, toilets could use a bit more cleaning overnight but otherwise on a par with most decent Truckstops. Has a gym for drivers (terrifying!!!!)
Bosses - Money grabbing nasty people.

¬£25 to park for the night - no food voucher.
¬£20 spent in the shop.
¬£10 spent in subway.
Want to charge me for a shower too??? Nah thanks. There are free showers no more than an hour away in every direction.

Purely for this I‚Äôll stop elsewhere in future. If they think they can monetise personal hygiene I don‚Äôt want to deal with them.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The only reason this gets 1 star is because you can't rate it 0.
¬£39 overnight parking, the parking area is full of potholes, some 5 6/7 inches deep.
You can be blocked in if leaving early as people are allowed to park anywhere (not monitored).
The showers are a disgrace,
Nowhere to hang your clothes, no flat surfaces to put anything on, the shower has to be pressed continuously, which means you have to shower with one hand (not easy). The water temperature is at best described as tepid (no temperature control)
The drain was that full of hair and grease that the water was still 2 inches deep when I left and will probably still be there if I was to ever go back (nor a chance.
Complained to staff and told to put a review on, so here it is, but as we all know, nothing will change.
¬£4,000  a night ¬£20,000 a week, and you can't even get a shower.
These places should be shut down and directors put on jail (most people would treat an animal like this
Bet they don't respond, or if they do, it will be sorry to hear about your experience. we will look into it, or we are looking to have a  refurbishment of all facilities
Stay well clear use thier facilities and parking during the day and stay well clear at night or shower somewhere else
DISGRACEFUL
showerReviews.author: Paul Gray

showerReviews.reviewText:
The only reason this gets 1 star is because you can't rate it 0.
¬£39 overnight parking, the parking area is full of potholes, some 5 6/7 inches deep.
You can be blocked in if leaving early as people are allowed to park anywhere (not monitored).
The showers are a disgrace,
Nowhere to hang your clothes, no flat surfaces to put anything on, the shower has to be pressed continuously, which means you have to shower with one hand (not easy). The water temperature is at best described as tepid (no temperature control)
The drain was that full of hair and grease that the water was still 2 inches deep when I left and will probably still be there if I was to ever go back (nor a chance.
Complained to staff and told to put a review on, so here it is, but as we all know, nothing will change.
¬£4,000  a night ¬£20,000 a week, and you can't even get a shower.
These places should be shut down and directors put on jail (most people would treat an animal like this
Bet they don't respond, or if they do, it will be sorry to hear about your experience. we will look into it, or we are looking to have a  refurbishment of all facilities
Stay well clear use thier facilities and parking during the day and stay well clear at night or shower somewhere else
DISGRACEFUL
showerReviews.author: Paul Gray

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely amazing place. Yes it's get full fast, yes it's on a slope  in some places..... but.... food is absolutely winner 10/10

Top price (as you have a few options) is ¬£35 with ¬£12 food voucher. Other options  are for ¬£6/¬£31  and so on. ¬£ 12  feed you everything  from menu apart from fully monty grill  ¬£15.95
Food menu is massive,including  burgers,curry,kebabs,home made pizza sandwiches  and so on. Food is awesome!  Trucker next to me said they try to kill you with the size of those portions. I saw different  platters out and all was great and when ask all said amazing. So a big shout out to a kitchen staff!

All place  very clean and tidy, don't forget to take token for a shower(7min plenty enough)  shower  room with massive space and regulated temperature of water üòéüí¶üòç so in summer - winner.

Staff mostly  very friendly  and kind, one bad egg but it might  be not his day so I won't  blame or judge  his life  on that. We all had it.

If by any  chance  I will be around, even  for a sneaky 45 I will be there!

I would recommend it 100%

The mushrooms chicken was not cooked enough, I didn‚Äôt send it back because it was impossible to do anything about it after that and I didn‚Äôt want to find some ‚Äòspices‚Äô added. They couldn‚Äôt provide me the bank card receipt which I needed. And the showers are good, but they should have start/stop buton, especially for women, 7-8 minutes it is not enough, or at least it should play the sound one minute before ending, not when the water stops so we are able to rinse.

locations.title: Moto Blyth
locations.address: ÓÉàHill Top Roundabout, A1(M), A614 S81 8HG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: What can I say that hasn't already been said? Well let me start with this, there is ample room for walking your dog,  fairly large amount of undulating terrain arranged in such a way that simulates a reasonable route around half the perimeter of the services itself. Granted it's not particularly scenic but it's next to a motorway so what do you expect? The rolling hills of Scotland? Furthermore I found the inside of the service station to be exactly as I've come to expect from a services. Unfortunately nothing sets it apart from the others but that's not to say there's anything wrong with it. I had a burger king meal, someone tried to claim it as their own when the number was called out but I can't put that on the service station, the good lady had a wrap from M&S which was likely fine. I've marked the services down a star because I used the wash room and found the smell to be rather pungent, of unrine. Now this isn't uncommon I know and probably expected, I'm willing to review this later on in life when I return. But until then it's a soild 4. Which does put in it my top 10 of services in the UK (northern half) Stay say.
showerReviews.author: Ed Manley

showerReviews.reviewText: I‚Äôve been asked to elaborate on my rating and in fairness, I should have done so originally. Arriving on a wet busy Twixmas afternoon, the service station was really busy, floors wet, tables needed a clean down and the general feeling was pretty meh. That said, I can imagine on a warm summers day with more people sitting outside it may have an entirely different feeling to the place. But our visit, on this day, was just a bit meh. Long queue to get into the car park to find there were in fact lots of spaces but the layout meant people parking caused tailbacks. Three staff wearing hi vis, apparently there to assist with parking, standing doing nothing. Two on their phones, one standing with a sign stating Spaces Here but not holding it aloft meant no one could see it.  The bathrooms were wet and there were papers littered on the floor in the cubicle, with a wet seat and not in the best condition as a result. We‚Äôve all been there, and even hourly checks would have struggled to keep the cloakrooms up to scratch on a wet busy day, and ultimately, it‚Äôs down to the users to make an effort. Visited the food shop and grabbed a burger meal (dry burger and bland fries)and staff were pretty indifferent.  The service station itself provided a service but it‚Äôs a splash and dash, not one I would want to take a break at, particularly compared with others on the same south to north road trip.
showerReviews.author: Lorna W

showerReviews.reviewText: I‚Äôve been asked to elaborate on my rating and in fairness, I should have done so originally. Arriving on a wet busy Twixmas afternoon, the service station was really busy, floors wet, tables needed a clean down and the general feeling was pretty meh. That said, I can imagine on a warm summers day with more people sitting outside it may have an entirely different feeling to the place. But our visit, on this day, was just a bit meh. Long queue to get into the car park to find there were in fact lots of spaces but the layout meant people parking caused tailbacks. Three staff wearing hi vis, apparently there to assist with parking, standing doing nothing. Two on their phones, one standing with a sign stating Spaces Here but not holding it aloft meant no one could see it.  The bathrooms were wet and there were papers littered on the floor in the cubicle, with a wet seat and not in the best condition as a result. We‚Äôve all been there, and even hourly checks would have struggled to keep the cloakrooms up to scratch on a wet busy day, and ultimately, it‚Äôs down to the users to make an effort. Visited the food shop and grabbed a burger meal (dry burger and bland fries)and staff were pretty indifferent.  The service station itself provided a service but it‚Äôs a splash and dash, not one I would want to take a break at, particularly compared with others on the same south to north road trip.
showerReviews.author: Lorna W

showerReviews.reviewText: A small service station but it has a few areas to buy food. The bathrooms were extremely clean with the rest of the areas. When I was washing my hands I saw a staff member to say thank you for the cleanliness but when I'd finished the lady had moved and I couldn't find her. The staff that we saw were all very friendly. The staff in Greggs worked tightly as a team with every customer been served quickly and got breakfast sandwiches handed out quickly (the sandwich fillings were lovely and hot.) Lots of electric charging points. We will definitely use this service station again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had a pleasant stay at the Art Hostel in Leeds. The bed was a bit too hard for my comfort, which affected my sleep, but I appreciated that my bed was made and ready for me upon arrival. The hand towel in the bathroom and the number of showers available were great. However, I do think the cleanliness could be improved‚Äîparticularly with the bedsheets and the fridge, which could use more regular cleaning.
The kitchen was spacious, well-equipped, and offered a good selection of tools and supplies. The staff at the reception were friendly and helpful, providing clear instructions during check-in. I really liked the art concept at the hostel‚Äîit gives the place a unique and creative vibe. With a few tweaks in cleanliness and upkeep, the overall experience could be even better and more welcoming.
I‚Äôd definitely consider staying again!

locations.title: Russell Scott Backpackers - Leeds
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Lisbon Square, Leeds LS1 2LY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
DO NOT STAY
Where do I even begin

My two friends (male) and I (female) booked a triple room with ensuite for three nights a few months ago, and got hit with an email a few days before our stay saying that there were ‚Äúmajor maintenance works‚Äù which had impacted the whole building and we would be moved to their other property.

As a result of this we changed our booking to just one night, and as we arrived we paid for our stay and were told that check in would be at 5pm and to come back then.

We came back at 5 to see the ‚Äúroom in another property‚Äù was quite literally a part of an active construction site, with walls still not up, floors exposed concrete and plywood and our room being three beds in a room with no curtains, carpet or anything besides three single beds with dirty and torn sheets which were covered in dust from the construction.

The bathrooms were still not complete upstairs- and most definitely not the ensuite room we booked. But it was too late to cancel as we had to leave for an event.

The manager showed us the kitchen- where the sink was full of dirty dishes and three couches were piled in covered in dust- opened the fridge to show us a bottle of milk and some cereal and assured us ‚Äúyou wouldn‚Äôt get anything like this in another hostel!‚Äù.

The place being an active construction site was not my main concern though, the manager also lives at the hostel and was quite off putting, attempting to get me to see the room without my friends when we first arrived, and as my friends insisted they came with he abandoned the idea

Every room had an (easy to guess) four digit pin that he knew, and to our delight he was sleeping in pretty much a closet at the end of the hallway as we left for our evening.

We came back from the event to the building pitch black, scary in itself and even scarier to go upstairs and try to use the bathroom in the middle of the night and see the manager loitering in the showers and not acknowledging us walking past.

We went to sleep and slept terribly due to the trucks going in and out and construction ensuing at 6am the next morning, the dust making us cough all night as well as the light coming through the window from having no curtains.

I KNOW! We should have found somewhere else to stay as soon as we saw the state of things but honestly- lesson learned for next time.

In absolute shock of the unprofessional experience we had as we leave today. I wouldn‚Äôt stay there again even if they were paying me.
showerReviews.author: Ella Avni

One girl came to warn me I should be careful because he had followed her into the bathroom when she got up to use it in the middle of the night.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great place, very basic I didn't mind that as it was for one night and didn't need anything more, had to share toilets and shower but they have locks on doors. They also provided hot drinks you make yourself. Toaster and cereals if needed. Just needed to wash up if you used.
Owner/manger was friendly and helpful. Overall I was very impressed. Our room didn't have TV but that didn't worry me as most of the time I be on my phone, you can have WiFi if you wanted. (only thing I would say is that it could be noisy if all the rooms on the same floor as you occupied)

showerReviews.author: R B

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed just before Christmas for two nights. There were apparently only three people staying in the hostel, and I was put in a room with another girl. It was the front room, right by the street and we could hear everything going on outside in quite a rough part of town.

Manager was nice while checking in, but when I came up for breakfast in the morning he came out of the shower room in just a towel, so I felt uncomfortable. To be fair to him, I was quiet coming up and he did apologise profusely after ducking back in to get changed. He did also let two people sleep on the sofa's in reception.

Shower rooms are freezing as you can't close the windows. There was a door to the back of the house that was the main entry and exit point which was only secured by a four digit pin, which felt quite unsafe as its told to anyone who checks in. You do get a card for a discount at a local pub which was good.  Sheets were itchy - I slept in a sleeping bag with a coat over me.

Place is easy to find, and quite a short walk from the station and city centre. There was a quite nice park nearby, as well as good resteraunts and pubs, but I felt quite unsafe being out past 7pm and didn't drink at all.

Overall quite good value, but some weird experiences and odd fixtures make it a bit uncomfortable.
showerReviews.author: Azar Nichol

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed just before Christmas for two nights. There were apparently only three people staying in the hostel, and I was put in a room with another girl. It was the front room, right by the street and we could hear everything going on outside in quite a rough part of town.

Manager was nice while checking in, but when I came up for breakfast in the morning he came out of the shower room in just a towel, so I felt uncomfortable. To be fair to him, I was quiet coming up and he did apologise profusely after ducking back in to get changed. He did also let two people sleep on the sofa's in reception.

Shower rooms are freezing as you can't close the windows. There was a door to the back of the house that was the main entry and exit point which was only secured by a four digit pin, which felt quite unsafe as its told to anyone who checks in. You do get a card for a discount at a local pub which was good.  Sheets were itchy - I slept in a sleeping bag with a coat over me.

Place is easy to find, and quite a short walk from the station and city centre. There was a quite nice park nearby, as well as good resteraunts and pubs, but I felt quite unsafe being out past 7pm and didn't drink at all.

Overall quite good value, but some weird experiences and odd fixtures make it a bit uncomfortable.
showerReviews.author: Azar Nichol

showerReviews.reviewText: For to start, don't had a recepcionist. After to do my booking and in the time for to go to the place (is difficult to call the place as a hotel) I received a SMS about the number of my room. Was the room 1... And was horrible, because is close to the door entrance to the place, close to the area for to use the microwave and other things. In the SMS I received the number to my room, the information about the self check in and the number of the safe that was the key to the front door and the room. If have Internet... Wi-Fi... Ok... But I don't received the password so I had to use my mobile data, which didn't help me much. The mat in front of the shower was damp and without a good smell. Bath towels were not completely dry. The room heater didn't work and the same as the heater for the towels. And around midnight, all the sockets in the room stopped working. I usually sleep late and so, to my surprise and sadness, I had to put my cell phone and laptop to charge where the microwave is. My room was number 1... Right in front of the area where the microwave is and until around 11 pm, I heard a lot of noise coming from that area. The cleanliness of the room was reasonable and when my key fell on the floor... When I lifted the mattress I realized that they hadn't cleaned under the bed in weeks. Deplorable. First and last time I went to this place, they should lower the price per night because it's not worth it. I come to Leeds twice a month to meet my girlfriend, who lives in a place that can't accommodate me, and so I stay in a hotel. I don't recommend this place to anyone! I add the picture to my cellphone and laptop charging close to the microwave and the TV... That without to work the energy sockets... Was off.
showerReviews.author: Flavio Martins Costa

locations.title: The Bells Leeds
locations.address: ÓÉà6 Church Row, Leeds LS2 7HD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed at Big Ben at The Bells for my wife‚Äôs birthday in November and were absolutely blown away from the moment we arrived. It genuinely exceeded every expectation and the photos don‚Äôt come close to showing how stunning it really is.

Both bedrooms were beautiful, each with its own en-suite shower room, and the whole apartment was so nice that it made it hard to leave for our day in Leeds. Thankfully, the city-centre location meant we could pop out for a few drinks and food, then head back to the apartment.

We‚Äôre already looking for the next special occasion to return. If you‚Äôre thinking about booking, just do it! You won‚Äôt regret it. Watching a spooky church yard and the leeds skyline from your hottub is a great experience!
showerReviews.author: Jonathan Derbyshire

locations.title: Blenheim Point
locations.address: ÓÉàBlenheim Walk, Woodhouse, Leeds LS2 9BU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
It‚Äôs a 7 stories accommodation (0-6). They have a lift.

The flat is clean and new. No electrical or wifi problems. (Edit: wifi is the same network as the uni‚Äôs. It gets fixed sometimes.)

Walls protect noise within rooms pretty well! (Edit: if someone shout, u‚Äôll hear it) We cannot hear each other when we‚Äôre in our private rooms at all. (Unless someone talks on the corridor which doesn‚Äôt happen very often).

It‚Äôs got plenty of outlets under desk as well as bed area, so you won‚Äôt need any extension.

There‚Äôs storage underbed which is enough for two big luggages.

Lighting condition is ok. You may need a small table light on the desk.

Distance from UoL is brilliant! (~7 mins to Parkinson building)

Washing machine, dryer and a vacuum cleaner are free in the kitchen. The staffs are friendly (especially Luke).

Building safety is on standard level, they test fire alarm weekly and doors are fire resistant.

The common area isn‚Äôt big and there‚Äôs not much facilities to socialise but that‚Äôs reasonable compared to the price.

The only thing is two fridges aren‚Äôt enough for 8 people to share. However, each flat is different.
showerReviews.author: Babab Studio

Plenty of good pubs and restaurants nearby too.

Google will be your friend!

Well worth a visit!

Good points
Well kept
Clean facilities
Washing up room with fridge and freezer
Free WiFi
Hot showers
Friendly staff
Self check in
Site has security barrier
Good views

Bad points
Toilet block not heated (Not nice November)
Pitches are small (be aware) ¬£25 per night Hook up charge ¬£10 per night
Pitches very close together
Charges for having a dog  ¬£2per night
Charges for awning  ¬£5 per night
Under flight path to Leeds Bradford  (quiet at night)
Next to busy road (quiet at night)

Overall we had a pleasant stay at Clarion, we both agreed that it‚Äôs a little too expensive compared to other site offerings. If you compare it with say a camper/caravan club site.  Expensive for a out of season stay

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked this as we were doing the Emmerdale tour and this was fairly local (approximately 9 miles away). Arrival was hassle free and automated. There is a map of the site at the barrier and your name is by your pitch, simples. We had electric hook up for the camper so that was great. It was peaceful and the view was lovely. Yes, you are on a flight path for Leeds airport (I had seen this on a different review) it‚Äôs not constant seemed quite sporadic and to be honest having grown up on the Manchester airport flight path this didn‚Äôt bother me too much. The site faces south west-ish so if the weather is good then sunsets could be amazing. Ours was 50/50 due to cloud.
Facilities onsite were great. We haven‚Äôt camped much but the wash station was one of the best we have encountered. It‚Äôs in a nice summerhouse type wooden building with two sinks and complementary dish cloths if you‚Äôve forgotten your own. A fridge freezer for campers to use too. Great for the beverages and to replenish the essential ice blocks. The ablutions were exceptionally clean. The men‚Äôs had two urinals, two pans, a shower plus two sinks and a shaver point. From what I can gather the ladies had two pans and a shower with three sinks. Everything was clean and tidy.
Overall very happy with our stay and would definitely consider this site if we were to visit anywhere else in that part of the county.
showerReviews.author: William Flitcroft

showerReviews.reviewText:
Myself, 2 Leaders and 12 Scouts Travelled to Leeds for a camp. We stayed here and couldn‚Äôt have asked for anything more from a site.
We stayed in the lodge. 12 Bunks in the main Hall. 3 separate bedrooms each with bunks and an additional ‚ÄúLeader Lounge‚Äù with some comfortable chairs to debrief each night.

The kitchen was spacious with a large fridge freezer. All utensils we needed and storage space.

There is an additional area you can ask for that is a Grill area with a BBQ and plenty of seating. I would love for our local site in Hertfordshire to have a area like this.

There is a single toilet in the building for night use.

Toilet blocks are perfect for our scouts with cubicles and a separate shower area . There‚Äôs also separate Shower block for leaders.

The actual site was massive with 3 separate large fields for wide games and a very good campfire Circle.

CCTV on site that covers the car park

We used the bus Stop just down the road 5/10min walk and caught the A Flyers to the Airport and by the time you arrive there is separate A Flyer Bus that goes into Leeds City Centre.

In all honesty the buses were the only part of the whole trip we had an issue with to any group should keep an eye on the trackers.

We will 1000% be returning to this site on our rotation.
showerReviews.author: Billy Clarkson

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely setting with well-kept grounds and great entertainment watching the football and cricket games on site. Site management were friendly and helpful, on arrival. Unfortunately, the facilities really need an upgrade and more frequent cleaning; rubbish in the shower block hasn‚Äôt moved in days. Quiet hours from 10 pm aren‚Äôt enforced and we were kept awake late, by noisy neighbours. Although advertised as dog-friendly, dogs are restricted and not allowed on the fields if matches are due on in the day, which makes exercising them stressful. A shame, as the location is fantastic and it could be a brilliant site with better management.

Lovely site, near Esholt village, which is beautiful and has the famous Woolpack pub with good food, and a village shop, although it was closed when we got there on Sunday.
The toilet and shower block is going to be completely renewed by the new owner this winter, which will be welcome, as it is currently shared by the sports club and in need of upgrading, although it was clean and perfectly usable.
As yet there is no grey water disposal point but the camper van WC empty point is good.
The new owner was friendly and helpful and we look forward to staying there again and benefitting from his renovations.

showerReviews.reviewText: Delightful little site with lovely owners. Strict rules but purely for the benefit of campers. Excellent showers and toilets with generous pitches. Ducks, geese, turkeys, bantams, chickens and guineafowl running free. It‚Äôs up high with no protection from the wind so ensure you have the necessary storm guys etc if under canvas or with awning. Good dog walking with easy access to the moors. Added benefit is the small attached cafe that will deliver to your pitch if you wish.
showerReviews.author: Nigel Bachmann

showerReviews.reviewText: Little cl site on a small-holding farm. Owners are lovely, and they do a fab cooked breakfast from the onsite cafe. Beautiful views across the valley. Can't fault it. 2 toilets and showers in a little barn, could be described as "rustic" but clean and does the job. Will go again when in the area again.
showerReviews.author: Julie Woods

showerReviews.reviewText: Little cl site on a small-holding farm. Owners are lovely, and they do a fab cooked breakfast from the onsite cafe. Beautiful views across the valley. Can't fault it. 2 toilets and showers in a little barn, could be described as "rustic" but clean and does the job. Will go again when in the area again.

showerReviews.reviewText: If you want a really peaceful and tranquil site,look no further, right on the moors, loads of walks, a mile and a half from Guiseley,cafe on site,dog friendly ( must be on a lead at all times ) as chickens,Turkey  and goose roam free, but don't worry they don't encroach on your stay, lovely clean toilets and showers, if your a plane spotter, this is perfect for you if the wind is blowing in the right direction as they fly over head from Leeds Bradford Airport, a couple of mile away, Sharon and Mark are more than pleasant and couldn't be more helpful, lovely seating area in the grounds to chill and read,can't praise this site enough,will definitely be going back.
showerReviews.author: Ian Hanby

showerReviews.reviewText:
I took my son to his first swimming lesson at Springs 10/09 He is just turned 5. He absolutely loved it. We managed to get a slot for straight from school which is handy as it is just up the road.

There's a room for parents to sit in and watch with vendors for tea/coffee, snacks etc.

I do feel as the lessons are only half and hour and the next class is already waiting when you collect your child it's hard to speak to instructors but I havent had chance to fully look at the app yet so maybe they update on there.

He really enjoyed it and that's the main thing for me. He cannot wait to get back. Up to now it's seems good.
showerReviews.author: Jade Hurst

Monthly fees seem really reasonable.

But I do like to gym and swim early but have to wait till lunch or evening. Other than that I love how it's not overcrowded. I can do my gym workout without feeling intimidated or waiting for equipment. It's a very small gym and a 20m pool. Perfect for me üòä
I have been to 4 gyms in the last year and this is the most comfortable I've been

locations.title: Hillsborough Leisure Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàBeulah Rd, Sheffield S6 2AN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: The first time I took my grandson there, a friendly girl with long black hair greeted us at the front desk. So, the second time, I took another grandson with me. Unfortunately, the girl who greeted us before was busy. This time, we were attended to by a British woman with her hair pulled back in a high bun. She told us there were no spots available and we would have to wait for 2 hours. I went inside to check the swimming pool and it wasn't as full as she claimed. When I came back and asked the nice girl from before if she could help, she said she would take a look. However, the British woman heard this and immediately stopped her, saying, "I've already told them there are no spots." The girl was so scared that she didn't dare to help me anymore. Goodness! Who does she think she is? It's just a regular job, but she's treating her front desk customer service position as if it's a tool to make things difficult for customers, as if she has some kind of authority. It's ridiculous.
showerReviews.author: Bing O'Toole

showerReviews.reviewText:
The swimming pools are set out good for the children, however, having to witness floating poop in the baby pool was disgusting, I reported it to the safe guards and they never got the children out of the pool to check PROPERLY, they were trying to look for it whilst kids were left playing, which I think is appalling. I felt like I was being made out a liar, as the replies I saw was ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt see anything‚Äù which is silly to say, you was looking whilst people were in the pool when i reported seeing it! When everyone should‚Äôve been told to get straight out asap, but no. Vile.
We won‚Äôt be coming here again, due to this lack of unbothered attitude. Lovely receptionists though.

locations.title: Ponds Forge International Sports Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàPonds Forge, International Sports Centre, Sheaf St, Sheffield City Centre, Sheffield S1 2BP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Friendly staff but terribly managed, if you are here for gym and swimming, don‚Äôt bother, for 40 pound a month you get your money worth elsewhere. There are about 6-7 machines with OUT OF ORDER stickers for weeks and months and they seem like not bothering to fix them, just leave stickers on and hoping everything will be alright, you would think for a medium sized gym they will take care of the equipment and get them repaired asap, the cardio machines are poorly maintained and makes squeaky sound, the hand sanitizer boxes were empty 90% of the time. When I started my membership few month ago I was told that we get a locker key to keep and it only took 2 months to arrive, which meant that every time before you started working out, there were massive queuing in the reception area takes up at least 10 minutes of your time to get a temporary key. The swimming pool closes constantly, it disrupts your training plan before you almost form your own work out routine. I would give 1 star if weren‚Äôt for the friendly staff. Avoid at all costs.
showerReviews.author: Snow Ellow
