showerReviews.reviewText:
If you don‚Äôt mind a sport centre with a supervisor receptionist who will shout at you, go to Ponds Forge.

This mid age female receptionist with red hair and glasses, she was so aggressive to costumers, her attitude is absolutely not acceptable. She questioned me in a surprisingly loud voice and made me so upset. When I said I would cancel the membership because of her, she was like ‚ÄúTHAT‚ÄôS FINE‚Äù and couldn‚Äôt care less. This staff is the supervisor of the reception, now you can imagine how terrible the team is!

This is not the first I have been disappointed by this place. From the booking system which is unbelievably difficult to use, to the enquiries that no one cares and responses. Their higher office, the so called management team, literally has no management skills.

Not even mention the ‚Äúrefer a friend and get one month free membership‚Äù thing. It was totally fake. You had to ‚Äúrefer‚Äù a friend and wait till someone contact you and start a membership for you, but actually no one will contact your friend ever, so your referral would never be successful. How interesting is it!

Not only that, they always change the rules without notifying people and they don‚Äôt see people equally! They don‚Äôt allow people who have swimming MEMBERSHIP to use the MEMBERSHIP changing room. That makes no sense. They set this nonsense rule this morning, no email, no notification, no explanation, just suddenly applied. I was told I couldn‚Äôt use the changing room I always use before as one of the members. If you ask them what time the rule was set, they say ‚Äúthe other day‚Äù, what an answer!

Plus if you decide to buy the membership, be careful! You will have to pay ‚Äúthe last month fee‚Äù at the very first. I had terrible experience today so I wanted to cancel my membership, but I‚Äôve been told my membership will have to finish on the end of December. If not, my ‚Äúlast month membership‚Äù fee will not be refunded. What a two month notice period!

The only positive thing about this venue is the competition pool, although the 50m lane swim has been stopped for a long time. I have been swimming here for 7 months and have encountered so many problems. I've tolerated enough, I simply can't take it anymore.

AVOID!
showerReviews.author: RUIQI HUANG

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely shambolic!! The online or app booking systems are incredibly difficult to use. I downloaded the app, expecting to be able to book a Pilates or yoga class. What a joke!
The designer of the app should consider making it easier to use. Too much messing about.
I downloaded it thinking it would be only exclusive to Sheffield but no, all council run gyms in England are listed. When I selected Sheffield I was instructed to download another app!!

Don‚Äôt get me started about the cafe area!! How can any eatery be filthy first thing in the morning? I went to use it around 9am. The tables were very dirty, crumbs, sugar grains, drink stains etc.
It was obvious that the mess was from the day before. The member of staff started cleaning tables (after 9) as I left because there was no way that would eat or drink anything from there.

Management should consider wipeable plastic seats because the fabric covered ones are very badly stained with food and drink. It‚Äôs evident they are not steam cleaned regularly.
Some serious hygiene issues that day!

Even though the changing/shower area is spotless, the gym area is dirty, dusty and tired. The machines are definitely NOT state of the art either.
I‚Äôll be cancelling my membership!
showerReviews.author: Queen Majesty

showerReviews.reviewText:
The first point to note is that the majority of the positive reviews for this site are related to the centre's use as an event space for graduate ceremonies, NOT for the leisure facilities themselves.

This site should be a flagship, instead, it is a poorly shoe-string-run unhygienic shell of itself being grossly let down by inadequate management and poor investment. It is a prime example of what happens when public facilities are put into private hands. Membership cost up, service down.

For months now the lane swim schedule has been at best part time. This week for example there are no sessions Thurs-Sunday, at all. This has become standard. On the days when there are sessions, they are patchy, with gaps during the day, and often ending by 4pm. No explanation is ever given, complaints are responded to with a generic 'we're sorry you feel that way' response (as I'm sure this will be) and then ignored.

In addition to this, hygiene standards have plummeted and membership prices soared since Everyone Active took over (running the site for profit), from the charity Sheffield City Trust. The members changing rooms are mouldy and stale, with every single hair dryer broken. The showers are rarely cleaned, I've seen stains and dirt sit in the same spot on the shower block floor for weeks at a time. The yoga mats in the studio reek of stale sweat, and there is no antibacterial spray for wiping down. A loudly championed 'refurbishment' of the gym involved a rearrange, and the swapping out of broken equipment with already worn equipment shipped over from the Hillsborough site.

With respect to membership costs, the first thing that Everyone Active did on taking over the running of the site was to hike prices, and particularly spitefully, remove the discount rate for disabled people. To mark the one year anniversary of their running of the site prices have just been raised yet again without excuse or apology.

All this seems to be a common pattern with Everyone Active who appear to at least in part keep their sites profitable by slashing staff and services, particularly with the cleaning team, but I also suspect with lifeguard numbers. The current excuse in the case of Ponds Forge is that there is a problem with the leisure pool which has lead to swimming lessons being moved over to the main pool, causing cancellations. However, this is an excuse that Everyone Active have been using for months, whilst also cancelling swimming lessons, and often leaving the main pool half empty with neither taking place. At some point all physical problems become management problems.

When Sheffield City Trust ran the site, it was not perfect, but they were a charity doing their best, and the general level of service was far above what it is now. Private for-profit companies do not deserve the leniency that we give to charities. They should step up their game, communicate with their members, improve as a matter of urgency, or lose their right to run the facility.

Ponds Forge could be so much, and yet, because of poor management and investment, it grows shabbier by the day.
showerReviews.author: Danny Shaw

Ponds Forge could be so much, and yet, because of poor management and investment, it grows shabbier by the day.
showerReviews.author: Danny Shaw

locations.title: Concord Sports Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàShiregreen Ln, Sheffield S5 6AE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A really great community sports centre!

I have been ill for 10 years and during that time my mobility has become progressively
worse. Always put off swimming, but last month decided to get back into it.

Rachel and Levi were absolutely lovely. They gave me a tour of the centre and sat with me to go through my options, which was wonderful!

Everyone is SO friendly. It's a fantastic community hub where everyone says hello and has a little chat.

I only use the pool and sauna, so can't comment on the other facilities. The sauna is new and very nice.

The pool area is really good and kept clean. The only issues I have is that I dislike unisex changing rooms and the pool water is cloudy.  Plus the bottom of the pool looks like it needs a bit of a refresh.

Good prices, great people and lots going on. I highly recommend Concord sports centre if you're looking to keep fit.
showerReviews.author: Claire Robinson

locations.title: Zest Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà18 Upperthorpe, Sheffield S6 3NA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Unfortunately, me and my girlfriend had an uncomfortable experience at Zest's swimming pool today. It doesn't feel like a welcoming place if you're not part of a certain religious group. We were stared at the whole time by the other customers. We experienced homophobic comments from other women in the pool for simply being two women with short hair.

We left our swim session early as a result, wasting our money.

This feels harsh as it's not necessarily the fault of Zest themselves how their customers behave. But I advise that you should avoid if you're LGBT.

The pool was also extremely busy and unsuitable for actual swimming. It was full of people socialising or just splashing about, blocking room those who were trying to swim. This was a 16+ only session, so it wasn't even kids playing.

The changing room is also very cramped and difficult to navigate when busy. The whole place doesn't feel clean either.

It's a shame that my local pool doesn't feel welcoming to me.
showerReviews.author: Amber

showerReviews.reviewText: The swimming pool is an absolute nightmare. I‚Äôve never been to such a dirty swimming pool. It‚Äôs overcrowded with women just standing and not swimming, you cannot do laps in this pool as a lot of people just mess around. Everytime I swam I could see chunks of brown substance floating around, hair everywhere as most of the women in the session did not wear a swim cap, and other unusual substances in the pool, it looks like it‚Äôs not cleaned enough. I‚Äôve been here two times and both times the pool has been dirty despite me telling staff as such, it looks like it isn‚Äôt cleaned often. You also feel out of place and uninvited if your not a part of the community who attend often. The changing rooms are filthy, not a single cubicle is clean, I didn‚Äôt even go near the showers so can‚Äôt comment on that. I will not be going here again I hope the team can encourage regularly cleaning of the pool and for users to wear swim caps and respect pool clothing rules.

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a very nice, spacious, clean leisure centre with mostly friendly helpful staff. It just gets extremely busy with swimming lessons, I've still not been lane swimming yet due to this despite being a member for years. The gym also gets extremely busy from around 4-7pm. Due to the crowds it's difficult to find a space to park or a place to sit at certain times. I also wish they'd find a way other than fines to stop people booking up all the fitness classes 2 weeks in advance then cancelling on the day as it's not fair to other people who could actually attend the class but can't due to the people who do this.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The facilities are good and the swimming teachers are very good, but the website/app is awful and it is incredibly frustrating trying to book your kids on to classes. The app doesn‚Äôt let you move them when they‚Äôve passed a stage and tries to make you pay a new ¬£46 membership joining fee when you‚Äôre already a member and just want to put your child in a different class when they progress up a level. You then call them and the phone is rarely answered and they are slow to respond to emails.

They need to get their online system sorted out - it‚Äôs been the bane of many parents‚Äô lives for the 3 years we‚Äôve been there and they don‚Äôt seem interested in making it any easier to use.

showerReviews.reviewText: The pool temperatures are absolutely freezing. Not suitable at all for taking babies swimming as even as an adult its far too cold to swim in let alone a child. Tried to check in for swimming at reception and was told multiple times I didnt have a booking despite me showing them the confirmation email numerous times. Eventually after around 10 minutes of arguing back and forth and them trying to dismiss me, they discovered i DID actually have a booking and let us in. I wanted to bring my son swimming and had to get out more or less straight away as he was upset due to the temperature of the pool and didnt want to be in the water. He normally loves swimming. Staff are extremely unhelpful. Everybody who works there seems like they dont want to be there and are often dismissive when you try and talk to them. Facilities dont look clean either. Wouldn't recommend coming here, I'd go to Dronfield instead where its cheaper too.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Removed the Swim Pods with no warning which we had been booking in almost every week since they began. We tried the regular sessions on Saturday and purposely chose one with very few spaces booked due to one of our children not handling busy areas too well. This seemed to work until the family from the next session decided they were going to start their session a good 10-15 minutes early and take over the pool.

Generally the staff are polite and friendly and the cleanliness and condition of the pool is as expected for a local community centre. There are a few customers who mistake the changing rooms for the bins but it‚Äôs not the centres fault these tramps exist.

There‚Äôs plenty of parking for the size of the centre especially disabled. However, please bear in mind if you need a blue badged space they fill up quickly usually by non blue badge holders. In fact, on our very first visit on the new time table 2 spaces were parked on by some woman who had just had her hair greased at the local chippy and then picked up her dangerously obese daughter and grand son.
showerReviews.author: Lee Machin

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a lovely little Victorian baths. I came for a 7am swim this morning for the first time and loved it.

You need to book a slot as they get filled up pretty quickly, but I think you can pay on the day too. The pool was a lovely temperature, and not over crowded with most spaces gone. Individual changing cubicles are along each long side of the pool, keeping in keeping with the history of the building. Did read some reports of the pool area being dirty, but going for the first session of the day was very clean.

There is also a small gym on site, and by the reception area are some vending machines.

Excited to go back!

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a lovely little Victorian baths. I came for a 7am swim this morning for the first time and loved it.

You need to book a slot as they get filled up pretty quickly, but I think you can pay on the day too. The pool was a lovely temperature, and not over crowded with most spaces gone. Individual changing cubicles are along each long side of the pool, keeping in keeping with the history of the building. Did read some reports of the pool area being dirty, but going for the first session of the day was very clean.

There is also a small gym on site, and by the reception area are some vending machines.

Excited to go back!
showerReviews.author: Sarah Tadman

showerReviews.reviewText: Been coming to my kids swimmings lessons here for around 5 years. Parking has got worse especially through term times, even though it got extended. The higher up the levels your child gets they seem to have on less classes. My oldest is in level 8 and this has proven very hard as they hardly do any classes for this stage and the teacher she had at first looked like he couldn‚Äôt be bothered on his phone and was constantly just telling them to do laps. Not the best. Luckily the teacher has now been changed. Changing rooms is so full people leave their clothes in the changing blocks rather than in the lockers, so then you struggle to get changed as there‚Äôs no space. There‚Äôs no where to watch your child once they go into the big pool unless you stand around a tiny window in the changing room with 3 other people. If you manage to get a space inside when they are in the small pool it‚Äôs good, if not there‚Äôs tables behind the window but you can‚Äôt see you child as you‚Äôve just got a load of people‚Äôs backs and heads who managed to get a space sat inside. I‚Äôve been coming here for this long for the convenience that‚Äôs it‚Äôs the closest one to my home not for any other reason.
showerReviews.author: Casey Ramos-Pears

showerReviews.reviewText:
My son and I came for a swimming session on Sunday the 14th May. I had called ahead of time to check the training pool was a good temperature as my son doesn't like it too cold.
The receptionist was very helpful even telling me what degrees Celsius the pool would be.
As it was my first visit, I was given a parking permit to fill in and display in my car window. This was a lovely touch as I wasn't aware of the parking restrictions and the car park is much safer than the busy road the leisure centre is situation off.
Inside, the centre looked and smelled very clean. The toilets were fresh and well stocked with toilet paper and soap. The communal changing cubicles were spotless and very pleasant to use. There are also ample lockers of various sizes which just require a ¬£1 to lock up and keep all your belongings safe whilst you swim.
When we entered the main pool, there are showers before you enter and a balcony where you can put your towels if you prefer them by the pool for immediate access after your swim.
It was lovely to see a multitude of toys, floats and buoyancy aids in and around the teaching pool. My son took great pleasure in collecting all the toys and playing with them whilst in the pool and he said this sports centre is his favourite so far!
When we left, at least 3 team members were vigorously scrubbing down the floors, lockers and walls with soapy water and you could tell that they took pride in their leisure centre and want it looking at its best.

WELL DONE to all the team at Aston-cum-Aughton. My son and I will be back very soon, of that I have no doubt!!
showerReviews.author: Jon Warner

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been using this gym for about 2 years now. The facility itself is very good and not crowded at the time that I usually go between 10.30 am to 1 pm. Today when I went in the changing room to go and use the toilet, someone was trimming/shaving their beard just outside the toilets in the right area of the image (I usually put my water bottle there as I go to use the toilets). Now if this had been done in front of the mirror inside the toilets with the sink in front of him, I dont think I would have had any problem. However it was done just outside the toilets just on the right side (his beard trimmings where all over). I personally do not think that is ok so I asked the staff about it to which they replied that there is nothing wrong with that. Hygiene people! HYGIENE!!!
showerReviews.author: Bogdan Bratu

Good size, variety of equipments, good location and easy to access, discount on using the car park, bike parking available, free tap water with hydration station for a monthly fee, showers, toilets.
Update!
Two stars for a couple of reasons:
You can't stop auto-renew.
When you need to cancel you have to do it before 4-5 days, or you will be charged.
The cancellation process is annoying, you do it through the application and then you have to fill a form as well, even though, the membership is not cancelledyet, and you have to wait someone from their team to contact you.

locations.address: ÓÉàStation gym, Mansfield Rd, Sheffield S12 2AE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The best gym I've been to. It has a unique atmosphere where all the staff are friendly and supportive and the owner can often be seen walking around saying hi on the gym floor. He's really gone the extra mile to make this gym a community rather than just a gym.

The machines are all brand new and placed very spaciously. The gym and changing rooms are very clean and there's even a little cafe with very affordable prices.

In with your membership are loads of cool classes such as yoga and boxercise etc. and you can sit with a trainer and get a personal workout program drawn up to your needs.

If you are new to gyms and wanting a supportive friendly environment then this is the place. Veteran gym goers will also love the range of facilities, experienced staff, and nutritious cafe.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym is amazing. I love doing the Zumba and Burn sessions with the amazing personal trainers and they always turn hard work into fun times. They are incredibly supportive of your progress too ie. Teach you how to improve your fitness and stance. This gym has not only improved my confidence but have picked up alot of knowledge from the members/(pt‚Äôs)who have also been equally supportive.

The gym can get quite hot from the workouts so be sure to take a water bottle, towels and rehydrate from the wide selection of drinks from the vending machine which can add to the energy levels.

There are plenty of water fountains too located near the vending machine.

You can donate your old clothes and other bits and bobs to BHF as there is a box near the entrance and also put in your reg plate for the parking space.

There are a wide variety of classes to choose and enjoy at your convenience and machines so it never gets too busy.

The gym is cleaned on a daily regular basis and there are plenty of sprays to sanitise the machines if needed but highly recommend.

The toilets and changing rooms are spacious and clean.

This gym is amazing. I love doing the Zumba and Burn sessions with the amazing personal trainers and they always turn hard work into fun times. They are incredibly supportive of your progress too ie. Teach you how to improve your fitness and stance. This gym has not only improved my confidence but have picked up alot of knowledge from the members/(pt‚Äôs)who have also been equally supportive.

The gym can get quite hot from the workouts so be sure to take a water bottle, towels and rehydrate from the wide selection of drinks from the vending machine which can add to the energy levels.

There are plenty of water fountains too located near the vending machine.

You can donate your old clothes and other bits and bobs to BHF as there is a box near the entrance and also put in your reg plate for the parking space.

There are a wide variety of classes to choose and enjoy at your convenience and machines so it never gets too busy.

The gym is cleaned on a daily regular basis and there are plenty of sprays to sanitise the machines if needed but highly recommend.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym is a glasshouse. It‚Äôs absolutely boiling in there, you‚Äôll sweat before working out. This gym lacks fresh air and regardless of the commercial use air machines which are limited in the space they cover. They‚Äôre turned off after a certain time, apparently for air quality reasons which doesn‚Äôt justify reducing the gym memberships charges per month to increase new joiners yet the air quality is disgustingly suffocating. If you‚Äôre someone with a respiratory condition or intending to do cardio. You‚Äôll struggle to breathe, will not workout properly and will have to keep take multiple short breaks. The changing rooms are cooler than the actual gym. I‚Äôd describe the air as high humidity, after a while you can see and feel the condensation filled air settle on your skin.

- Good equipment and a lot of people come there to work out and not linger
- Machines are shared and everyone is nice and sociable. I‚Äôd recommend this gym to gym goers
- Staff are friendly and helpful

Other cons are as a lady I wouldn‚Äôt really recommend you to visit this gym without a man after 9pm there are very thirsty foreigners who don‚Äôt understand the purpose of a gym and use it to make moves or make women feel uncomfortable through their stares. When confronted they act innocent. However if you‚Äôre a woman without self respect neither pride then visit after 9 solo. Plus if you‚Äôre someone who doesn‚Äôt like the smell of BO which causes a sore throat. Regardless of showers being available I find certain persons don‚Äôt use the facilities. Their smell lingers for hours.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Been a member of this gym long enough. The management here is terrible, nothing is enforced and members can just walk all over them. I have also witnessed members abusing, yelling and getting confrontational with staff and nothing ever seems to be done as I‚Äôve seen them remain in the gym. The gym have to many unpleasant members and it appears anyone is allowed to come through that door as long as they pay membership (or use their friends details). It‚Äôs an unsafe environment for everyone. Weights are never re-racked, despite staffs best effort, the gyms a mess 5 minutes later. Members spit on the floor, leave actual sweat puddles on the leather (blue roll has been taken away from us, we now have to use toilet roll to clean equipment which is gross), food is left in cardio cup holders, I‚Äôve even blood on the punching bags. Members have no respect for the changing rooms either and cleaners are hardly ever around to keep up with the cleanliness, my friend has even seen poo left in the men‚Äôs showers!

I‚Äôve seen the new actual general manager of the gym maybe twice since I‚Äôve been a member?  She‚Äôs never on shift during busy periods when staff and members need help and the few times I‚Äôve noticed her in, she‚Äôs been locked away in an office. Whos is running this gym? It‚Äôs gone completely down hill since Cheryl left and needs shutting down before a health inspector walks in.

showerReviews.reviewText: Good high tech equipment, lots of different machines and several of them as well which is good for busier times. I have been to high end gyms and low budget ones and always find that I have to wait about for certain machines but there are plenty of machines across 2 floors. There is also an app you can download to track your workouts, reps, calories, distance etc which is useful for people who have goals and targets. There is also a large variety of free weights. I can't say I saw any staff other than at reception but then I wasn't looking around for them either but the reception staff are knowledgeable and friendly. Changing rooms are large and clean, showers and toilets also clean and spacious. Lockers are available free of charge which is also a plus. Overall glad I joined and look forward to my next visit

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am writing this review to express my disappointment with the gym facilities that I recently visited. I purchased a day pass for ¬£8.99 with the expectation that I would have access to the pool and sauna facilities until the gym's closing time, which I was informed was at 5 pm. However, upon arrival at 3:40 pm, I was informed that the pool and sauna were already closing at 4 pm.

This was highly frustrating, as the limited access to these facilities made the price of the day pass seem exorbitant, especially since I was not informed of these restrictions before purchasing the pass. I would have appreciated it if the gym had informed me of these limitations before my arrival, as it would have saved me the time and money spent on the day pass.

Moreover, the early closure of these facilities means that the gym is not providing a comprehensive service to its customers, especially those who work or study late and would appreciate the opportunity to use the pool or sauna after work hours.

Overall, my experience at the gym was highly disappointing, and I would not recommend this facility to anyone looking for a comprehensive gym experience. The early closure of facilities, combined with the high price of the day pass, makes this gym a poor value for money, and I will not be returning in the future.

Further comments from my partner, who is a membership holder at this gym:

I'm sorry to say that this gym has many issues that need to be addressed. The equipment is in decline and often needs repair or replacing. Unfortunately, most machines take a long time to repair, sometimes 1-3 months. The pool has very limited availability, and the sauna and steam room are out of order 1/3 of the time.

The gym is very small and very expensive. Memberships are oversold for the capacity, leading to overcrowding during peak hours. It's a common sight to see all machines occupied, or even worse, out of order. People are often on top of each other, making it challenging to get a proper workout in.

The gym management has failed to keep up with the growing demand for the gym, and it's clear that they lack a long-term vision. If they had planned for expansion years ago, we wouldn't be dealing with such issues. Despite the high prices, the gym is generally dirty, and there's a lot of mould on the ceilings.

It's frustrating to see the gym constantly overselling memberships, and even worse, advertising new years deals despite already being at capacity.

Overall, this gym is an absolute disgrace, and it's difficult to recommend it to anyone, especially for the extortionate amount. The staff are friendly, and there is good car parking, but those positives don't outweigh the many issues the gym has. It's clear that the gym needs better management, more space, and more attention to cleanliness and hygiene.
showerReviews.author: Emily Coldwell

There is a good volue of new equipment, with plenty of fixed benches, adjustable benches, squat racks, cables machines, free weights etc. The environment (Air conditioning, cleanliness, state of equipment) is comfortable to work out in. However, everything is brand new so I hope the uni will stay on top of cleaning and maintenance long-term. Seem to be plenty of lockers. showerReviews.reviewText:
Great facilities. The gym was refurbished near the end of 2023 so all the equipment is pretty new.
There are synthetic pitches, squash courts, fitness studios, A multipurpose sports hall (badminton, basketball, etc)
Water fountains available all over.
Staff are helpful and friendly.
Taken a few fitness classes and the instructor (Alison) has been excellent.
The only issue is the pool is now permanently closed.
I think the rock climbing wall may have been removed as the room was used for a weights room the last time I looked.
Lockers are free, as is the water. Fitness classes are inexpensive.
The site is spread across two public buildings, with lockers, showers and changing rooms in both.

showerReviews.reviewText: I visited today for the first time, and the gym was spacious and well organized. Both the changing room and the toilets were clean. Reza, the manager, was very friendly and made me feel comfortable even though it was my first time there. I also really enjoyed Cameron's SGT-glutes class today. He helped me use equipment I had never tried before correctly, and he didn't let me take the easy way out. He pushed me just the right amount so I could improve. He was very nice. Everyone who took the class with me was nice as well, so it was a great start and I will definitely keep coming back.

locations.address: ÓÉàNapier St, Sheffield S11 8HA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Recent switched to Nuffield Health after my previous gym membership ran out and increased their prices. Can not recommend this gym enough. Always clean and tidy, reasonably priced, central so extremely accessible for everyone. The Staff are extremely helpful, the receptionists are always so welcoming answered every question I had and always had a smile on their faces! My kids absolutely love the swimming school and facilities! I took part in my first spin class this weekend after being talked into it by the receptionists and I can not recommend it enough! The facility is absolutely amazing and really adds to the experience! Lucy the instructor was amazing, so chatty and witty and really pushes you to your limits but also appreciates everyone‚Äôs diversity!
The changing facilities are also fantastic, always clean and the only gym I‚Äôve been to that doesn‚Äôt seem to mysteriously run out of hot water at the end of the day!
Can not recommend Nuffield enough! Amazing!
showerReviews.author: richard wesson

locations.title: King Edwards Swimming Pool
locations.address: ÓÉàClarkehouse Rd, Broomhall, Sheffield S10 2LB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
There‚Äôs been no real progress in my son‚Äôs swimming. He was due to move up a level last term, but because the instructor changes every couple of weeks, no one actually tracks his progress, they don‚Äôt keep any proper records at all. For the past three months he‚Äôd been swimming confidently freestyle, backstroke and breaststroke and then suddenly a new instructor came in and put him back on a float. We were really taken aback, and my son was upset as it made him feel like he was starting again from level 0. It‚Äôs knocked his confidence completely.

I spoke to reception, and their attitude was basically that they didn‚Äôt care. They said there was nothing they could do and that the regular instructor would check when she was back. When I asked if they kept any progress records, they said they only provide something at the end of term.

It‚Äôs honestly so frustrating. I‚Äôve got no hope of seeing any real improvement at this rate. Best of luck,  I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place to anyone who genuinely wants their child to progress. Cheers.
showerReviews.author: Sudhanshu Shukla

showerReviews.reviewText: Both me and my mum who are in the age range 50s and 70s were unable to use Westfield Baths because of a chlorine issue so decided to try King Edwards. We arrived about 12pm on a Sunday and had parked at Broomhill as you are exempt from the parking restrictions on Sunday. It was a ten minute walk there as there is no parking. The lady on reception was very pleasant and said she could only accept a card payment which was ¬£6.50 each. Westfield is only ¬£4.85 each. The changing area and shower cubicles were clean. As we entered the pool we thought the water temperature was a little bit too warm compared to Westfield. The men who were swimming were very disrespectful to us and we found ourselves having to move out of their way. They had no consideration or manners towards other swimmers. At one point I saw something that resembled a blood soaked cotton wool floating. I can't say it was the best experience of swimming I've had recently. I'm unsure if I'll be returning.
showerReviews.author: Gillian Warren

locations.title: Ponds Forge Swimming Pool
locations.address: ÓÉàSheffield City Centre, Sheffield S1 2BP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The first point to note is that the majority of the positive reviews for this site are related to the centre's use as an event space for graduate ceremonies, NOT for the leisure facilities themselves.

This site should be a flagship, instead, it is a poorly shoe-string-run unhygienic shell of itself being grossly let down by inadequate management and poor investment. It is a prime example of what happens when public facilities are put into private hands. Membership cost up, service down.

For months now the lane swim schedule has been at best part time. This week for example there are no sessions Thurs-Sunday, at all. This has become standard. On the days when there are sessions, they are patchy, with gaps during the day, and often ending by 4pm. No explanation is ever given, complaints are responded to with a generic 'we're sorry you feel that way' response (as I'm sure this will be) and then ignored.

In addition to this, hygiene standards have plummeted and membership prices soared since Everyone Active took over (running the site for profit), from the charity Sheffield City Trust. The members changing rooms are mouldy and stale, with every single hair dryer broken. The showers are rarely cleaned, I've seen stains and dirt sit in the same spot on the shower block floor for weeks at a time. The yoga mats in the studio reek of stale sweat, and there is no antibacterial spray for wiping down. A loudly championed 'refurbishment' of the gym involved a rearrange, and the swapping out of broken equipment with already worn equipment shipped over from the Hillsborough site.

With respect to membership costs, the first thing that Everyone Active did on taking over the running of the site was to hike prices, and particularly spitefully, remove the discount rate for disabled people. To mark the one year anniversary of their running of the site prices have just been raised yet again without excuse or apology.

All this seems to be a common pattern with Everyone Active who appear to at least in part keep their sites profitable by slashing staff and services, particularly with the cleaning team, but I also suspect with lifeguard numbers. The current excuse in the case of Ponds Forge is that there is a problem with the leisure pool which has lead to swimming lessons being moved over to the main pool, causing cancellations. However, this is an excuse that Everyone Active have been using for months, whilst also cancelling swimming lessons, and often leaving the main pool half empty with neither taking place. At some point all physical problems become management problems.

When Sheffield City Trust ran the site, it was not perfect, but they were a charity doing their best, and the general level of service was far above what it is now. Private for-profit companies do not deserve the leniency that we give to charities. They should step up their game, communicate with their members, improve as a matter of urgency, or lose their right to run the facility.

Ponds Forge could be so much, and yet, because of poor management and investment, it grows shabbier by the day.
showerReviews.author: Danny Shaw

showerReviews.reviewText: My son has been having swim lessons for a few weeks now and he is absolutely loving them. The weekly themes help keep the lessons new and engaging for him and the support from the staff is fantastic. They are always so enthusiastic and friendly and keen to give feedback at the end of each lesson so you really feel like you're clear about the progress they're making. Abbie and Albert are particularly fantastic with the younger children in their Swim 1 classes and you can see them making progress and getting more and more confident every week! I would highly recommend swim! to any parent looking at getting their children started on their swimming journey.

locations.title: Hathersage Swimming Pool
locations.address: ÓÉàOddfellows Rd, Hathersage, Hope Valley S32 1DU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Wonderful visit today for their festive swim. My blind aunt was with me and we were blown away by how amazing the staff were. Seperate accessible entrance to avoid steps, looked after her guide dog in the staff are so we can change and swim easily and had signs up to warn other swimmers where a visually impaired swimmer was swimming. All that and clean warm water and fab Christmas songs. Thank you so much
showerReviews.author: Fiona Morgan

showerReviews.reviewText: Visited Hathersage outdoor swimming pool today as part of a Sauna event. Both the sauna and swim sessions were a great experience for the beginning of March. It's nice to experience the outdoor pool at this time of year and the experience of the additional sauna and plunge pool at this event was the cherry on top, This was an experience I would recommend to anyone who enjoys outdoor swimming or sauna experiences. showerReviews.reviewText:
Unique swimming experience with the most spectacular views.  Worth a visit whatever the weather.   A July Saturday and a balmy 15c air temperature.   The pool was indeed the place to be.
Pre booking tickets is easy to do and advisable as some public swimming sessions are, rightly,  very popular.   Even when busy there is a lane or two for those wanting to exercise.   Great place to visit and a decent cafe if you need refueling afterwards

locations.title: PureGym Sheffield Meadowhall Retail Park
locations.address: ÓÉàUnit M, meadowhall retail park, Lock House Rd, Attercliffe Common, Sheffield S9 2YZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Edit (Sept 2024) - They're letting it fall apart!! Clips missing, machines broken for weeks on end, vending machines always broken, etc. Such a shame. The cable connecting the display on the 2 air bikes is split, the display won't stay on, been like that for months! The glute/ham raise is missing the adjuster clip for, it's been missing for months. The staff have also started emailing members, threatening them with account suspension if they don't put weights back after use... I agree to some extent as some people are just lazy! But I put my weights back 99% of the time... Occasionally I'll forget, if I'm in a rush to get back to work for example... I forgot to put my weights back once this entire year and they emailed me threatening to suspend my account! Every member is going to be suspended if they keep it up, it's ridiculous!!!

Edit (May 2023) - Downgraded to 3 stars. Having visited the gym frequently (4 times a week) since opening my opinion has changed. One of the vending machines is broken already, the entrance turnstiles have broken multiple times. There are already clips missing for the cable machines and barbells. The fire alarm on the entrance has been flashing "error" and beeping for weeks! I've come to  realise that the toilet facilities are way too small for a gym this size. There are not enough lockers downstairs and the staff care more about the silly "no gym bags on the gym floor" rule than they do about actual health & safety. There are always barbells and other equipment left in the middle of the gym floor (which I've tripped over or moved out of my workout area multiple times) yet the staff ignore it or walk around it. They don't seem to care about the gym. There is currently a chest fly machine that is broken and has been for over a week. There's a few clocks on the walls and they haven't been changed since the clocks went forward over a month ago, which I know isn't a big deal but it shows a lack of care and attention from the gym staff. The gym has only been open a few short months and it's already being neglected. It's sad really!

Original review - Really impressed with the new Pure Gym. I went to the opening yesterday and had a look around then this morning I went for a proper workout. I was a member of the old Pure Gym (Nr. Tesco) which was a bit of a dump, but this one couldn't be further from a dump!

Everything is brand new (I was worried they'd move some of the equipment from the old gym). There are 8 squat racks across the middle at the back, plus another 3 that doubles as bench press stations. The squat racks in the middle have solid platforms for squatting on one side, which is a welcome addition. They also have 2 sleds and Ski-erg machines (which I love!). There are a ton of DBs across the back wall with plenty of benches. There are also kettlebells, med. balls, and weighted bags... It has pretty much everything you can think of!

They have a large open area on the main floor for doing WODs or stretching, etc. There's also a studio with plenty of space and studio weights/barbells. The changing rooms and toilets are upstairs. As you can imagine, they are nice and new, let's hope they don't get ruined. There's also a cycle/spin studio upstairs with cool lighting, full of brand-new bikes.

The only issue with it being so big and having the toilets upstairs is that it's a bit of a mission if you're working out in the free weights area downstairs. I kid you not, from the squat racks to the toilets and back is about the length of a football pitch in total distance covered. Not ideal after heavy squats with jelly legs. I wish they had downstairs toilets.

Parking and lockers are plenty, plus they have the usual vending machines with snacks and shakes. They have mostly the same staff that were at the old Pure Gym. They're a nice friendly bunch.

The opening offer (¬£10.99 a month for 12 months) is an absolute bargain! Having such a nice gym makes me look forward to working out. Hopefully, it doesn't get ruined, please look after the gym people!
showerReviews.author: Lee Calcutt-Scott

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym membership is used to be ¬£25 for one month flexi which is what I used to get. Now they have raised the price to ¬£37 per month flexi, which is disproportionate for a student gym and for what you get.

The swimming pool and the saunas are permanently closed, which limits the membership to only the gym. I appreciate the fact that the monthly membership price is cheaper when you purchase an annual membership, but I don‚Äôt want to be tied to a monthly subscription for a year! Not to mention that the gym isn‚Äôt 24/7 and it shuts early on the weekends at 5pm.

Plus, the showers and toilets in the gym is disgustingly gross, dirty, and uncomfortable as well. I don‚Äôt feel comfortable to showering there.

locations.title: Hillsborough Sports Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà26 Beulah Rd, Sheffield S6 2AN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely sports centre located petfectly across from hillsborough park. Got an amazing gym with full range of equipment. Venue I'd clean and tidy and well maintained. Plenty of parking and accessible parking for disabled at front of venue. I use the swimming facilities most and there is a great private area for lane swimming and learning to swim. Leisure pool has two big slides suitable for children 1m and above. Slides are nice and gentle and great for young kids and parents to go on with. Small baby pool and pirate ship with toddler slide. Lovely facilities around pool area and fantastic value for money. Would advise booking online in advance as slots quickly go. Swimming is 1hour per session.
showerReviews.author: Leonard

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely freezing outdoor pool ü•∂ BUT it was an amazing day out!
Little slide to use, plenty of seating and green space to use. Cafe was available but we took a picnic with us.

showerReviews.reviewText: We went at 6pm on a weekday in the school holidays on a warm day. There were many like us hoping to have a proper swim, but there was only one very small section of the pool separated off for this (equivalent to a lane). The area for diving was bigger. This was a shame as the pool was starting to empty out but there were still a number of children in the areas that were deep enough to swim. It is a lovely setting and the pool was very refreshing, it is unheated. There are grassy areas where you can sit if you are planning to be there for a few hours. It is definitely aimed at families. It would be nice if Bradford Council set aside the last hour of opening for adult lane swims. The changing rooms are in serious need of a revamp - 3 showers, 2 sinks, 6 cubicles, dirty and wet everywhere. For ¬£11.95 a swim, they should be much better than they are. Bizarrely we were asked twice to be quiet as there was a soundbath going on in the next room - this at the end of the evening when lots of people were showering (or queuing to shower!) and changing.
showerReviews.author: C A

showerReviews.reviewText:
We came as a big group lady on the counter was brilliant really helpfull had loads of names to check through for the waivers. Kids enjoyed it this is our 3rd time here as a big group. Its loads better this time around boards inbetween inflatables so bit easier to get round.

Only thing that lets it down a bit is the changing rooms and toilets. Alot of people were having to get changed outside trying to cover up with towels.

It is a very busy place which i get and maybe in peak times needs more staff on the cafe. We were queuing 25 minutes and there was no rush in them to serve people. We did do a big food and drink order which i had spoken to a few hours before we put it in so they had a little heads up. When i say big i mean 25 pizzas and chips.....by the way thd pizzas are so nice. This was really quick to be honest they did really well sorting this but the one thing that i thought was very rude.

There was a lady an oldish lady i said is there any chance we can get some paper plates she looked at me and said how many i went 50 she said oh no ide have to charge you for them i went but weve just put a massive order in. She was like right you can have them but i thought the way she had spoken to me was very rude and come on what a few plates when weve put loads of money in the till.

Other than the lady at the cafe the place is great kids will love it the staff on the front are great. We will always go back
showerReviews.author: hayley reid

locations.title: The Boiler Room Sauna
locations.address: ÓÉà208 Savile St E, Sheffield S4 7UQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Visited 17/12/2024 mid afternoon after a work meeting finished early. Easy enough to find, though parking non existent and the free on street alternative was particularly intimidating - not sure I'd want to leave a premium motor there after dark?

It's not unusual for gay venues to be located in "low rent" areas and low rent buildings and boiler room doesn't dissapointed in that aspect and I'm sure in this day and age it's still off putting to the inexperienced but at least the signage is decent.

The guy on the desk was efficient and polite, asked if I had been before and volunteered a guided tour which was a nice touch although I opted to explore unaided.

30 years ago I'd have faked the newbie status just to spend a few more minutes in his company though as he was a fine looking man with a beard and definitely a boat floater for me!

Sad to say as per a number of reviewers previously maintenance issues meant the full facilities were not on offer as the jacuzzi was closed off.  I get that maintenence is a challenge in venues open long hours and that a jacuzzi relies on power and water which are not the best of bed fellows in terms of safety but it's dissapointing to be charged full entry when the facilities advertised are not available?  Even a complimentary return or discount for a future visit would have been a welcome gesture but it was not to be..

As Tuesday is a Naked day I was provided with a spa towel the size of a tea towel and a micro fibre "shower towel" which I didn't unroll (more on that later..) if Naked Day was an intimidation I'm not sure the flimsy feeling towel provided would have assured my confidence much,  but maybe there are different towels for non naked days?

Immediately past the tiny reception is a compact locker room with similarly compact lockers.  Fine for my street clothes wallet phone and watch, but I was grateful I wasn't wearing a jacket or coat as it would have been quite the challenge.  Luckily I was in a car, and not lugging a work laptop around, as spacewise I would have been buggered.

I know I'm no longer the prime customer, and nowhere near as athletic and agile as I once was but I'm quite "British" about shucking my kit off and I suspect at busier times dressing or undressing would entail a lot of unexpected contact (yes I know I paid my money for Bums and Willies fun but I'm the guy who always gets the unsavoury neighbour....)

Downstairs the sauna cabin was on and working, if somewhat small? A bit like an old Northern train, it may have a given number of seats,  but unless you're a string bean or don't mind wedging yourself between sweaty relative strangers it would have similar capacity to a large family car?

The nearby toilet was passable but lacking in toilet paper when I arrived, and when I left, although thankfully I didn't need any.

I found the out of use jacuzzi then noticed the stairs up.. And the promise of better things.. The upper floor is like most gay saunas a repository for sterling board, sheet ply, and 50 gallons of matt black with the pleasantly disorienting array of doors cubicles and alleyways.  Two "video" areas one smaller and less exposed, and the, larger with two tier benching and two doorways which made it feel strangely exposed? The assortment of glory hole cubicles was fine.. I liked the two elevated ones which allow the guy(s) on both sides to stand up.  There are two sling rooms but they looked to be suspended at an odd height? I know many young guys are much taller than my respectable 6'2‚Äú  but I have serious doubts about my ability to service any willing occupant without a step to stand on? Later I did see a couple of guys engaged in the act as the door was left open,  and it was definitely a precarious job on tiptoes.

Now back to the shower towel provided on entry...  The shower area is long and narrow with access at the end  possibly not very big   I didn't find out because the entry point has a sign that made me grateful I didn't need to wash.

"Do not shit or douche in the showers" 10/10 for plain English, 0/10 for appeal.
showerReviews.author: Junk Mail

showerReviews.reviewText:
I don't like givin 1 star reviews but here goes.... A few years ago this place used to be absolutely fantastic.... Over the past couple of years this place has nose dived big time and it has NOTHING to do with the people coming through the doors. It is the place itself.

There is ALWAYS at least one of the facilities not working, it is now purely contactless entry, they charge ¬£1 for each additional towel so if you want a shower and a fresh towel its going to cost you, and the worst thing is that the place is rundown and dirty bigtime. It needs shutting down and a massive revamp.

Everything in the place is showing its age... The paintwork, the cubicles, the floor and even the outside area are just worn out and in big need of an overhaul.

I understand economic downturn and finances not been as they once were, but a place like this needs to be kept on top of, especially given the nature of activities that go on here!

Its no longer an inviting place.

I think the biggest draw that keeps people coming back is the fact that the closest other saunas are in dewsbury or mansfield and not everyone can drive or get to them easily.

So in one respect, the owner is laughing all the way to the bank, but surely even he has noticed that his once extremely loyal customer base has dwindled massively!

I fully respect the work that these places must need to keep going, but this sauna has to be the only one that only does the absolute bare minimum.

He needs to fix it or sell it and let somebody else run it that actually gives a monkeys.

I would be embarrased to say i owned this sauna if i was the owner.

I'm sorry for the massive thumbs down but it needed saying.

Don't waste your time here, if you are able to get to another sauna i highly recommend giving this place a miss.
showerReviews.author: Bob Morely

showerReviews.reviewText:
It wasn't bad at all, for my first time ever at a gay sauna. The place was clean and the people were friendly! I felt very looked out for! The free tea and coffee was lovely too, and a nice thing to have in between activities. Only a couple things that could improve:

- The selection of sandwiches wasn't great, and I don't know if it'd be worth it but an expansion of the food options would be nice. Also, the salad had a bit too much salt and could've maybe used a citrus or vinegar-based dressing instead?
- The stairs to the upstairs area are very slippy, especially given that the showers are up there but the jacuzzi is downstairs. Some kind of rubber grip on the steps would go a long way to preventing accidents, perhaps especially important given the age of some of the attendees.

Despite those points, I had a lovely time and I think I will go back.
showerReviews.author: Jaike

locations.title: The Gym Group Sheffield The Moor
locations.address: ÓÉà81a The Moor, Sheffield City Centre, Sheffield S1 4PF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Quite spacious. A great place to burn your fat and melt your indecisiveness. There are enough machines and weights that no one ever has to wait for their turn.
Regarding cleanliness, the floor is spotless and the machines are wiped regularly not only by the people who use them but also by the cleaners. There is always a cleaner on site. The toilets and showers are also tidy and nice.
The music keeps you going and pushing. The facilities are great. The vending machines sell everything from healthy snacks and drinks to towels and lock-pads. Depending on your membership, you can track your body with a special machine and you can drink flavored water as well.
There are various classes held in different times of the day.
Don‚Äôt miss this place.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Have closed changing rooms and access to the gym for significant periods of time in July. Only informed of this at the beginning of July meaning I did not have the chance to freeze or cancel my membership for the month. This feels very underhanded and deceptive.

Other alternative gyms offered as "compensation" but these are not realistic solutions given additional travel time required to get to them (two of which are literally in other towns).

Sent a complaint but the response basically said "we can close the gym when we want, it's in your contract".

locations.title: Firehouse Fitness Millhouses
locations.address: ÓÉà9 Archer Rd, Sheffield S8 0LB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Been a member for around 2 months now.. here's some feedback:

+ Gym is tidy, I normally use squat racks/functional kit.. and plates/barbells are always there - if your after a gym where athletic/functional training is your thing.. defo check this gym out
+ several Curve runners which is great for sprint training (more of these than regular treadmills which iv not seen before but does makes sense as functional/conditioning clases is a big part of the gym)
+ Free weights area/machines/cables smaller and fewer than most regular commercial gyms but the large functional zone makes up for it so no real complaints.. plus it's tidy so no real complaints but probs not the gym for a bodybuilding approach to training
+ friendly instructors.. they may let you use part of the functional zone even if there is a class on but that's down to how busy the class is so time your workouts!!
+ clean changing rooms, and blue roll around the gym

Only things that could make it better and 5*

- maybe 2 more regular treadmills, granted it is a more class/functional focused gym but think these would be appreciated
- way too warm upstairs.. not ideal when your doing sprints!!

Overall though.. its a quality gym with great staff and atmosphere.
showerReviews.author: JB

locations.title: PureGym Sheffield Crystal Peaks
locations.address: ÓÉàCrystal Peaks Shopping Mall and Retail Park, Drake House Way, Beighton, Sheffield S20 7JJ, United Kingdom
locations.street: ÓÉàCrystal Peaks Shopping Mall and Retail Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not really one to go to the gym, certainly hadn't done much before. Have gone a few times now, mostly 1-2 times a week for a couple of hours at the time max‚Äî taking advantage of the "bring a friend" option, to go with my partner.

As we work shifts, we find it easier to go at odd times during the day (using the app to estimate when it's going to be least busy‚Äî normally 1-3 PM on a weekday, or later in the afternoon on a weekend). So far never really had to wait much for equipment, or felt like it was oppressively busy. Most people attending seem normal, and no-one has bothered me/come up to me so far, or made me feel uncomfortable.

Mainly I'd want staff to proactively, more often clean equipment‚Äî or give users a chance to pick up a cloth & spray bottle to clean equipment before/after use. When I have been there it seems mainly staffed by "gym-bros", so don't feel particularly comfortable approaching them for any advice, so just keep my workouts directed by the app/what I know.

Been apprehensive about reviews regarding safety of belongings‚Äî especially as doors to the changing rooms are not locked, needing a code to access‚Äî so I only go in with keys/phone/headphones and water, which I keep with me at all times.

Overall, would recommend, just even to give it a try.
showerReviews.author: Clinging Squirrel

locations.title: Virgin Active
locations.address: ÓÉà300 Broadfield Park, Broadfield Rd, Sheffield S8 0XQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Been registered here since March and have decided I will not be renewing unless big changes are made.
The gym floor is fairly standard for commercial gyms with nothing that makes it bad or overly special. The pool is also pretty standard but they do close lanes at times for family swim and lessons. There is a hot room that I don‚Äôt overly use but also seems quite nice. The female changing rooms are extremely clean as they consistently have people cleaning them. The cafe is also quite nice with good selections of both smoothies and food.
The issues that I have with the gym are with the bits most important to me: the climbing wall and classes. The climbing wall is autobelay only and is actually a fairly decent height but has the most diabolical, god-awful setting I have genuinely ever seen. I have been to countless climbing centres and outdoor crags and have not experienced anything remotely close to how lazy and uninspiring the setting is here.
I no longer go to the yoga classes here as there isn‚Äôt anything here for advanced students. The barre class is also overly beginner friendly. The main issue I have with classes is the reformer pilates classes. There is one non-introductory class a week for people only able to attend evening classes and it feels like the starting part of the hunger games trying to get into that class - which is such a shame because Tiff is a phenomenal instructor. There used to be four classes across two days in the evenings but these have been axed with no replacement despite always being full. If you want morning or middle of the day classes you won‚Äôt run into the same issue.
All in all this is a fine (but expensive) gym if you don‚Äôt care about classes or climbing but I would not recommend if you had any interest in climbing or doing evening classes.
showerReviews.author: Ashley Mutch

There used to be four classes across two days in the evenings but these have been axed with no replacement despite always being full. If you want morning or middle of the day classes you won‚Äôt run into the same issue.
All in all this is a fine (but expensive) gym if you don‚Äôt care about classes or climbing but I would not recommend if you had any interest in climbing or doing evening classes.
showerReviews.author: Ashley Mutch

Very good experience here last night.
My first visit following a recommendation.
Excellent food !
I had seared calves liver in red wine and red onion gravy, mash and roasted carrots and leeks ! Wow ! There was enough liver for 3 of me - I had to leave some.
Good nights sleep !
Very quiet up the top yard.
Great shower this morning !
Modern cubicles with electric showers and plenty changing room.
No faffing around with token slots or cards either!
Also wash basins with hot water for a good shave.

Only fault I can pick - my company won't pay the extra for a food voucher - let me pay the extra then !
Excellent facilities and I will see you again.

More cameras than the BBC

Toilets/shower that are SPOTLESS

Josh ( Owners Lad) couldn't  be more helpful TOP MAN üëçüëçüëçüëç

Downsides.

Only 19 spaces but you can usually get in

No cafe/food on site
( Pub a few hundred yards away)

Should the last one be a plus?? üòÅ

¬£36 per night......
Yes it maybe steep but if you use the services then it's comparable and you also have security and NO smell of piss as soon as you open your cab door.

If you do decide to park here then please respect it.

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time visit to Onroute Truckstop Jcn 29 of the M1. First of all a congratulations to all the staff on site, I engaged with ground staff who were at the fuel pumps, shop staff, the catering team in the restaurant and visited the truck wash.

On arrival, my purpose of the visit was to refuel, quick shower, some breakfast and wash my truck. All of which were the result of my eroute @SNAP app. Fuel pumps were easily accessible with over head canopy at 5m height restriction.

Keyfuels, UK fuels and Silvey Fuel cards accepted with loads of information boards encouraging you to sign up to the Onroute app and collect loyalty points which can be reclaimed onsite as discounts towards purchases, and 50% off your first restaurant order. A few minutes later my app was installed and breakfast ordered whilst stood at the fuel pumps!

Parked up and next on the agenda was a quick shower. Straight into the shower block which was spotlessly clean on entry with a separate changing and drying area. A bit old school but better than trying to dress on a wet floor. Striped off and wondered into the shower cubicle to find a vending machine at the shower with a notice to buy a token from the shop at ¬£2.50 for the pleasure. I was sorely tempted to walk back out naked to get my token but decided as time was of the essence and my breakfast was being cooked, to dismiss the shower for now. Perhaps moving the notice to the shower door would be advised? As a result no review to the showers or the hot water, but looking at the shower curtains, stained and tired looking, we‚Äôll leave that there.

The shop staff, stock available and friendly engagement was first class. I picked up some Tacho rolls and paid via Apple Pay at the till and was given a receipt without asking. Conversations were flowing and a happy environment - 10/10.

In the foyer and just outside the front door with the usual slot machines and laundry facilities, all working and available for use.  Plenty more information on hand about facilities on offer and selection of advertising.

Into the restaurant and again a joyful atmosphere with happy staff and a greeting by another member of staff ensuring I had downloaded the Onroute app and even offered me a fuel card application for silvey - nice touch. Food was presented bang on time as per the app order, was piping hot and further enquiries if I needed anything else, which I didn‚Äôt. They catered for everything. Very well done 10/10.

After breakfast I retired with my coffee to the seating area outside for my cigarette and the smoking area was fully accessible, clean and tidy.

Finally the truck wash, which was the purpose of the visit. I departed Driffield in Yorkshire on route to the South West and my collected trailer was black. It was supposed to be white!  Logging into the Snap app my first available truck wash on route was here. So this was a fairly integral part of my visit. You can imagine my disappointment to pull up and find it abandoned and closed. 0/10

All in all, not a bad experience, not sure if the truck wash is permanently closed but it‚Äôs let the site down in its overall scores.
showerReviews.author: Casper Roe-Lavery

locations.address: ÓÉàJ30, South) Service Area, Welcome Break, 31 M1, Woodall, Sheffield S26 7XR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was a little bit dubious about it being a motorway hotel, and i was wrong. The hotel was bright and airy, the staff on reception were warm and welcoming. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfy and clean. There was a bath and shower
Coffee and tea were available.
The hotel was close enough to the services to have a walk there.
I had taken the wrong charger for my phone. The receptionist was very helpful and let me borrow a charger. I didn't get her name but she was amazing. The hotel was busy but was quiet.
Breakfast was available to purchase from the services.
Thank you for a lovely stay. Highly recommended.
showerReviews.author: Julie Slingsby

showerReviews.reviewText:
The hotel was okay, nothing too special‚Ä¶ I stayed here with my parents. They had an issues with their room smelling like wet dog, however I just admit the hotel staff were fantastic in dealing with them and changed their room. The rooms are very basic and are in need of a little bit of TLC. I‚Äôve rated the room so poorly as there was a mysterious brown stain in my shower/bath that looked fresh but didn‚Äôt wipe away. I only noticed it in the morning and by that time, I had to check out and carry on with my day. I‚Äôm sure that had I have notified reception, they‚Äôd have corrected it. I know Days Inn are more of a budget stay, but I could have paid less for a Premier Inn in the same region, I only selected this one as it was closer to my venue.

Having said all of this, I probably would book Days Inn again.
showerReviews.author: Daniel Lee

Big kitchen available with microwave, furnace and enough pots and pans to prepare your own food. Not so many room to stuff your belongings in the rooms, pretty annoying. Except for the clean showers and toilets there is no public sink for brushing your teeth. Only sink is in the room.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not a good experience. A very strange and uneasy feel to the place. This place is not really a hostel, its more like shared living, in which some people there were definitely using as permanent accommodation.
Staff were lovely and kitchen facilities good but was smelly and had a sticky floor. Also the cleanliness of the showers looked questionable. Get an air BnB!
showerReviews.author: Louis Thomas

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.author: Louis Thomas

showerReviews.reviewText: Cut my trip short because couldn‚Äôt bear coming back to the hostel for the second night. The kitchen table was filthy, the ‚Äúcontinental breakfast‚Äù was a few jars of dusty cereals and one of the employees lingered in the kitchen all morning telling guests to do their washing up (one guest left a mug on the side and went upstairs, the employee called after the guest and spoke to him like a parent speaks to a child. The guest was popping upstairs to get changed and returning to the kitchen to have his drink. He had to explain himself, this is an unacceptable way to treat paying customers. Made me want to avoid the kitchen - the only common space available. Embarrassing.) I felt like I was being tested on my cleanliness in a hostel I felt dirty just being in. It was not relaxing at all and I felt like a socially anxious teenager again!! I felt like I was being watched! The room, however, was cleaned by the lovely employee who welcomed me on my first night (the reason this is not a 1 star review) and was a good level of cleanliness - I wish the rest of the place was as clean. The sheets were fresh and duvet was nice but the bed was so uncomfortable I barely slept and woke up with aching joints. No lockers to keep valuables in so I had to carry all my stuff around with me around the city. The room was also way to small for how many beds there were, which just made it awkward and absolutely no storage. Front door and bedroom only locked with a code which didn‚Äôt feel safe at all.
showerReviews.author: jessica owens

showerReviews.reviewText:
Well, it‚Äôs a cheap place to stay. Although I would make it even cheaper considering the facilities. We didn‚Äôt find our room key until the day of checkout (it was hidden IN the room) so all our stuff was available for the taking had someone chosen to steal it. (Which they didn‚Äôt, thankfully).
Reception was nice and friendly.
Parking was a nightmare as there was only one space at the hostel and my car‚Äôs handbrake wasn‚Äôt strong enough for the hill outside.
The rooms were not clean at all - maybe cleaners come and do the sheets but the carpets, toilet, showers etc all dirty from over time, and the whole building seems to be falling apart. I was just pleased that we had a private room as the bunk dorms looked depressing AF. Also it was way too hot in the night and I woke up several times in a sweat.
Breakfast in the morning was also equally depressing with a selection of 3 cereals and some cheap coffee. I wasn‚Äôt expecting much but I think if you‚Äôre going to advertise ‚Äúbreakfast included‚Äù then it should consist of more ingredients - maybe something gluten-free? Or even some fresh fruit?!
All in all you get what you pay for I guess!
showerReviews.author: Mikaela Korth

showerReviews.reviewText: The youth hostal is in a stunning location. We camped at the Castleton YHA for 3 nights with our grandchildren. Access to the main house is 24 hrs, the campers have great kitchen facilities, with a fridge frezzer, cooker toaster etc. the shower and toilet area is also spotless. Here is the negative and is a disgrace, the campers share a field with sheep, lots of sheep that pooh everywhere. You just can't miss it. When we arrived home, we had to clean the underside of the tent, several pairs of shoes and throw away the mats we use in front of the tent. At night we had to arrange out equipment under the tarp to ensure no sheep was able to enter and pooh in the middle of our cooking, eating area. Sorry you need to decide if its a sheep field or a campers field.
showerReviews.author: Sam Jolly

showerReviews.reviewText:
We will likely come again and recommend to others.
The site has a lot of people like us who live in Sheffield either testing equipment or in my case just wanted to book a last minute adventure with minimum travel.

Kids loved it, making some holiday friends. Showers warm and clean but the type you have to keep pushing to turn on again. Toilets clean with loo roll. They described it as busy but never had to wait for any facilities. Pot washing had clothes and washing up liquid which was amazing as I hadn't packed them. Clean water tap worked well.

Paying was slightly awkward, you go to the farm house and lots of 'beware of the dog' made me nervous, what if I wasn't meant to go there. Fair price ¬£7 per adult and ¬£3.50 per child.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wonderful campsite, clean and well situated, there were a group of DofE kids that were all crammed into the toilet facilities which made it very difficult to shower or use the bathroom but luckily they were only there for one night and were well behaved, I can see from a lot of reviews the campsite is often over run by large groups of school kids and DofE kids with no notice from the campsite  which is a massive shame, I would like to come back here but I would definitely be emailing to find out what groups were booked first as they have the ability to completely ruin your stay.
The staff we did see were friendly and helpful and it has everything you could want apart from no campfire allowed :(
showerReviews.author: Liz Stead

showerReviews.reviewText:
A Tale of Two Cities (Oxford and Bedford).
We booked for two nights midweek thinking it would be quieter.  However, around 5pm on the first night the camp was inundated with around 60 young people all on their DofE Gold.  Great to see and good for them, but they absolutely took over the field with about 30 two-man tents arranged in a horseshoe. That said, they were polite and well-behaved, observing the 10pm noise curfew.  Their teachers and DofE guides camped in the same area, and regularly looked in on the students.  This was a secondary school from Oxford.
The Oxford school left by 8am the next day and the field looked like it had when we arrived.  However, around 4pm we saw two more minibuses arrive, this time from a school in Bedford.  A different kettle of fish.  Again they camped right across the middle of the main field, but were sadly less societal than their next-but-one-county neighbours.  Teachers were largely absent, camping in a separate field. The 10pm noise curfew was therefore unpoliced, and the noise, football, rugby, music etc. continued until at least 11pm.
Why do I say all this ?  Not because I don't applaud youngsters embracing camping, not because I haven't been there myself, not because I begrudge youthful exuberance.  No, because I would have expected the campsite to advise and maybe forewarn families and couples that these two groups were incoming.  Clearly these group bookings were made some time ago, and so an advisory email or even a quick word from the onsite warden wouldn't have gone amiss when we checked in.
All that said, the campsite was fine. Lovely location and probably otherwise quiet and peaceful.  Couple of clean showers, couple of outdoor sheltered washing-up sinks, bit rocky and slopy in places, but was OK.  The hand dryers in the toilets though could likely be heard from Dronfield.  In hindsight, we should have chosen the top field as far as possible from the toilets and the Germans who decided to wash, rinse and generally clatter their pots and pans around at 11pm.
showerReviews.author: Phil Hindley

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great location. You can walk to Stanage edge from the campsite.

The pods are a great choice. They are very spacious and insulated. They have a small heater, and 2 outlets for charging phones ect. We stayed in the Stanage pod, it was close to the car park and the toilets/showers and community space was just across the field. Everyone staying there was considerate, even the DofE group that stayed the first night, and there was little noise after 10.

The site is well managed and the staff were really friendly and happy to help. I would definitely recommend if you are looking to stay in the area

These were dirty and smelly, looked like they'd not been cleaned for a long long time.  There was a large pipe in the ground (sewerage?) on the way to the portaloos that had a plastic cover just placed over top - accident waiting to happen!
No bins for rubbish apart from one small one near drinking water sink.
Grass was too long so we all got bit to death.
Wouldn't go again but probably ok for 1 night for someone passing through and not for families.

The view was the best bit!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Family group used the Paddock with agreement of the campsite. 2 x Motorhomes, 3 x tents. EHU from pitch 32 used.
Friendly welcome by the campsite on checking in on the Saturday of Aug Bank Holiday weekend.
Walk to Fountain Inn was rewarded with good pints of Guinness.
On the road up to the pub, came across a honesty box shed selling local honey at ¬£5 per jar. Some lovely looking vacuum packed bacon if you fancy something other than supermarket bacon.
Showers are hot enough once water flowing with repeat press of the button.
Please help with recycling of waste, separate bins for tins, glass, plastic, paper and cardboard. Limited non recycling waste but I appreciated the sites organised waste.
showerReviews.author: John Cashman

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was very impressed with the site.
CCTV for peace of mind and security. Very spacious plots. Most had access to water and electric where you pitch but not all.
Shop on site for urgent buys.
Toilets and shower block very clean and though they do inspect regular and toilet had room for two toilet rolls holders they did run out. But I was actually surprised they supplied loo roll. Shower was clean lovely and hot however some complaint not powerful enough to wash hair I washed mine. I'd stay again. Though didn't like pitched next to a grave stone. When travelling alone.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed 3 nights on a grass pitch on the small tourer part of the site.  Easy access, well looked after pitches and planting.
Friendly owners who allowed us to choose from the pitches available when we arrived ( 7 was good).
Perfectly spotless shower block with adequate number of toilets and showers although push button showers annoyingly cold for the first 4 pushes!!
Garage with shop within 15 minutes walk and a brilliant location for getting out and about on the train as Bamford Station very near.  There are quite a few trains passing very close to the site but we didn't find them obtrusive at all.
Loved the area and would definitely stay at this site again. üôÇ
