showerReviews.reviewText:
Great place to stop for a couple of nights whilst cycle touring in the area.
Clean toilets and showers although some still shut when all corony restrictions are over....
I had ear plugs so didn't hear the trains at night.
Lots of picnic tables which is great as we don't have any sort of table usually.
Only issue is that if any customers only have 1 arm (as Def Leppard were formed down the road maybe Rick Allen the drummer hadn't paid a visit yet to comment) they would struggle with the push button showers as they only stay on for 3 seconds. Great temperature though.

Thanks for a wonderful stay.

locations.title: Rother Valley Country Park
locations.address: ÓÉàMansfield Rd, Sheffield S26 5PQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful place to have a picnic with friends and family. You can hire bike for ¬£9 per hour, best to take yours if you can. Loads of space to park but the payment was confusing, I paid for the hours I stayed at the pay machine but the barrier wouldn't open until I paid another ¬£1, don't know why. The tech should be working better.

The water sport center has lots of activities. If you are into water stuff and swimming, pack a swimsuit. It was my first time and I will return with better preparation now that I know you can do your barbecue fresh on site. It was generally a lovely place to hang out and loved the vibe of everyone doing their stuff. Didn't interact with any staff so can't comment about them.
showerReviews.author: Ade Fowowe

showerReviews.reviewText: Set next to a working farm with cows for your neighbours and fabulous views. This is helped by the blue moon cafe being sited on the farm, of course!

The campsite was in a beautiful location. Very close for hiking Mam Tor and Bamford Edge.
The facilities were outstanding. Toilets, showers, and pot wash areas were immaculately clean.
The fully stocked shop had everything you could possibly need.
I have already recommended to friends and I will definitely be back again. ‚ò∫Ô∏è

showerReviews.reviewText: Amazing campsite easy access to lots of hiking and more importantly pubs. Really impressed by clean facilities and although it doesn‚Äôt have an inside bar the pop up bar and covered outdoor area is a nice touch. Will definitely be back!!!

showerReviews.reviewText:
A gem of a campsite to find.
Beautiful location with great views and a burbling river at the bottom of the site.
Great facilities which are very accessible, including larger 'disabled' shower and toilet facilities.
They are also kept remarkably clean.
The staff are excellent and the onsite shop is really good for all the items you left at home.
Staff are very knowledgeable about the  local area and ready to recommend walks or where to drive to.
A very welcoming and well organised site with quality pitches.
The nearby Hope is lovely.
The only possible negative is the levels of road noise, but for that you gain great access with no goat tracks to navigate to the site.

Highly recommended.
showerReviews.author: Rob Stewart

locations.title: Fanshaw Gate Farm
locations.address: ÓÉàLidgate, Dronfield S18 7WA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This site is run by a lovely couple and has fantastic views over the South of Sheffield, from Totley, Dore, Bradway and down to the city centre.
Just a few miles out of town but in a lovely rural setting , this is a perfect location to explore the Peak District, whilst being walking distance to the outskirts of Sheffield .
Facilities on site are limited but adequate, with EHU, water and a chemical toilet disposal point . Pitches are on hard standing . We found our motor mover very handy for getting into position , but I‚Äôm sure a more accomplished caravanner would find it Ok.
The gate to enter and exit the site is tight , but I didn‚Äôt have any trouble and I‚Äôm no expert driver . Having a second person to spot on the road is handy .
Accessibility is otherwise very easy , off a quiet road with space to pass, off a main road . Fresh eggs are available from the owners .
I‚Äôve given 4 stars as it would be even better if it had a toilet/shower room , to reduce the frequency I needed to empty the cassette toilet, but I completely understand the reasons why the owners haven‚Äôt done this, and you get what you pay for .
At ¬£16 a night, it‚Äôs very good value.
showerReviews.author: Ian Morgan

showerReviews.reviewText: What a lovely campsite. Just spent 3 nights here.The views are out of this world.We only live about 25 mins away from here.But It felt like we were a million miles away from home.So peaceful and relaxing.Gary is very friendly and makes time to chat to the campers..As advertised, it does NOT have shower/toilet block.Which, with being in a caravan it wasn't a necessity. Weve genuinely found our local "Bolt Hole" Other than a couple of trips to Hade Edge to fill up shopping supplies.The rest of our time was spent just admiring the ever-changing views  and farm animals (My daughter, partner and Granddaughter joined us for a night with their tent-Gary was very accommodating at allowing her to pitch near us) My Granddaughter ABSOLUTELY  loved the freedom and seeing all the animals. We will be back (If you'll have us back)
showerReviews.author: Sara Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked to take our toddler swimming one Sunday morning. When we arrived, the person manning the front desk told us that the session had been cancelled as lessons were now taking place and there had been a double booking. He said that we should have received an email that morning informing us- we hadn't.

No apology was forthcoming, just a credit for ¬£13, received by email the following day. Not even a refund, so we'd have to go back to redeem the credit.

Suffice it to say, our toddler didn't understand why we couldn't go swimming and we had to make other plans at short notice. Reluctant to go again, even if it is to redeem our credit...
showerReviews.author: Wesley Blackburn

showerReviews.reviewText: This is one of our favourite swimming pools. We like to come on a weekend and school holidays for the Family Fun Swim. The Family Fun Swim is packed with inflatables, balls and a couple of small boats, the kids love it. The large pool can be a little cold for the kids, but if they're moving around a lot it's refreshing. The kids have to do a swim test to go into the deep end (standard practice), and the staff are very supportive and helpful. The changing rooms are clean, the pool is modern and clean, too. Plus, the prices are great, as little as ¬£1 for the kids. Free parking, too. What's not to love.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Firstly, the water temperature in the pool is extremely coldü•∂, making it uncomfortable for swimmers. Despite the cold weather outside, it is essential for the pool to maintain an adequate and comfortable temperature for users. I kindly request that the temperature be adjusted to a more comfortable level.

Additionally, I noticed that the room temperature surrounding the pool area is also uncomfortably low, further contributing to the discomfort when exiting the water.

Finally, the overall cleanliness of the pool area has been concerning. I observed several areas of dirt and debris around the pool, as well as in the changing rooms. A clean environment is crucial for both safety and comfort, and I urge you to ensure that regular cleaning protocols are enforced
showerReviews.author: Leonard Badea

showerReviews.reviewText:
Swimming pool is absolutely freeeeeeeezing!!!! I took my two eldest children yesterday for the first time. For an indoor pool the water temperature üå° is absolutely baltic!!! I wasn't told that I couldn't use my "Better" token for the lockers like the other "Better" centres. After changing into our swim suits we realised our locker wouldn't work, I spent 5 mins trying many different lockers to then be told by a member of staff I have to go back outside and buy a locker token from the machine for 25p. I was half naked and only had my card. Thankfully she took pitty on me bless her and went and got me a token herself. This was very kind but it's not good that the receptionist didn't tell us when we arrived and told them it was our first time. They didn't even direct us as to where we needed to go, to get to the swimming changing area.
Energise is the closest centre to my house so I was wanting to join as a member for gym and swimming. Thanks God I visited yesterday before joining. Safe to say I won't be returning. Sadly the gym is really small the swimming changing area is not ideal and many areas taped off due to "out if order", lockers issue and the water being that cold I've woken up the next day feeling poorly! We didn't even stay the fully 60 mins because it was unbearable and couldn't stop shivering in the water.
Sorry guys. I just couldn't give a better review!
Not worth the money at all!
showerReviews.author: Kate Sordabak

showerReviews.reviewText:
Swimming pool is absolutely freeeeeeeezing!!!! I took my two eldest children yesterday for the first time. For an indoor pool the water temperature üå° is absolutely baltic!!! I wasn't told that I couldn't use my "Better" token for the lockers like the other "Better" centres. After changing into our swim suits we realised our locker wouldn't work, I spent 5 mins trying many different lockers to then be told by a member of staff I have to go back outside and buy a locker token from the machine for 25p. I was half naked and only had my card. Thankfully she took pitty on me bless her and went and got me a token herself. This was very kind but it's not good that the receptionist didn't tell us when we arrived and told them it was our first time. They didn't even direct us as to where we needed to go, to get to the swimming changing area.
Energise is the closest centre to my house so I was wanting to join as a member for gym and swimming. Thanks God I visited yesterday before joining. Safe to say I won't be returning. Sadly the gym is really small the swimming changing area is not ideal and many areas taped off due to "out if order", lockers issue and the water being that cold I've woken up the next day feeling poorly! We didn't even stay the fully 60 mins because it was unbearable and couldn't stop shivering in the water.
Sorry guys. I just couldn't give a better review!
Not worth the money at all!
showerReviews.author: Kate Sordabak

showerReviews.reviewText:
I really enjoy coming to Energise, as a member I use the gym and the pool. Never had a problem with either. The small pool is great when I have my children with me. It can be a bit frustrating when it's full but I'm not sure what can be done about this other than the waitlist which they already have in place.
The changing facilities are good, and the showers work well too. I enjoy being a member and it costs a lot less than the local health clubs.

locations.title: Yearsley Swimming Pool
locations.address: ÓÉàHaley's Terrace, Clifton, York YO31 8SB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
My son and I like coming here for free swim.
It is a dated swimming pool, however all facilities are there and does not impact the swimming experience.
I like that they have vending machines and 1 of those you can get hot beverages.
It's 20p for a locker, decent size, I could fit 2 hoodies which there is a inside hook in the middle to hang those, plus swim bag and clothes.
You remove trainers before entering the swim area, I like this method as no outdoor shoes are allowed past certain points and is more hygienic then Monkscross swimming pool.
There are shower facilities and hair drying, however they are very old!
I would recommend this pool, its warm and deep and not very busy at all. Staff are nice to and approachable.
Only negative are the tiles in the pool and side look so old now and probably put some people off.
showerReviews.author: A M

I managed a sneaky swim on a recent trip to York. This pool was just the ticket, booking online was easy enough and made getting in very easy.

It‚Äôs an unusual pool - like an indoor lido.. you walk poolside to get to the changing rooms and lockers then in you get!

It‚Äôs 50yds in length and plot into three wide lanes. The temperature was quite cool, it wasn‚Äôt over chlorinated and it was far from crowded.

Really nice pool and if it was my regular I wouldn‚Äôt be disappointed .

showerReviews.reviewText: We go here a lot. It's a full size pool which is quite rare. They do lane swimming and swim for all and family fun swims on a weekend. They also do aqua aerobics twice a week and swimming lessons and club stuff. Loads going on. It's an old building/pool with some great heritage and historic links to the city and it's workers/people. The pool and building are well looked after and are clean and the changing areas/showers/toilets are clean. You can book online and I think you can turn up and pay, if there are spaces. The staff are good. There are vending machines in the lobby for hot and cold drinks and snacks. There is enough parking at the venue but the car park is really tight with little space between the 2 rows and the spaces are tight.
showerReviews.author: Sarah Lee

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice big pool. 50 yards long.  Showers are nice and hot. Lockers require 20p coin.

Great for lane swimming or family swimming. No slides.
Water temperature ok,  but the water itself wasn't particularly clean. Lots of clumps of hair on the bottom.

The rest of the pool side is well maintained though with plenty of individual changing cubes as well as family charging cubes, all split by gender. Plenty of life guards.
Be nice if they had a couple of centrifuges to spin trunks / swimming costumes dry, which is quite common for swimming pools.

There is seating upstairs for parents to watch their kids and 2 vending machines with drinks and snacks in reception.

Places for lane swimming etc. need to be booked online or via the Better app.
Free parking for customers and some parking reserved for Blue badge.

Overall a good pool (although old) and one of the few pools longer than 25m.
showerReviews.author: Herjan Velding

showerReviews.reviewText: I'm a triathlete, and up to now swimming has been a necessary part of the training mix but not much more, but since I found Yearsley swimming pool, it is honestly one of the highlights of my week. The pool is large (50 yards) and is (usually) split into 3 wide lanes, which gets rid of all the agro - its easy to over take/ be overtaken so there's no stressing about what pace you or others are doing. It's really bright and airy and the light dapples on the bottom of the pool as if you're swimming outside. The staff are all friendly and helpful, its well maintained and cleaned, it's clearly well valued and used by so many and there's a wide variety of people who go, from breast stroke chatters to competitive athletes and everyone in between and there's a generally friendly atmosphere between everyone. Thanks so much for this gem!
showerReviews.author: lucy hurn

locations.title: York Sport Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàUniversity of York, James Way, Heslington, York YO10 5NA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Honest review of my personal experience at this Sports Center.

I love gyms and visit almost on a daily basis. I appreciate a good gym culture that is cultivated by the management, staff and frequent gym visitors.

I'll describe good and bad sides and a lot of it can be subjective due to the fact that I've not been able to compare this one to other gyms in the UK.

Pros:

1. the students get a discount at the beginning of the academic year, I've paid around 230 pounds for 12 months, which is an okay deal. Slightly above average for "gym only" experience and when I say gym only I mean you get access only to the workout facilities and showers for free . No free group classes or pool, sauna, etc

2. Close to Wentworth college campus. It's a five to ten minute walk from Wentworth collage and it has parking space.

3.  They have two locker rooms, always half empty and you're normally alone in the mornings and late evenings from 8 to 10.

4. Staff doesn't care about you or other visitors and that's a pro for me personally, but if you need their attention get prepared that they don't care about you and will ignore even when you drop the bars on yourself. They're busy ceat cheating.

I'm afraid there are no other positive aspects of this gym.

Cons:
The biggest and the most stupid thing is that you have to buy an actual lock üîê to be able to close your locker. Hahah this was a brilliant marketing to milk money ü§ë from new comers who have no idea that the locks stay open unless you buy or bring a lock. The lock costed five pounds or something and you have to carry on a heavy lock all the time to be able to close the locker with your belongings. I've been to hundreds of gyms and it's the first time I see such thing.

1. This might be a cultural and social behavior, but it's very very strange for me to see extremely bad hygiene of student visitors. You'd see a vomit on the locker room floor on a weekly basis.

a. A lot of students would take their shoes off while heavy lifting, and boy that stinks so bad. It's a rack of stinky socks you're smelling all around. It seems it's a norm as some would enter the gym without sports shoes on or completely dirty covered in mud.

b. Big issue with bags and clothes of visitors thrown all over. Despite the notice , a lot of people would "make their spots" at the platforms by throwing up their clothes. This is extremely unhygienic and uncomfortable for me personally to navigate.

c. most of the people would keep the equipment vacant for minutes, some would stay for an hour making certain equipment unacceptable. They would chat with others and trainers for minutes and when you try to approach they would say it's busy.

d. Overall visitors tend to be very unhygienic when it comes to personal hygiene. No one takes a shower after the workout which is strange for me, I couldn't care less, but this speaks volumes about the personal hygiene of visitors.

e. in Europe you'd have a first aid box on a visible spot. I couldn't spot one there and when I tore my finger I had to manage my bleeding finger myself.

f. You can't access the gym on Sunday morning if you're heterosexual male , because apparently there are hours for non binary people üòÅ how do they check if someone is a non binary ? Apparently there were females working out only. Very strange and artificial agenda.

g. from time to time they would randomly approach you to check the blue entry bracelet. It's really strange because you do enter the gym by tapping the bracelet on the entry to the building and then on the entry to the actual gym, why they approach you to check again is extremely invasive.

h. you can't move your shower and the water is directed to one angle only. Some showers are ok the others are bad with water temp and flow.

I. sometimes they would forget to turn the music on and you'd workout in absolute silence for an hour

j. If you go there on a daily basis you'd notice that the same playlist is being played on repeat

k. during the week big sports groups would occupy the gym giving almost no access to equipment.
showerReviews.author: G T

showerReviews.reviewText:
Visited here for a Spa Day package. Warm greeting on arrival with directions for the spa services from the Front of House Manager.

We used the gym first and there were plenty of free machines, all very modern and well equipped.

Pool recently refurbished. A little busy with a variety of swimmers but jacuzzi / hot tubs had space and steam rooms and sauna an added bonus. Changing rooms very clean and spacious.

We had lunch in the cafe as part of the spa package. Limited choice of soup, jacket potatoes or avocado and eggs on toast but very delicious and something for everyone. Seating arrangement a bit unusual as more like a cafeteria looking out onto car park but modern and clean.

Massage treatments lengthy and relaxing and dual bed appointment. Swedish back, back and scalp message to die for! Relaxation room with heated beds was definitely our favourite room!

Ignore the negative comments, it is more about having unrealistic expectations. This is a fitness centre and not a country retreat. The service was great, all staff were polite and helpful and we had a lovely day there.
showerReviews.author: Shelley Barrett

showerReviews.reviewText: Gym and pool are OK, just the staff were not helpful. My locker wouldn't open and I was forced to walk out into the reception area in my swim shorts dripping wet, then proceeded to wait for 15 mins for no one to attend the changing room as the only male member of staff was in a meeting. Eventually got the locker opened (the lock had seized), then when I complained that they'd just left me there shivering, the manager (as rude as expected) stated that they'd done everything they could.. also said they sent someone to help but I must have sorted it by then, I actually saw the guy come in and it was about 20-25 mins after I'd originally raised the fact that my belongings were stuck in the locker. Honestly would have usually just let it go but I'd just joined this gym and expected a bit better service for the price they charge. So I decided to quit immediately, and in the stereotypical big gym criminal behaviour, they want more money from me, even though I'd paid for the month up front! Get lost lol!
showerReviews.author: Michael McLeod

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wonderful afternoon of relaxation and pampering.  On arrival the young gentleman on reception was fab. Kind and most helpful explaining  about what to expect, booking us in, showing us where to go snd generally just really welcoming.
Swimming pool and steam room were great then on to the relaxation room. We went a little early so we had time to enjoy the warming beds. Room was nice (speakers a bit tinny with the music which buzzed a smidge). Then into our treatment room. Ladies were really respectful and welcoming. We had a Swedish massage and a facial. Absolutely fantastic! So relaxing and really thorough.
Couldn't fault my day at all. Finished it off with one of the cafes smoothies. Also tasty. Thank you all.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I wouldn‚Äôt even give this place one star. Big claims and very bad service. I‚Äôm particularly talking about DL club in York. Closed swimming pools/spa without any prior notice, did not respond to any requests of suspension for two months, when finally responded, refused to refund membership for the months we waited for their response and did not even enter the club for those months, finally When convinced it was communication gap from their end, refused to refund the fee and refused to suspend membership without 25% fees while swimming pools and spa still under refurbishment for another 4 months.
Abusing members financially, bad communication, poor club room services. The management is simply incompetent and never there for members‚Äô queries.
Not worth the time, energy and effort it takes to argue with their staff on very petty issues.

locations.title: Ebor Fitness
locations.address: ÓÉà33 Hospital Fields Rd, York YO10 4DZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Have been using Ebor this week whilst in the city on holiday, visiting early morning to get my training in. A whole lot of kit packed into a small but perfectly formed space, geared primarily to strength training but with a reasonable selection of cardio machines. Equipment is of various ages but everything I wanted to use was in good nick, save for the rowing machine which has seen better days and needs its sensor replacing. Clientele mainly blokes but of varying ages and builds - I'm not exactly massive but did not feel out of place. Staff friendly. Day pass and weekly membership prices for those of us just visiting were reasonable.

Gents changing room and showers, upstairs on the first floor, were nice and clean, which is always the main thing, but the main door opens straight out onto the stairwell (from which most of the room is visible) and the doors to the shower stalls are just inside said changing room entrance. You therefore need, unless you're possessed of a devil may care attitude to nudity, to be very careful not to flash passers by, bearing in mind that the ladies' facilities are located a little further down the landing. The showers themselves need a little maintenance: the first one I tried was basically a tap rather than a spray; the second had no time delay on the push button which meant it had to be held down continuously to work - a manageable nuisance whilst you're facing it, but resulting in contortions when you're wanting to give your back and arse a proper wash.

The gripes aside, however, a good, clean and well equipped gym which seems to be run and used by the right kind of people. Would give 4.5 stars if the rating were available.
showerReviews.author: Matthew Potter

showerReviews.reviewText: Been going to this gym for 15 years when I come to York. Today will be the last time. The customer service was pretty shocking. After paying for my day pass, I politely asked if they still give towels as when I have been in the past they have been provided, he responded "no" I said OK no problem went up to the changing room then remembered I didn't have a locker key so I returned downstairs to the desk and asked if I could have a locker key, the said nothing rolled his eyes then provided. When I was leaving and returned he said nothing, he was generally quite aggressive. I don't know what his problem was. In future I will travel further to another gym where I am.sure they will have friendly professional staff.

showerReviews.reviewText:
What I like about the gym is its location, however the gym lack when it comes equipments so much space but they are not using it wisely. The gym definitely needs some incline and decline benches as well as some other machines for back. These are essentials and available in most gym but not the gym group. Also another thing that I find very disturbing is (hygiene)
‚ÄãI find the hygiene and air quality to be a major disturbance. While member behavior plays a role, the gym is responsible for providing a clean and pleasant environment. The odor in the bathrooms and common areas is consistently unpleasant. I strongly suggest implementing better cleaning schedules and, at a minimum, installing air fresheners or improving the ventilation system throughout the facility. This is a crucial area that needs to be taken care of immediately.

With plenty of machines, spare accessories for cable setups, and multiple dumbbells of each weight, you‚Äôre never left waiting. The resistance machines, including top-quality Hammer Strength gear, are a standout.

The gym is open 24/7, making it incredibly convenient for any schedule. The staff are friendly, approachable, and always willing to help. Hygiene is a priority, with constant cleaning keeping the facility pristine. The music selection keeps the energy high, creating a motivating atmosphere. JD Gyms York has set a new standard for what a gym should be!

The changing rooms are stunning, clean and well stocked stocked with hairdryers and lockers, as well as a sauna. Byron is always welcoming as are the rest of the staff. The gym is spotlessly clean and never that busy when we go. We are daytime users but I have no experience of what it‚Äôs like at peak hours. For the cost, it‚Äôs worth every penny!

locations.title: UltraFlex - Gym in York
locations.address: ÓÉà10 Layerthorpe, York YO31 7YW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Was a member for over two years until recently. Positives- wide selection of equipment, rarely have to wait for a machine, a great gym for weightlifters and bodybuilders.

Negatives- NO AIR CON OR HEATING!  It‚Äôs in a tin shed so freezing in winter and unbearable in summer. The few cardio machines they have are on a mezzanine so even hotter up there. They installed some fans last year but they are rarely working and when they are they just blow warm air.

No WiFi. What gym doesn‚Äôt have WiFi and it‚Äôs in a bit of a dead zone so my mobile coverage was poor and I had to pay for more data due to the lack of wifi.

Toilets are disgusting. I never used the showers once and the one men‚Äôs toilet is grim.  Someone ticks a checklist on the back of the door hourly but they are not seeing what customers are seeing. They are terrible and clearly havnt learnt about the benefits of bleach.   They were refurbishing them when I left but unless the cleaning massively improves then it won‚Äôt make a difference.

Parking is limited. In my first year I got a ticket despite being a member and entering my reg number but they couldn‚Äôt have cared less and made out it was all my own fault, ¬£100 down the drain.   Often had to turn around and park in the ASDA opposite as car park was full.

Finally, not the friendliest of gyms with one staff member seeing me literally daily and never acknowledging me even when he was walking right past me in over two years.

It‚Äôs fairly expensive for a York gym, particularly with the drawbacks mentioned (and prices rose twice whilst I was there) so I‚Äôve moved to a much less expensive gym.

P.S.  I did raise my reasons for leaving with the Manager but didn‚Äôt hear anything further.
showerReviews.author: Kevin Macdonald

showerReviews.reviewText: Good gym however it needs some serious maintenance especially the male bathroom. Also no water in the bathroom it has been like that for a while. And the lockers,,, they are all need to be changed. Lastly they should have a wifi for members.
showerReviews.author: Alex Alex

showerReviews.reviewText: Good gym however it needs some serious maintenance especially the male bathroom. Also no water in the bathroom it has been like that for a while. And the lockers,,, they are all need to be changed. Lastly they should have a wifi for members.
showerReviews.author: Alex Alex

showerReviews.reviewText: in the last few months York Ultraflex has really gone down hill!.. I feel like the guy who owns ultraflex is too busy now making the other ultraflex gyms around the country/world bigger & better where the York one has been left behind & abandoned - a few of equipment/machines been out of order for months! A few Members who think they own the rack area where you do deadlifts etc are dumping & leaving crap in the shelving so other members can‚Äôt put their stuff in there. The locker area is a mess with broken lockers.. was a notice a few weeks ago saying something about lockers been removed but they have been taking down and the broken lockers remain..  the boxing area is a real joke its in the way of everyone trying to get to the changing rooms! It‚Äôs also quite intimidating when you are working out near them It‚Äôs too close to the smith machines as well  which are now both squashed  together in a corner next to a fire exit  making it unsafe - the Pendulum is also crammed in there too  (which is now broken) If someone is on the Smith machine, next to the fire exit doing hip thrust someone is on the other smith machine doing chest it makes you feel like a plate could fall on their head making it feel unsafe,  - only one hack machine so everyone is fighting over it.. its starting to turn into a more of a student gym than a bodybuilding gym!.. the car park is a joke.. especially now one member has their own parking space, which is ridiculous!!  Behind the reception area looks like a dumping ground the posing/sunbeds rooms are really bad now wasn‚Äôt before when it got moved - changing rooms and toilets are dirty  - It‚Äôs a really shame because York ultraflex use to be the best gym in York now with the JD gym opened makes it looking old and battered!  I visited the Leeds Ultraflex recently it was 100% times better probably be worth the drive to Leeds :(
showerReviews.author: Mich

locations.address: ÓÉàBaxton's Sprunt, Helmsley, York YO62 5HT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely pool nestled in beautiful countryside, friendly staff, comes equipped with kiosk selling drinks and snacks, changing rooms and sauna. Heated to a perfect temperature throughout the summer months, and then gradually cooled and available for cold water swims. A perfect place for a relaxing, peaceful swim, walking distance from Helmsley.

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely pool nestled in beautiful countryside, friendly staff, comes equipped with kiosk selling drinks and snacks, changing rooms and sauna. showerReviews.reviewText: This is a lovely little outdoor heated pool; we've visited a few times now over the last few years. Booking is required as there's a limited number of people allowed in due to its size. Once in, you're free to dip in and out of the pool as you wish as there are chairs and tables to sit at and a small selection of drinks are available from the kiosk. There are two outdoor showers for after swim. The pool offers moonlight and meteor swims which we'd really like to get to at some point. For those folk not quite ready for "wild"swimming this is an excellent in between with lifeguards on duty.
showerReviews.author: Philipa Phillips

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic open air pool. Great for a swim or a family day out. The family fun time with all the floats was great for the kids, but other swim sessions allow for laps if that's your thing. There are tables and chairs around the pool, and you can take in food and drink for picknicks and snacks (no glass or alcohol though!). Each session is around 1hr 45 and with numbers being controlled, doesn't get too overcrowded. The staff are friendly, the pool well maintained and a good temperature once you're in. We had a great day out! Would highly recommend - especially with a little tub of Yorkshire ice cream from the tuck shop after! üòÅ The changing rooms could do with an upgrade which they're currently fundraising for. Lovely, local pool, well worth a visit!
showerReviews.author: Spark FG

locations.title: Pool Bridge Farm - Wild Swimming & Wellbeing
locations.address: ÓÉàWheldrake Ln, York YO19 4SQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We visited Poolbridge Farm today and spent our time at Q Lake, which is ideal for under 18s. There was plenty of space around the edge for towels and picnics and the water was clean and refreshing. Some areas were shallow, while others reached up to 12ft, offering something for everyone.

Facilities were clean and the atmosphere was welcoming for all ages. There are also three adult-only lakes for those wanting a quieter experience. The lake bed has a clay, squidgy feel, so swimming socks might be a good idea.

Overall, a fun, affordable day out ‚Äì we‚Äôll definitely be back!
showerReviews.author: Charlie Cicero

We booked this in advanced as no bookings on gate, so happy we did, it was fantastic! We had 2 adults and 1, 11 year old with us, and couldn't recommend enough!! We turned up at 09:45 and stayed until 1400, the Q lake was super clean and facilities - shower, toilets and changing rooms all well kept too. We stopped off at the cafe on our way back to the car and had pizza and chips - delicious!!! Food was fresh and tasted yummy!

Next time we visit we will most likely camp over as well to make a weekend of it. We will be back!!! Thanks for a great experience Pool Bridge Farm.

showerReviews.reviewText: Visited here for the first time in July, we wanted to book more than one night for camping but there was only one night available as we didn‚Äôt realise how popular it was and we would definately book more in advance next time so we can stay there longer as the place is amazing! When we arrived we were initially taken back by the number of people however when we got onto the campsite the pitches were spread out and quiet with the added bonus of the fire pits being already on the field free to use! The swimming was out of this world! I‚Äôve never been wild swimming before so was slightly apprehensive but it was a truly amazing experience, surprisingly the pools adult only pools were quiet and relaxing the horseshoe was our favourite (slightly warmer than the Monet lake) but the Monet was beautiful still to swim amongst the water Lillie‚Äôs! We will definately return here in the future! The only negotiate would be the shower weren‚Äôt as spotless as other campsites but I think this is more due to the guests not cleaning up after themselves with the squeegee provided

showerReviews.reviewText: Visited in late September for a private session in the Willow Tree Sauna. Faultless experience, clean, hot sauna and perfectly located on a private lake reserved just for sauna users (so not too busy). Sauna came with a vestibule which was great for hanging towels etc. Lovely cafe for a brew afterwards. Would be good to add the option of aromatherapy oils to buy to enhance the steam. Cant wait to return!

showerReviews.reviewText: With 3 fresh water lakes there is plenty of scope for wild swimming. The lakes are very well maintained but boy the water was cold so you have to be a little brave. Mid May and not a sunny day so we ventured into the water with some trepidation. Although it was cold once we started swimming the feeling of being cold was soon replaced by the joy of swimming in such beautiful surroundings. The farm enjoys ample parking facilities, toilets and changing rooms, sauna cabins and a very welcome cafe where hot food and drinks along with cakes are served at reasonable prices. We had a great time and will certainly return.
showerReviews.author: Charles Polkadottery

showerReviews.reviewText:
How rural cattle markets should be, open for the lowly lorry driver to park overnight. There are only a handful of these places remaining in this country, so get parked on them, have a meal and a shower!

Look at my other reviews to see where I've been!

showerReviews.reviewText: Writing this as it's the kind of review I was looking for before my visit. Always washed my own cars but due to the hosepipe ban the car was dirty and being in York (I'm not local about an hour away) I thought I try the Jet Wash. I paid ¬£8 which got me 8 minutes which was ok for a medium sized car (BMW M4) but I may have rushed the first couple of the stages. I was nervous about using the brush thinking it had the potential to scratch/swirl and that would show on the carbon fibre roof. But I can't see any and it has a great shine along with the rest of the car. If going again I'd maybe take a wash mit to avoid the brush. Oh and there wasn't a separate/dedicated wheel tool.
showerReviews.author: c123987xx

locations.title: Welcome Lets | Holiday Lets & Serviced Accommodation in York
locations.address: ÓÉà4-6 Gillygate, York YO31 7EQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: North American Traveller Review. As I say in other reviews, if you‚Äôre from NA you will need to get used to the incredibly small dimensions of any rental accommodation in the UK. This is no different. However, having said that - the rental was clean, well suited and very nice. Quiet at night as well. We could see the Wall from our backyard.  Size-wise, our suitcases were in the living room because there was no room for them in the bedroom. The only table to eat at was in the glassed-in conservatory at the back because the kitchen was so small even 2 people couldn‚Äôt fit. Again, however, this is normal and not specific to this unit but you should be aware and plan accordingly. The people at the corporation operating the rental were uniformly pleasant and helpful. The unit comes with a book of Operating Instructions. Which is absolutely required. For example, in NA if you wish to use the broiler on the oven you turn a labelled dial to Broil. Done. But in order to do the same thing here it required the manipulation of a Byzantine series of 3 dials including symbols and numbers and colours that had to be exactly correct, with no language on the oven itself. Guessing how to do this would have been hilariously impossible without the instructions. Also, from a NA traveller perspective oddities abound. There is a washing machine for clothing - but no dryer. The bathroom sink hot and cold are separate spouts so you cannot wash your hands in warm water - it‚Äôs either cold or very hot - take a choice. There is no mirror over the bathroom sink so when shaving or putting on woman‚Äôs makeup - you have to guess. You can‚Äôt just turn on a radiator for heat, the thermostat on the wall needs to be turned up first to above the current room temperature and then the radiators will work if they, in turn, are turned up. No issues per se, but it does add a layer we are not used to after a long day. Having said all of this no complaints. Very nice spot. Nice helpful people. Clean and tidy. Enjoyable.

locations.title: Astor York
locations.address: ÓÉà124 Holgate Rd, Holgate, York YO24 4BB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
It does the basics of a hostel well enough and at a good price, with common extras like a towel or breakfast being available at reasonable prices (though I didn't use them, so can't say much about the quality). Staff were very friendly. The location is fine but not great as it's a bit of a walk relative to both the train station and the city, and there isn't much nearby apart from a corner shop, but there is a bus stop just outside (though the traffic at York meant it was not much faster than walking...).

The 4-bed dorm and the ensuite were fairly spacious, though no soap in the shower is a nitpick. Only one extension with 4 sockets tied to a bunk pole for all 4 of us did feel a bit odd, I have to assume the building was not meant to be a hostel and not properly converted. Another sign was the desk and chair, which is nice to have in and of itself, but no socket to use is a big oversight. Comfort was fine though I would say. One "luxury" missing was privacy curtains, so you are at the mercy of your roommates' manners. In terms of facilities, there was also a lounge, quite large kitchen, a pay-to-use laundry, and a bar, though I didn't use any of those so again can't say much.
showerReviews.author: Shoumma Shams

showerReviews.reviewText:
Never stayed in a hostel before, I was recommended to try it,so booked the York one for a mother/daughter Xmas market weekend.
On arrival we were greeted with a smile and 2 nice ladies, booking in was so easy, but pleased remember who ever booked it take photo ID, so many who was before us didn't and caused a delay, if you have mobility problems you'll need to tell them as there is a lot of stairs, we booked a 6 woman only room, the beds are good but bring an extra pillow with you for comfort, the room is spacious and has a little shower room as an ensuite, the room is lovely and warm, we had a mix of ladies in our room from America to Scandinavia, all really nice, surprisingly nighttime was quiet, you can hear voices and the odd door banging but that's due to the people not the hostels fault.
I was surprised at who actually used the hostel from an older age group to the very young, even what looked like a football team, it's ideal if you have younger children too.
In all stay was very good and said we will definitely use them again.
showerReviews.author: Nikki Hughes

locations.title: YHA Helmsley
locations.address: ÓÉàCarlton Ln, Helmsley, York YO62 5HB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: A family of four, we have just stayed for 3 nights, camping in the grounds. It's smaller compared to some other YHA's we've stayed in but excellent all round. The location (a short walk to the village centre) is great, the facilities, including the kitchen, shower rooms, eating and lounge areas have everything you need and are kept clean thoroughly. The camping area is a small, flat garden that fits 6-8 good sized tents. There are picnic tables and benches in the camping area so if you're camping you don't need to bring any tables or camping chairs.The staff were all really friendly and hard working. Helmsley itself is absolutely beautiful and we will definitely be back to this gem of a place.
showerReviews.author: Jayne L

showerReviews.reviewText: We arrived to a good number of pitches been reserved and a white peg pitch was allocated to us. A nice white peg pitch was not available due to the numbers reserved. We therefore had to park on a corner opposite the toilets with people regularly cutting across our pitch. The toilets whilst lovely need more cleaning. The first morning one shower had been left with hair and tissue all over. We truly believe the site are saving pitches and we asked why there were so many reserved white peg pitches and were told it was because of the length of the vehicles. We saw lots of vehicles not as long as ours on better located white peg pitches. We have been coming to rowntree many years and are doubtful we will be returning. The staff are not as friendly and we spent ages waiting for the barrier to be lifted which resulted in a queue of vehicles wanting to acccess.
showerReviews.author: Karen Starkey

showerReviews.reviewText: We arrived to a good number of pitches been reserved and a white peg pitch was allocated to us. A nice white peg pitch was not available due to the numbers reserved. We therefore had to park on a corner opposite the toilets with people regularly cutting across our pitch. The toilets whilst lovely need more cleaning. The first morning one shower had been left with hair and tissue all over. We truly believe the site are saving pitches and we asked why there were so many reserved white peg pitches and were told it was because of the length of the vehicles. We saw lots of vehicles not as long as ours on better located white peg pitches. We have been coming to rowntree many years and are doubtful we will be returning. The staff are not as friendly and we spent ages waiting for the barrier to be lifted which resulted in a queue of vehicles wanting to acccess.
showerReviews.author: Karen Starkey

showerReviews.reviewText: Great site a 10/15 min walk to centre of York on the riverside next to a lovely park area with shops / cafes / restaurants behind the site.  Toilets clean with hot water and plenty available despite it being a large site.  We were on a pitch that you could have an awning but some without an awning looked bigger- (don‚Äôt really understand their ‚Äòwhite peg / blue peg system).  Nice walk along the river away from the buzz to York marina for a lovely cuppa / cake and back the other side of the river (good 8 miler). Plenty cycle routes nearby - we have done the orbital route previously.  Expensive site but great that we could use our free night here so good value.

locations.address: ÓÉàMalton Rd, York YO32 9TH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really good site with spacious pitches. Great dog walk on-site and down the access road for a leg stretch.

Wardens we met were super friendly and actually happy to chat. One of them appears to be out doing everything from vehicle marshalling, giving advice and helping folks on their pitches. All round solid bloke.

Facilities clean all the time. Shower block feels like a sauna and could do with a few extra windows. Bins are a pain, giant ones at the entrance and none across the site. Had to help an elderly couple who couldn‚Äôt lift the industrial bin lids! This needs a rethink. One size doesn‚Äôt fit all regardless of environmental targets and cost saving.

Park and ride is nearby which is excellent along with M&S, Sainsbury‚Äôs etc. Will be back next year, with my roll of black bin bags.

showerReviews.reviewText: The site is really well planned, the pitches are spacious & set so that you do not look onto your neighbours. The facilities are outstanding! Very clean toilet area with electric point for straighteners for example as there is a hairdryer. The pot wash area is heated with plenty of hot water, there is also 2 washers & 2 driers here. The shower cubicles take this site to outstanding in my opinion; each little room has a large walk in shower, toilet, hand basin & vanity mirror. It is all heated & in excellent condition. We took our cycles & there is the trans penine track about 10 minutes cycle away going to York or Selby. The pub in Naburn is welcoming with a typical bar food menu that is well cooked & well priced. Great location near the river with plenty to do.
showerReviews.author: TJ Garraway

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have just stayed 3 nights at Naburn Lock Caravan Park.
After reading the previous reviews we had high expectations and were not disappointed. The staff were very friendly and welcoming on arrival.
The new shower/toilet facilities are superb we love the individual spacious rooms with shower, toilet and sink lots of hooks to hang everything is a bonus. Immaculately clean throughout.
Location is great we cycled on the designated cycle path one day to selby the next day to York.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our first time staying at Naburn Lock. Stayed on a hardstanding with electric hookup. Lovely peaceful site with a short walk down the lane to Naburn Locks where you can have a walk or a cup of tea in the tea rooms there. Ideally located for York, we were visiting a relative at Uni and the drive in took 7 just  minutes.

The site itself is within a picturesque village and despite it's proximity to York feels very rural. The  hardstanding we were allocated was very level so we were literally able to drive on , park up and sleep. Toilets and showers were superb, with each shower rooms containing shower, toilet, sink, hand dryer and pull down seat. Small shop on site was handy as I forgot my hairbrush.

There are codes to access the site and the showers, toilets, sinks and laundry rooms. This was very convenient as we didn't have to worry about getting back before the gates closed. All in all a well organised, clean and peaceful site which is a great vase for visiting York and the surrounding Yorkshire Dales and coast. We would definitely stay here again
showerReviews.author: Shelley Nutting

locations.title: Acomb Grange Caravan site
locations.address: ÓÉàAcomb Grange, Grange Ln, Acomb, York YO23 3QZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed for one night and arrived at around 10 pm. When we tried to use the showers shortly after arrival, there was no hot water. We later confirmed with a fellow camper that they experienced the same issue. As access to basic facilities was part of what we paid for, this was disappointing.

We followed the instructions provided and tried calling and texting the number listed when the showers weren‚Äôt working, but received no response at the time. As we were only staying one night, there was no practical solution available to us. We therefore had to leave the site late at night and go to a nearby 24-hour gym just to shower, which was a significant inconvenience.

The owners later explained that the issue may have been resolved by the morning and offered a ¬£10 refund, which we appreciate. However, whether the hot water returned later is irrelevant to our stay, as we were unable to use the advertised facilities when we needed them.

The site itself is quiet and has potential, and it sounds as though improvements are planned. Unfortunately, on this occasion, the experience fell short of expectations.
showerReviews.author: Owen Ho

showerReviews.reviewText:
On arrival we knew the site was down an unmade road but the road splits left & right & as there was no signs indicating where the campsite was, we ended up down the wrong one having to do a very tight turnaround at the end of someone‚Äôs house! Not a great start.

Once we found the actual campsite, there was no one there to great us but as there was some builders doing work to the house, I asked if anyone was around to help us set up only to be told there was no one there. The builder kindly helped me by ringing the owner as our name wasn‚Äôt on the notice board at the entrance of the site showing which was our pitch. The builder also showed me where to find the, very dirty, toilets, shower & pot washing building. There was no indication about where the water was so we eventually found a water connector but had to drive slightly onto the grass to connect. Whilst we were filling up with water, we presume the owner returned (he never actually introduced himself) & promptly told us off for parking on the grass, indicating we should have used the hose reel by the house (this was being used by the builders & covered in concrete & dust). There were no signs to inform us of this & as no one was around so we just did the best we could.

The toilet block was filthy. The toilet was dirty when we arrived & was never cleaned whilst we were there. There was hair & dirt in the shower room. The second toilet was in the same room as the pot washing sink which is not hygienic to say the least, especially as the on-site builders were also using the toilet facilities. It was so dirty, I refused to use the shower or toilet. The bin in the toilet was full, had empty cans of pop in & wasn‚Äôt emptied over the 2 nights we were there.

We paid ¬£30 per night which was way over what I would have been prepared to pay if I had known what it is actually like. Have stayed on far nicer sites for much less money. Think it‚Äôs fair to say we will not be returning!
showerReviews.author: Rebecca South

We had the pleasure of camping for 2 nights in August.
The site has very recently been taken over by Ellie & Darren and they have already started doing some major upgrades that is gonna make the site even better.
We didn't meet Darren as he was grafting on the upgrades but I had been emailing with Ellie and had the chance to speak to her on site a few times and she was super lovely and she helped me out massively when I decided I needed an electric hookup.
There is a bus route in to York nearby but Uber is so cheap we just booked both ways.
The site is super cozy and has perfectly usable and clean hygiene facilities as is.
There isnt anything 'to do' on site but that's what makes it so nice. People are coming back to the site to relax or sleep at the end of each day.
This will be our 'go-to' site when visiting York from now on.
showerReviews.author: Jamie

showerReviews.reviewText: Light and shadow. Positive: The campsite is very pretty and well equipped. The staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Negative: The pitch we were allocated was very uneven; they could have made the effort to level it out. The showers were terrible. You should wipe them down after use to leave them ‚Äúnice for the next guest.‚Äù Friends, if anything is ‚Äúnice,‚Äù it's not an ancient push-button shower‚Äîno one has one of those at home, so why expect guests to put up with it? It's impossible to wash long hair under it; it takes three times as long and you freeze. On top of that, the cubicle was extremely small (and I'm a slim person). There was nowhere to put your things‚Äîin theory, there was a dirty folding stool, but unfortunately one can't squeeze in next to the unfolded stool. It's a shame, because with modern showers (that stay on?!) of a reasonable size, it would really be a great place!
showerReviews.author: Martin W

showerReviews.reviewText: Just had a few days away at this lovely little campsite in our campervan. Hidden away in a forest setup it has electric hook ups and a nice middle toilets block with showers and toilets with washing machines and dryers etc. Also has a games room which sadly not much in there works and remains unplugged.  The WiFi is rubbish and we couldn't even receive it's signal. Hard standings are almost level. Very clean shower block. Taxis available at special price into York. If you want to catch the bus to York then bus stop is a bit of a walk across two big busy roads. The nearest pub is just over a mile walk away down a narrow road with mostly no path so beware of fast coming cars. The pub is really nice but the food wasn't nice and not cheap. See my other review at the Nags Head. Overall the campsite was okay but location wasn't best. You can hear the traffic most of the time.
showerReviews.author: skycamvideo

showerReviews.reviewText:
This lovely, well-managed small site is perfect for cycling or catching the bus into York. There‚Äôs a beautiful traffic-free cycle route all the way into York city centre which starts about 200m along the country lane from the site. The Tarmac route runs through woods and meadows and for much of the 4 miles hugs the bank of the River Ouse. It‚Äôs mostly flat and on some sections the surface has recently been upgraded. You can cycle all the way to the National Railway Museum in complete safety!
The bus stop about 150m away has an hourly service into York. The shower block is modern and spotlessly clean.
showerReviews.author: Ben Webster

showerReviews.reviewText:
Weekend at Flaxton Meadows on the campsite.

We were met with a friendly welcome, shown where all the facilities are located then taken to our pitch.  We had booked a  hardstanding pitch which was very spacious.
The whole campsite was very well maintained.
There are plenty toilets and showers. They were heated and kept immaculately  clean at all times.  They are amongst the best we have been to!
The bar area is great, very comfortable.  Again, a friendly welcome when we walked in.
Love the pizza van! We had pizza, garlic bread and chips.  They were freshly cooked and delicious.
We will certainly return, it would be nice if if it was open all year round......

Absolute gem of a place.  Large pitches, with water & EHU. Showers & toilets clean & warm (plus the lights didn't go out halfway through your shower). Laundrette very reasonabily priced.
Pizza & burgers were fantastic. Johnnie & Mark were incredibly helpful & couldn't have been nicer.
Would definitley recommend, & hopefully we'll be back.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Make sure you have the correct location details in your sat nav, My nav look me down a single track lane a little before the actual site, had to then turn around. You need to look for the brick entrance which shows Woodlands Farm, 2pm check in and a 12pm checkout (great)

The site itself is lovely, well manicured and spacious flat, even pitches, the drainage, tap and electric point are easy access.
The shower/toilet block is immaculate,  warm, plenty of hot water. Our only criticism is there is no shelf or curtain/divide between the showers head and door so if you have footwear its advisable to take a bag to keep them dry.

When we arrived we went to reception, met a lovely, friendly gentleman who explained that the bar and pizza van would not be opening, maybe on the one day but as they weren't very busy they dont open. I do understand this but maybe this could have also been put on the website or sent in at email at time of booking or as we like to choose sites that have a bar or are within a 10 min walk to a pub. On the one day we arrived back the guy came over to us as we got out the car to say they had opened up the bar for tonight, we duly went over for a couple of drinks. Nice warm bar area, good prices and friendly.

The only other thing is that this site is advertised as Adults only. There are 4 or 5 cabins on site, whilst we were there several of them had children in. Didnt matter to us as the site was quiet but not sure if it should be advertised as adults only.
Free wifi.

We went into York for the one day, got an UBER in ¬£11 and then one home in the evening ¬£16 defo worth it so as to have a drink and enjoy the city.

It might sound as if I am moaning but as always I think its important to say how it was, all in all its a lovely well kept site, we always ask ourselves would we ever go back. The answer is yes, if were ever in the area we would.
showerReviews.author: Anthony Fulcher

showerReviews.reviewText: Was rather concerned about our visit after reading the latest review. However, nothing to worry about Nice quiet CL, friendly owner. Grass cut short.! Mostly full all weekend. York races and BH weekend. ¬£30 per night which is much cheaper than most other places around York. One toilet and shower room which was simple but practical. A chair for clothes would have been useful. Grey and fresh water sites fine. Toilet emptying was rather basic and needed a bucket of water to dispose of the waste properly. 10-12 mins walk to Monks Cross Park & Ride and retail park with shops and supermarkets etc. Bus ¬£3.90 for adult day return into the city. Quick and easy. Walk is a 35-40 mins flat route. Overall a great stop and would definitely use it again over the usual expensive sites in York.

Mostly full all weekend. York races and BH weekend. ¬£30 per night which is much cheaper than most other places around York. One toilet and shower room which was simple but practical. A chair for clothes would have been useful. Grey and fresh water sites fine. Toilet emptying was rather basic and needed a bucket of water to dispose of the waste properly. 10-12 mins walk to Monks Cross Park & Ride and retail park with shops and supermarkets etc. Bus ¬£3.90 for adult day return into the city. Quick and easy. Walk is a 35-40 mins flat route. Overall a great stop and would definitely use it again over the usual expensive sites in York.
showerReviews.author: Nick Jones

showerReviews.reviewText:
üöê We had a lovely stay at Chowdene Camping and Caravan site, a @CandMClub Certified Location just outside of York. üå≥ The site offers fairly flat gravel pitches with generous grass sections between each pitch, and each has an electric hook up. üí° Fresh water, black and grey waste (not drive over) are available, along with a toilet and shower. üöø

Our 8m motorhome had easy access, and while there was a bit of road noise during the day, it was very quiet at night. üõå The location is perfect for visiting the City of York, with only a 10-minute walk to the Monk Cross Park and Ride, getting you into the city within 15 minutes for just ¬£5.50 with a Family All York Day bus pass. üöå the site is also located close to a number of supermarkets.üõí

Highly recommend this very reasonably priced site if you're thinking of visiting York.

locations.title: Holiday Inn Express York by IHG
locations.address: ÓÉàMalton Rd, North Yorkshire, York YO32 9TE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We were greeted on arrival. The room was clean but the bed creaked and groaned as we sat on it. The mattress was really soggy like trying to sleep in a bowl.
We could hear televisions all night and other guests laughing and chatting loudly.
The was wash room was very good but on our second morning there was a water leak around the toilet.
We didn‚Äôt have breakfast on the first morning as we were off on an early train ride.
The second morning there was juice machine that stopped working the staff seemed to struggle with the mechanics and I don‚Äôt think they succeeded.
I was pleased to see that there was a flask of filter coffee I am not a fan of machine coffee. However I only managed to get half a cup and it was empty. I popped over to reception and the young lady said she would refill the flask. After a quarter of an hour I asked how the coffee was coming along, only to be told there was no more ground coffee , sad she didn‚Äôt come and tell us. By now they were also having issues with the coffee machine.
I next tried the pancake machine and got two tiny pancakes more like cocktail pancakes .A while later the staff were at this machine apparently it wasn‚Äôt working correctly either.
My husband tried the baps and said they were tasteless.
The fruit compote  was gloopy with not a lot of fruit. On the plus side my husband found a banana
All in all it was not a pleasurable experience not at all what we expected from a Holiday inn
showerReviews.author: Susan Heywood

showerReviews.reviewText:
York Meadows Caravan & Camping Park. Sheriff Hutton.

Fabulous site with pitches to suit all. Facilities although not the ultra modern are kept lovely and clean and there is always plenty of hot water. Very good play area for younger children, a small cycle track and area with nets for the youngsters to play footie.

All pitches are of a generous size especially the seasonal/part seasonal pitches, some fully serviced, which are a very generous size.
To be able to book a part season pitch was an absolute bonus as due to circumstances for us this year it was the only way we would be able to use our caravan. We were made to feel very welcome by all those around us on the seasonal pitches and static vans.

Paul and Shell the wardens were fabulous and work tirelessly to keep the site amazing and they always have time for a chat and a laugh and a joke. They also go above and beyond to offer help and advice if required.

The site is ideally placed to chill and use as a base to visit some lovely picturesque towns and villages, it‚Äôs also possible to visit the coast in just over an hour.

Great pub (The Highway Man) in the village of Sheriff Hutton, nice garden, friendly service and great food.
showerReviews.author: Janet Evans

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just returned home from a last minute weekend at this fantastic, well thought out site. We arrived and went straight to our pre allocated (via email) pitch and we were quickly greeted by the friendly and helpful owners.
The site is very clean and well equipped beyond my expectations actually, immaculate shower facilities, clothes wash facilities, high standard water waste traps and an excellent dog wash that is both powerful and warm.
The pitches are very spacious and I like how they are marked off with little hedges for privacy. Water and electric is shared with a supply in the middle of each two pitches and I like the little touch of dog poop bags and bins placed around site.
The adjacent fields are fantastic for dog walking and my little pup was in her element...We will be back soon :)
showerReviews.author: Gaz W

What a find!!!
Lovely, peaceful, relaxing site in a beautiful location.
We received a lovely warm welcome & we were told all we needed to know about the site & how it runs.
The toilet block is immaculate, there is even a hot shower for your four legged friends.
The rally field is good to let your kids & dog burn off some energy.
Well done to Peter for opening such a great site!!!

showerReviews.reviewText: I stayed at this site for 7 nights over the August bank holidays period.  What a fantastic site this is.  It had only been open 3 weeks at that time, but the owners were so professional and welcoming, you would have thought they had been open for years.  All the pitches have been well thought out, all close to the amenity block and great sizes.  Even the smallest will accommodate most size tents.  Tents are in a separate section of the site, each pitch has EHU which is metered but at a very reasonable rate.  There is also a water tap accessible to every pitch.  The amenity block has great showers and loos, very clean, also disabled facilities and even a dog washing facility.  Also available is a washing machine which is ¬£2 per load which includes washing powder.  These owners have literally thought of every detail.  I was camping on my own here but met some lovely people and felt very safe here.  Will definitely be coming back next season as still have lots of places to see and do in the area.  Thank you Peter and Gaynor for a lovely stay. x
showerReviews.author: Susan Cook

showerReviews.reviewText: I stayed at this site for 7 nights over the August bank holidays period.  What a fantastic site this is.  It had only been open 3 weeks at that time, but the owners were so professional and welcoming, you would have thought they had been open for years.  All the pitches have been well thought out, all close to the amenity block and great sizes.  Even the smallest will accommodate most size tents.  Tents are in a separate section of the site, each pitch has EHU which is metered but at a very reasonable rate.  There is also a water tap accessible to every pitch.  The amenity block has great showers and loos, very clean, also disabled facilities and even a dog washing facility.  Also available is a washing machine which is ¬£2 per load which includes washing powder.  These owners have literally thought of every detail.  I was camping on my own here but met some lovely people and felt very safe here.  Will definitely be coming back next season as still have lots of places to see and do in the area.  Thank you Peter and Gaynor for a lovely stay. x
showerReviews.author: Susan Cook

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic site friendly helpful and little extras like dog poo bags and bins a luxury! Dog friendly. Showers and toilets lovely clean and modern.  Love the honestly pot re electric and ice creams! We'll be back again Friday! Good pitches

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been going to Unique Fitness for quite a while now, and overall, it‚Äôs a really lovely gym. The swimming pool, badminton courts, and other facilities are great. The pricing is very reasonable‚Äîespecially for students‚Äîconsidering everything that‚Äôs included.

However, I do wish the gym opened earlier, around 5:30 or at least 6:00 AM. That would be ideal for students like me who want to work out early, have enough time to get ready, and then head to college.

Another issue is that some machines take ages to get repaired. For example, the leg machine is often broken, and since there aren‚Äôt many leg machines available, you have to get creative‚Äîusing things like the medicine ball to train your legs.

There‚Äôs also a large red rack in the middle of the gym that takes up a lot of space. It doesn‚Äôt seem to serve much purpose, so it would be great if they could remove it and replace it with more useful equipment. Adding a fly machine and more leg machines would help‚Äîespecially so there are backups in case one breaks down.

Also, the ground area where you do the bench press has a slight gradient and is slippery, so the bench tends to slip while you‚Äôre using it. The benches themselves are fine‚Äîit‚Äôs just the surface they‚Äôre placed on that causes problems. Because of this, it‚Äôs hard to maintain proper alignment, which affects your form and muscle activation.

That said, the staff are really lovely‚Äîsuper friendly and helpful, although sometimes they can be a bit too picky. I also wish the climbing wall was free to use, especially if you want to go all the way up, as there seems to be a charge every time you use it.

All in all, aside from these issues, I think the gym is great. I‚Äôd give it a 3.5 out of 5 based on my experience
showerReviews.author: Amir ‚Ä¢_‚Ä¢

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been a member at JD Gyms Bradford, but I‚Äôm extremely concerned about safety. For nearly two weeks, there have been exposed mains sockets in the gym. This poses a serious risk of electric shock to anyone nearby, and it‚Äôs shocking that no one has noticed or addressed this issue.

According to the Health and Safety at Work Act 1974, the gym must ensure the health and safety of all employees and members, which includes maintaining a safe environment. By allowing exposed mains sockets to remain, the gym is failing to meet its duty of care.

Additionally, it violates the Electricity at Work Regulations 1989, which requires that all electrical systems be properly maintained to prevent hazards.

It‚Äôs unacceptable that such a hazardous situation has been allowed to persist. I urge management to take immediate action to address this and improve safety protocols. Until then, I cannot recommend this gym.

The toilets and showers area smell and are disgusting.

Do NOT get a shower they only stay on for 5 secs so you keep on pressing and its smells horrible

The socket in question is in the small area as you walk in on the right of the entrance mirrored with small section of weights and next to the treadmills
showerReviews.author: Coco West

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had a very upsetting experience at JD Gyms Bradford (Retail Park, Manningham Lane).

After completing my workout, using the sauna and shower, I returned to my locker to find that a JD Gyms staff member had broken my padlock and removed all of my belongings without my permission.

When I questioned staff, I was told they are ‚Äúallowed to break padlocks.‚Äù However:
‚Ä¢	There was no warning sign
‚Ä¢	No notice explaining locker rules
‚Ä¢	This is a 24/7 gym, and I was actively using the facilities at the time

My personal belongings were taken, including:
‚Ä¢	A full Cetaphil hygiene kit (shampoo, conditioner, face wash, etc.) worth approximately ¬£150
‚Ä¢	My weight lifting belt

Some items were never returned, and staff could not clearly explain whether they were thrown away or taken. This is completely unacceptable. Even if lockers are monitored, staff should not destroy locks or remove belongings without warning, and certainly not discard personal property.

If JD Gyms has a policy allowing this, items should be safely stored and returned, not lost or disposed of.

I am still waiting for either:
‚Ä¢	My full belongings to be returned, or
‚Ä¢	Reimbursement for the items taken

Very disappointed with how this was handled.
showerReviews.author: mohit vaghela

showerReviews.reviewText:
An aspiring blood and guts gym.

Located on the 3rd floor of Allerton Mills, Maxxout has plenty of floor space and high ceilings. Set over 2 mezanines: one for weights, the other, currently for cardio and functional training.

The plate loaded machines are unbranded though purported to be hammer strength. There are plenty of free weights and dumb bells available from 3kg up to 100kg. I was there around 6pm and it was not busy. That was refreshing.

There are plans to expand, too - a studio and some proper changing roons with lockers.

The parking could be better. It's at the rear of the mill complex and shared with the snooker club. It's not very well lit, I didn't see any security cameras, and it isn't smooth tarmac, so drive carefully.

There is also a boxing gym 2 floors down in the same building, but it's run by another business owner.

At the time of writing 02/12/2022, a day pass was ¬£7 and a rolling monthly contract is at ¬£25.

Update at 27/05/2024:
With membership increasing. It's getting busier at peak times. Management has also increased the number of machines which is great, but it is now cluttered. The floor is unsteady, cables are frayed and maintenance should be a priority. Don't let standards slip!
showerReviews.author: Hamid

locations.title: Kents Gym
locations.address: ÓÉà80 Undercliffe Rd, Bradford BD2 3BN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great gym of a decent size. Need to update some machinery and fix those broken. Make it obvious that the Ladies gym is not for men to work out upstairs or walk through. Steam room and sauna could do with fixing but told they won‚Äôt. Never had time to use them in the past but would do now.

The classes used to be great and varied but now just the same old classes. I attend quite a few of them and the teachers need to mix them up every few weeks like they used to years ago but they don‚Äôt. Plus, if it‚Äôs an hour‚Äôs class, make it an hour and not 50-55 minutes.

Gym members take the mickey by keeping permanent lockers and never clearing out every visit. I don‚Äôt think the staff care to check. Speaking of the staff, Julie is lovely and I hope she reads this and listens to the feedback. Over the years there‚Äôs been some stand out staff but they eventually leave, including the class instructors. Apart from Lucy and Michael, I don‚Äôt find the other staff friendly. They just stand and chat with the young lads all day!

The car park needs sorting out, too many pot holes. Kents need to tell the local children to keep out for the safety of themselves and of the gym members.

I know I‚Äôve generally given negative feedback but the positives are what remained in the past. I do like this gym overall as I‚Äôm clinging onto what it used to be.
showerReviews.author: Ramuhcho Ramuhcho

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good gym for getting fitter and staying in shape. Has plenty of lockers, good size and private car parking space (alot of gyms lack this and they tend to have shared parking spaces!)
Staff are always helpful and available when you need them.

However, at one point in time, they have both, steam room and sauna. During covid, these got shut down and never turned on ever since. This was one reason why I love coming to this gym.
This is shut down for good and the staff have already said that it will not be opening up again.

There could be a number of reason for this, such as members abusing the thermostat to get the place hotter, or simply because it's too costly to run but whatever it maybe, it's a shame it's no longer opening again.

Another let down is the "ladies only" section. This used to be a thing a few years ago but due to the abnormality certain people have this day and age, they believe a man can transform into a woman and use the ladies only section absolutely is insane!

The price is still decent and quote competitive with other local gyms, however, many other gyms are starting to open 24 hours. Would like to see some big improvement happen to this gym and I may concider coming back.
showerReviews.author: Trusted Reviews

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a really good gym. The staff are good, the equipment is really good and there's always an option of the weights/machine you want is being used.

The lack of a temperature adjuster in the showers really let's this gym down. You basically have two options, a freezing cold shower or a really hot shower. Not ideal for a gym of this calibre and it's the rare time staff seem to shrug-off your feedback.

There's an odd clip missing here and there but generally, the gym regularly invests lots in new equipment and offer good value for money.

locations.title: Energy Mill Gym Shipley
locations.address: ÓÉàWellcroft House, 5 Well Croft, Shipley BD18 3QH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Unlike most gyms, this one didn‚Äôt feel intimidating at all when we first walked in‚Äîit was the complete opposite of what I expected. The atmosphere felt welcoming from the get-go. The staff were not only super professional but also genuinely friendly and supportive. Big love to Chris, Vicki, and Sharon‚Äîthey were so easy to talk to and helped us out with every little question we had.

Even though I wasn‚Äôt nervous about joining, I was honestly surprised at just how calm and inviting the vibe is. It‚Äôs got that peaceful energy that actually motivates you to turn up and train‚Äînot something you find everywhere trust me I know its the 3rd gym I've tried to join.

The gym is loaded with top-quality equipment and a huge range of facilities: think group fitness classes, relaxing saunas, sunbeds, and even a red light laser therapy room (yes, really!). The bathrooms are just as impressive‚Äîspotless, stylish, with modern showers, spacious changing rooms, and secure lockers.

Best part? It‚Äôs open 24/7, so you‚Äôre getting real value for your money. With a massive selection of machines, dedicated women-only zones and sessions, and so many ways to move, sweat, and feel good‚Äîthis gym doesn‚Äôt just tick boxes. It makes working out something to look forward to.
showerReviews.author: Lailah Mushtaq

showerReviews.reviewText:
