showerReviews.reviewText:
The staff are great and very friendly, and it‚Äôs a 24 hour gym with a decent range of equipment which is good.
However, the equipment is incredibly worn. There are often ‚Äúout of order‚Äù signs on equipment and sometimes you get set up just to find it doesn‚Äôt work, like the cable row. The weights are also not correctly calibrated on the pulleys, meaning you need to precariously add free plates to the stack. Weights often aren‚Äôt put away by other clientele (I appreciate this isn‚Äôt the fault of the gym, there are plenty of signs up about putting things back) and the ceiling drips water.
There is a clear level of care from management, they‚Äôre always trying to improve areas and a new mens changing room has just been put in, but it‚Äôs the basics that are frustrating.
At ¬£40 a month it‚Äôs not a cheap gym either, and these issues are inexcusable. If it wasn‚Äôt so local and open 24 hours, I‚Äôd likely go to a different gym in the area.
If you live in the Shipley/ Saltaire area, this is probably the best gym in the area, but I‚Äôd like to see a lot more attention given to the equipment.
showerReviews.author: Samuel Barnard

locations.title: Club Energy Otley
locations.address: ÓÉàThe Old Tannery, 7 Station Rd, Otley LS21 3HX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantastic Gym, Thank You to Pat and Jo the business owners who are both very friendly and professional individuals, always working hard to ensure Club Energy is the friendliest gym and that members are happy. The facilities are great, the classes offered make it such great value for money and I‚Äôve mentioned before I love the showers!
A person who has battled an eating disorder, anxiety and body dysmorphia being a member at this gym has helped me build up strength not only physically but (more importantly) mentally.
My mental health has significantly increased since I became a member. In turn my confidence around body image has also improved. Massive shout out to Ali‚Äôs Circuit Class, I always feel ready to take on any challenges the week presents after experiencing his class, if you really want to push yourself, he is your man!
Monthly membership price is very reasonable too. If you‚Äôre on the fence about joining this gym, they even offer free day passes for you come experience it for yourself. Give it them a try, I did and now I'm addicted Club Energy is my happy place. Thanks again to the team. Claire M.
showerReviews.author: Claire Matthews

locations.title: Today's Extra
locations.address: ÓÉàGain Ln, Bradford BD2 3LW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Staff/Service: For many customers there is a barrier due to the lack of English Language, long waits during the day due to the only staff member available at the till also working on the Post Office counter. Also the use of own native language in front of non-speaking customers, giving the impression that customers are being spoke about. And lack of space provided for disabled persons due to stock being piled on aisles and portable shelving/baskets being put in inappropriate places.

Hygiene: Appalling cleanliness of both inside and outside of store, shelves caked in dust and vermin seen running around outside on the grounds. Food and drinks being sold past the use by date and months after best before.

Availability: Quite acceptable for a local convenience, snacks, cleaning products and everyday essentials stocked majority of the time.

Price Fairness: Ridiculous amount charged for products, constant price hikes and priced marked products being sold above price. Change given incorrect many times within the day and pay-point amounts not correct.

Security/Protocols: Numerous breaches of age limits when dealing with Scratchcards, age restricted items, alcohol and cigarettes. Customer safety in jeopardy due to drunken customers, threats of violence and the inability to walk safety across the car park area in front of the store.
showerReviews.author: JD Sudren

locations.title: Arkwright House - iQ Student Accommodation Bradford
locations.address: ÓÉà16 Tumbling Hill St, Bradford BD7 1DB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had an awful year living here I am very happy my contract ended and I finally left this place.

It's too noisy, too overpriced, the staff it's not helpful and they don't care about you, maintenance is bad, it's just awful.

I had a bad situation with my flatmates. I had classes at uni every morning or working part-time but they were hosting parties every night. I asked them nicely for one month to stop but they didn't care. Then I reached out to the reception about this and they told me to call security. I called it one time , they just stop for the night and then next night they were partying again. Called second time same situation. And then after I called the 3'rd time they got angry and came and knocked aggressively at my door 5 times in a row. I called security again because of that and when he came they were fighting and shouting at the security guy for 1 hour. After this in the morning I went to the reception as soon as they opened. After all this, all they did was giving them a phonecall. I asked to be moved because I had enough and after that night I also didn't feel safe to live there anymore. And they didn't want to move me because the only available room was one that was more expensive than the one I had. I found that very unprofessional. They keep the logs of the times security goes to someone. They should've given a phonecall after the very first time the security was called not when the situation gets aggressive. Also the contract itself mentions that you are not allowed to be noisy from 11 pm till 7 am. Why they can just breach the contract so many times with no consequences and I have to suffer sleepless nights. And of course they didn't stop but I felt hopeless to reach out again to the staff members. Even outside people always partying, screaming in the parking, a guy blasting music from his car all night, but nobody does anything.

Also whenever the maintenance guy was coming he was leaving a mess behind. If it was a clogged shower I was finding water splashed everywhere. I reported the vacuum cleaner once and he left a pile of dust in the kitchen.

One day before my contract ending the staff members came to knock at my door to remind me my rent is ending. I found that rude. I know my rent is ending you don't have to come at my door to tell me. They sent email and phone messages reminders about that the days before anyways.
showerReviews.author: delia daniela

showerReviews.reviewText: Super couple of nights at Upwood but not only for the usual reasons. Great site, nice pitches, lovely view, clean facilities and a really buzzin' clubhouse serving great food goes without saying. But the wonderful staff did more than we could expect diagnosing the problem with our motorhomne that failed to start when leaving. Fellow campers and a pro mecahnic who happened to be on site all did their best to get the beast going but to no avail. We were relayed home later. The generosity, friendliness and genuine concern showed by all restores your faith in humanity. And a special mention to site staff Dave, Geoff, Isaac and Karen. Troopers one and all. Thankyou.
showerReviews.author: BEV Middleton

The facilities were very good with warm showers and clean toilets and a laundry room. The rest of our stay was pleasant.

Booked last minute as somewhere to get my head down before a big bike ride the following day. If I'm honest, I was looking for the cheapest I could find to camp, so wasn't really expecting much. I was very pleased with the site when I got there. Tidy and well kept.

Tim was so helpful when I arrived. The wash/toilet facilities were very good. I was a bit put off at the 50p shower cost, but they were more than good enough. The views were great too. Thanks Brown Bank.

locations.address: ÓÉàHolderness Rd, Hull HU8 8JU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Recommend üëç
This is a great place to loads of different sports or get food.
Parking: free parking for customers but on busy days there is a chance of no available spaces and you have just enough room to manouver to park so wouldn't recommend those who would struggle with that.
Swimming: 2 main sections. Main pool + teaching pool (more olympic and standard) and fun pool + toddler pool. The fun pool offers a waterslide, wave-machine (ü§Ø), small kidslide, etc.
Gym: decent gym with all that you would need from a gym at a more affordable price to competitors like JD. Unfortunately, during busy times you may have to wait fairly long for a machine or wieghts. Also, when equipment is damaged, it is usually fixed or replaced after a long time.
Sports hall: I have booked for badminton and it does the job.
Squash: courts available but haven't tried it.
Classes: recommended by a few to me.

I had an absolutely wonderful experience at Woodford Leisure Centre! The leisure pool is perfect for all ages, with warm, clean water and fun features that keep everyone entertained. It‚Äôs spacious but still feels safe and well-organized.

A special mention goes to the lifeguards, who were incredibly professional, attentive, and friendly. It was making sure everyone was safe while still creating a welcoming and relaxed.

In the leisure pool they have waves and slide for everyone to enjoy.

The teaching pool at Woodford Leisure Centre is absolutely fantastic! It‚Äôs warm, clean, and perfectly designed for beginners for young children and adults. The shallow depth makes it feel very safe and welcoming, which is great for building water confidence. The instructors are friendly, patient, and really know how to make learning fun. I couldn‚Äôt recommend it more highly for anyone looking for a great place to start swimming!

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Woodford Leisure Centre is a modern facility located in Holderness Road, Hull. The centre offers a range of fitness activities and classes, including a gym, swimming pool, group exercise classes, and sports courts. The gym has a good range of equipment, including cardio machines, weight machines, and free weights.

The swimming pool is 25 meters long and has lanes for swimming laps. There is also a separate children's pool for younger swimmers. The centre offers swimming lessons for all ages and abilities.

In addition to the fitness facilities, the Woodford Leisure Centre has a cafe and a soft play area for children. The centre is also accessible for people with disabilities, with disabled parking, accessible changing rooms, and lifts.

It is important to consider privacy concerns when it comes to sharing pictures of people swimming. In many cases, individuals do not want their images shared publicly without their consent, especially in situations where they may be in a state of undress or wearing swimsuits.

Sharing images of people swimming without their consent can be a violation of their privacy rights, and can also be seen as inappropriate or intrusive. In order to respect the privacy of all individuals and to abide by facility policies, it is best not to include pictures of people swimming in reviews of swimming centres or facilities. Instead, it is more appropriate to focus on the amenities and services offered, as well as the overall experience of using the facility.

Overall, the Woodford Leisure Centre is a well-equipped and modern facility that offers a range of fitness activities and classes. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the centre is accessible for people with disabilities. If you are looking for a fitness centre in Hull, the Woodford Leisure Centre is definitely worth considering.

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time visitors. Traveled from Scunthorpe with high hopes for the leisure pool. Wheelchair user and two carers. We needed the changing spaces facilities which were all in working order. This was just off the reception area. But we had a long walk to the pool using the pool pod chair ( this is very low chair). Had to take wheelchair and belongings with us.... staff weren't very helpful. Just pointed the way. One chap did help guide us in the right direction.
Pool looked good.... but a bit tired. Wave machine only came on once and the water was a bit  cool. We stayed in as long as we could cope with.
Long hike back to the changing room. Floors very slippery
Over all not a great experience üòï....who ever plans these facilities obviously doesn't have a clue!!!
Why aren't the changing facilities poolside??
showerReviews.author: Zoe Capell-Fenwick

showerReviews.reviewText: Attended a baby group today with around 20 babys. Pool was clean. The group was great. However there's 1 baby changing table in only 1 cubicle. I had to lay my 5month old on his towel on a very small cubicle floor and try get us both dry and changed then had to find another mum to hold him while I used the toilet. Not even a changing table in the disabled facilities. The car park is a long distance to carry baby from. The changing area is unisex so has no benches or anywhere to lay baby. I now understand why they wanted full payment upfront.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beverley Road Baths underwent refurbishment in 2021 to modernise the facilities and also to conserve the heritage  of the building. Most noticeably, the wonderful art nouveau inspired reception and entrance hall.
The tiles are a fine testament to the artistic and skilled manufacturing of a period when Britain was at the forefront of design and production.
The refurbished swimming pool  and new gym are once again giving local people somewhere to enjoy and keep fit.
This is the first step in the ongoing and much needed improvement to regeneration and retention of the cultural heritage of Beverley Road.
Hull City Council should be congratulated for undertaking this scheme that will undoubtedly improve the area for the people of Hull and attract investment to benefit the city into the future.
showerReviews.author: Michael Rieveley

showerReviews.reviewText:
Ive just cancelled my membership after 18months. Most staff are fantastic and helpful. The gym has mostly modern equipment but the air-conditioning never works so no good for people that suffer seizures when they over heat. Classes are great if you can get on them. People with old passes can book before everyone else and the rest must book for the following week while they're still in the class.
The changing rooms are constantly filthy. Some women think leaving tampax applicators in changing cubicles is OK!!? (Obviously not the staff fault on that occasion, nor is it kids or elderly) the family changing always has dirty floors and the showers just soak the entire room. There's not enough slope.
The soap grime on the shower walls (in female) has not been cleaned once in my time here.
Staff change over is ridiculous as the company doesn't care enough for their staff. 0hour contracts is unacceptable! Jess is fantastic and really encouraging. Charlie was great but he left. Francis was great also another that left.
The gym only has instructors available to help if they're doing a hit class. There's never staff around.
The pool area is usually clean. I don't fancy my chances with the life guards that sit eating or picking their nails. The jacuzzi gets randomly closed off and reopened throughout the day. (I've watched the sign being moved). The swim lanes often have old gents walking in them having a good chat. So I've decided ill save some money and go back to the council gym that I never had this many complaints about.
showerReviews.author: Samantha Abigail Knaggs

locations.title: David Lloyd Hull
locations.address: ÓÉàRaich Carter Wy., Hull HU7 3DB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: The best decision I have ever made for me and my child was joining David Lloyds club. It has transformed our life. Steph was so lovely at showing me around and answering all my questions. She made me feel excited about joining as she has such passion for the club. I went for a look around to potentially join myself, however I was completely blown away of how much it has a family feel to it and therefore joined my 5 year old too. I had lots of questions about the kids club, as my son is non verbal and autistic and Steph got Jack to come over to put my mind at ease. I am blown away by how inclusive you are and how trained your staff are, you should be so proud. Jack was really supportive and understanding and offered a slow transition for my son. My son loves the pool and his 1-1 swimming lessons. He smiles every time we enter the club, it has made him so happy and created a new routine for us. I have been a member for over two months now and it‚Äôs a wonderful place to be, not only to exercise but also to relax. It‚Äôs like a mini haven. I couldn‚Äôt recommend joining enough ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

locations.title: Total Fitness Hull
locations.address: ÓÉàBusiness Park, Beverley Rd, Cottingham HU10 6ED, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been a member for 23 years and have seen the deterioration of what once was a decent gym. It is now completely overcrowded with teenagers using it like it‚Äôs a nightclub and training in packs. No policing from gym staff despite me flagging again and again. It is so dirty now and bins overflowing with dirty tissues and rubbish on the floor. Thick dust and dirty windows, peeling paint all along the rafters. I don‚Äôt think the ladies sauna floor has ever been cleaned ever. I‚Äôve not been in the pool for years as people come out and say it‚Äôs like a holiday pool with so many teenagers shouting and messing around you can‚Äôt swim. They mess about rather than train and because no one calls out the ones who don‚Äôt put their gym equipment away or are messing about on the gym floor, they continue to disrespect the gym. If the staff has standards and enforced rules there might be more respect. My son also tells me the men use the sauna naked with no towel and nothing is done. Massive hygiene issues and no one cares. I do wonder why developers can‚Äôt see a niche market to build a new one-people would move en masse.
showerReviews.author: Joanne Kemp

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was a member when the club first opened and rejoined 2 yrs ago after returning from 15 yrs living away. Unfortunately it feels like a lot of the equipment, particularly the pin resistance machines are still the originals!
The gym recently had a refurbishment but unfortunately non of the pin resistance equipment was changed, just some multi stations and new flooring so still the same old stuff that keeps breaking, pins missing or bits falling off.

A lot of the cardio was changed but the new stuff isn‚Äôt great quality and feels quite small plus there has been a reduction in the amount of bikes, particularly recumbent, now just one recumbent bike on the first floor and one on the ground floor which is unacceptable for a club of this size and membership!

Also less cross trainers and now in the worst place in the gym, in direct sunshine!

Same old problems with gangs of youths permanently on phones hogging equipment and lack of basic hygiene at pool areas such as not showering after leaving sauna and jumping straight in pool, staff used to be a lot more vigilant on that kind of thing plus early teen kids in steam room, not ideal when trying to relax!

Changing rooms are a big issue, fed up of dodging people‚Äôs cameras and videos when I‚Äôm trying to get changed while they take pictures in the mirrors‚Ä¶pretty sure that should be looked at particularly when small children around in the changing rooms, no cameras allowed at the pool so why are they allowed in the changing rooms?

Also not being able to get to hairdryers and mirrors for bags, shoes and dirty/wet clothes on the counter tops‚Ä¶Some signs or vigilance please!!

Also would it be so hard to take a towel to the pool rather than come back into changing rooms dripping wet to get one out of the locker!
Club also needs to police the lockers better and remove locks as not enough lockers at peak times.

The aircon is non existent and for a club with a glass roof it really needs sorting as it‚Äôs borderline dangerous on hot sunny days! Just putting a few big fans around doesn‚Äôt cut it I‚Äôm afraid and really does put you off when you walk in to a wall of heat!

Good sized club with plenty of facilities but for a premium price gym, I would expect better, unfortunately the lack of viable alternatives I feel keeps people here!
showerReviews.author: Mike Matthews

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was a member when the club first opened and rejoined 2 yrs ago after returning from 15 yrs living away. Unfortunately it feels like a lot of the equipment, particularly the pin resistance machines are still the originals!
The gym recently had a refurbishment but unfortunately non of the pin resistance equipment was changed, just some multi stations and new flooring so still the same old stuff that keeps breaking, pins missing or bits falling off.

A lot of the cardio was changed but the new stuff isn‚Äôt great quality and feels quite small plus there has been a reduction in the amount of bikes, particularly recumbent, now just one recumbent bike on the first floor and one on the ground floor which is unacceptable for a club of this size and membership!

Also less cross trainers and now in the worst place in the gym, in direct sunshine!

Same old problems with gangs of youths permanently on phones hogging equipment and lack of basic hygiene at pool areas such as not showering after leaving sauna and jumping straight in pool, staff used to be a lot more vigilant on that kind of thing plus early teen kids in steam room, not ideal when trying to relax!

Changing rooms are a big issue, fed up of dodging people‚Äôs cameras and videos when I‚Äôm trying to get changed while they take pictures in the mirrors‚Ä¶pretty sure that should be looked at particularly when small children around in the changing rooms, no cameras allowed at the pool so why are they allowed in the changing rooms?

Also not being able to get to hairdryers and mirrors for bags, shoes and dirty/wet clothes on the counter tops‚Ä¶Some signs or vigilance please!!

Also would it be so hard to take a towel to the pool rather than come back into changing rooms dripping wet to get one out of the locker!
Club also needs to police the lockers better and remove locks as not enough lockers at peak times.

The aircon is non existent and for a club with a glass roof it really needs sorting as it‚Äôs borderline dangerous on hot sunny days! Just putting a few big fans around doesn‚Äôt cut it I‚Äôm afraid and really does put you off when you walk in to a wall of heat!

Good sized club with plenty of facilities but for a premium price gym, I would expect better, unfortunately the lack of viable alternatives I feel keeps people here!
showerReviews.author: Mike Matthews

showerReviews.reviewText:
The review is only for Swimming academy!
My daughter joined swimming classes with Lucy Chrost when she was three, and she now moved level up as she turned 4. We absolutely love every lesson with Lucy! She always finds energy to deal with kids with a smile, makes lessons fun, interactive, inclusive. I was amazed witnessing her, there was one day when she was In the middle of explaining the next exercise to the kids and one of the students was messing about and put arm bands on his feet. She stopped almost mid sentence and immediately turned over to the kid and explained why it is unsafe to do that. Because it was a safety thing. I was amazed! Very grateful and happy to be part for team splosh!
showerReviews.author: Natalya Taylor

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member of this gym for a few months now, and unfortunately, I would not recommend it to friends or family.

From Monday to Wednesday, the gym is extremely busy, making it nearly impossible to get time on the machines. There aren‚Äôt enough weight machines or cable options, and a lot of the equipment is old, run-down, or even broken. For the price they charge, you‚Äôd expect the equipment to be in much better condition‚Äîand for there to be more of it.

They‚Äôve recently introduced new cardio equipment, which is great, but they really need to invest in more weight machines as well.

A large portion of the gym is occupied by children. While it‚Äôs great to see younger generations staying active, many come in groups of four or five, taking up entire areas. This makes it difficult to get a proper workout and can also be intimidating for women, as some can be loud and obnoxious.

Even if you manage to find an available machine, you‚Äôll often be asked, "How many sets do you have left?" before you even start. It‚Äôs frustrating and creates a rushed, overcrowded atmosphere. Some tend to stand and wait, which again, makes it very uncomfortable for a women to do her workout.

I gave 2 stars mainly because Bridie was very welcoming during onboarding, and the swimming and sauna facilities are an advantage.

In my opinion, this gym feels like it should be priced around ¬£30-¬£35 per month, not the ¬£50+ they charge. The value just isn‚Äôt there.
showerReviews.author: Hammid Arfan

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have been attending swimming lessons every Saturday with my daughter for the past few weeks and, up until now, everything seemed fine. However, today‚Äôs experience was extremely disappointing. My 7-year-old daughter accidentally went into the wrong toilet (female) and instead of handling the situation with understanding, we were accused of using the wrong facilities although she‚Äôs a female but apparently we‚Äôre not allowed there.

It‚Äôs rather concerning that the expectation seems to be for a 7-year-old girl to go into the male changing area, where she could be exposed to adult men getting changed and exposed to men‚Äôs genitalia, Apparently, that‚Äôs considered more appropriate.

Very disappointing attitude toward children and parents. I hope this feedback encourages some common sense and sensitivity when dealing with young kids and the members in the future.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Waudby library and sports centre is a popular destination for residents of Great Field Estate in Hull, offering a range of services and facilities to suit the needs of the local community. The library has a comprehensive collection of books, magazines, and other materials, with something to suit every interest and age group. Whether you're looking for a quiet place to read or need help with research, the library staff are always on hand to offer assistance.

The sports centre at Waudby is equally impressive, with a range of facilities for sports enthusiasts of all ages and abilities. There is a well-equipped gym, a swimming pool, and a sports hall that can be used for a variety of activities, including basketball, badminton, and volleyball. The centre also offers a range of fitness classes, including yoga, pilates, and spin.

Overall, Waudby library and sports centre is a great facility for the local community, offering a range of services and activities to suit everyone. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the facilities are well-maintained and modern. Whether you're looking for a place to read, exercise, or socialize, Waudby is definitely worth a visit.

The staff were so lovely and helped with us on the day too. After working in the same industry I can tell you that it is stressful but to have support from the staff really helped. Couldn‚Äôt recommend this place anymore.
showerReviews.author: gracie beadle

locations.title: The Gym Group Beverley
locations.address: ÓÉàUnit 2, Victoria Retail Park, Victoria Rd, Beverley HU17 8XE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: You pay for what you get, It does the job. The gyms internal aesthetic is ok as it clearly appeals to the younger generations, being an introvert I would prefer a darker less lit tone to the gym. It is very bright with lights and cameras everywhere. Upon entrance bizarrely you have to walk through the centre of the gym where other people are working out to get to the changing rooms, this is awkward as people are moving about frantically at times, if you come and go in your gym gear this wouldn't be a problem, but for those that don't, it is awkward. The music pumping out daily is on loop and is generic dance instrumental, audio torture in my own opinion (Headphones are a must). A change would be good! A nice assortment of resistance machines and a good selection of budget quality free weights, benches, barbells, Olympic squat racks, but seemingly only one bench press quietly placed in the corner, for a movement such as this how they rationalise this is a mystery, The cardio machines are mid 00s quality, old but do the job however you are facing a giant mirror, not a wall with motivational pictures on which I personally would prefer. Bizarrely 60% of the lockers have broken locks deeming them unusable, so where does one secure there belongings. I feel for anyone attending when its busy as they only have 3 toilets / showers which are combined, so you'll have a wait. I have seen some very unclean floors here which can only be a cleaning staffing issue, but to be fair its hit and miss as other days i see cleaners in there making it clean. There is a separate area for bodyweight exercises / abs which is considerate however seems a little crowded, There are the usual overpriced snack machines selling processed so called (healthy snacks and drinks) there are no hand towels, no disinfectant for machines and benches, however they do supply free drinking water which is pleasant and a must to be fair even at this price point. I have not met any staff but have seen one or two about the place, fire extinguishers and fire escapes are present if you look for them, not a fan of the keypad revolving door method of access, Overall on balance for less than ¬£1 a day you get what you pay for and this should be considered when taking out a membership, speaking of memberships a real positive is being able to start a membership in minutes via the app or website, and same for cancellations, simply cancel your DD 4 days before the next one is due and that's it, cancelled, no contracts, no paperwork, no face to face conversations persuading you to stay on, this for me is a huge plus as I tend to go to a gym sporadically throughout the year so the ability to come and go is great. Beverley is a better place for this establishment as obviously exercise has far reaching benefits that this place enables, there is a Morrison's a few yards away for pre and post workout fuel, or getting tea, a petrol station a few yards away which is convenient and a not so convenient Mcdonalds opposite the gym, Car parking could be an issue on busy weekends, but not for me when i attend bright and early there's ample space, parking is free but may have time restrictions.
showerReviews.author: Stephen Meyers

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have recently joined the gym to find the equipment is old, functional but has no quick change of speed like modern one's do. they also have no ability to connect with your SmartWatch or phone to share data, or screen with entertainment.

There is a fair spead of machinery and weights benches.

The shower cubicles are decent, private and get the job done however they are also combined with the toilet and there is only three of them so if there are people getting showerd/ changed there are no toilets available.

They don't not provide any blue role or spray to clean down the machines / weight benches that'll get very sweaty, they expect you to wipe them down with your personal face towel, when the gym is staffed a member will go around cleaning however for 12 hours a day they are not staffed. Considering there was over 40 people in with no staff that's a lot of dirty sweat.

There is a reasonable amount of lockers but none of them work, nearly all the cam locks are broken therefore unfunctionable.

It Is fantastic that it is opened 24 hours unfortunately they are neglecting the things that really matter which is clearly a financial decision.

Somewhat disappointing really
showerReviews.author: Mike Kelly

locations.title: Energie Fitness Scunthorpe
locations.address: ÓÉàEnergie Fitness, Mannaberg Way, Scunthorpe DN15 8XF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great gym, can't be beaten when it comes to cardio as there's alot of different machines. Showers aren't good as they're small, you hang a towel on the inside door and it'll get soaked so I have to throw it well over the door, also the lockers are rusty inside and some of them are hard to turn the handle to close, you'll need to bring your own padlock and make sure it's thin enough to fit.
There's a upstairs open plan too and that's for legs, good selection and also classes you can book on the app which is a brilliant idea. Not been to one yet but planning on doing.
Good staff, free water ( been to other gyms that have no water and charge for small bottles)
Brilliant opening/closing times especially for shift workers.
Big car park free parking.
Even a jukebox for the public which is definitely different.
The weights are okay plenty to go at but I find some other gyms are more upper weight happy with more machines.
Big, open plan sort of gym and a fingerprint scanner to get in. (Has a face scanner now)
Would be great if it was 24/7 but the times are good enough really.
6am/11pm mon/Thurs
6am/10pm Fri
7am/8pm Sat/Sun
As it stands at this time.
Id check online times to be sure.

Money wise it's okay.
You can go into 6 months contract for around ¬£22 a month roughly.
Or ¬£35 a month roughly for no contact.
Different tiers of membership perks like the "WOW Membership" gives you access to classes and free coffee and bring a friend with you two or three times a week if they have no membership.
You also get discounts on the app for under armour gear and others.
Hope this helps.

UPDATE
Lockers have been sorted so I've changed my rating to 5 starts from 4.
Brilliant staff and great equipment.

UPDATE 2025
No More juke box, think its broken.
Now the gym have a big speaker on playing alot of Dance music so if tgats not your thing like myself,  bring your earphones.
Cause heavy metal is my Jam.
New machines which is always great!
Still my favourite gym for the last 3 years, although like alot of gyms nowadays its really busy so going outside peak times is best. Still wished it was 24/7 like Reso 24 but its open till 11pm through the week so not bad.
Staff are brilliant üëèüèª always have been.
Steve is a legend and happy to help.
showerReviews.author: Danny Niland

locations.title: Welcome Break Burtonwood East Services M62
locations.address: ÓÉà8, M62, Burtonwood, Warrington WA5 3AX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Im going to give this one star for the following reason;

Driving around the site is like doing some seriously off road driving the kind you would expect deep in the amazonian rain forest, but no need to travel that far it is here just of the M62, who knew?

The fuel pumps are disgusting and there were no gloves, diesel all over the floor being washed into drains great help to the environment that üëç
These pumps are also the slowest pumps i have ever come across, fine if you are filling a small family hatchback, not however if you need to fill a 460l lorry tank some 20 minutes later and its finally full.
Need a quick toilet break? Sure they have toilets in the filling station merely shown a cloth in the vain hope that it will magically clean themselves, cleaned by hopes and dreams does not a satisfactory clean make. Be careful of the ladies hand dryer it is cracked all over and not very safe and will dry your hands much the same speed as an asthmatic mouse coughing On them. But if that wasnt enough wait till it rains and the rutted road turns in a lake much more fun dodging puddles when walking around!
This really isnt acceptable for people who pay over the odds for fuel and food in these bandit based stop shops

Do better!
showerReviews.author: Katie Oakley-Spencer

‚Ä¢	Dining Options: A selection of eateries such as Burger King, KFC, Starbucks, Subway, and The Good Breakfast.  Ôøº
‚Ä¢	Shopping: Retail outlets like WHSmith and Waitrose & Partners for convenience and groceries.  Ôøº
‚Ä¢	Parking: Free parking is available for up to 2 hours. For longer stays, payment can be made via the PayByPhone app or by calling 0330 400 7275. The car park includes designated Blue Badge parking bays and electric vehicle charging points.  Ôøº Ôøº
‚Ä¢	Hotel: An on-site Days Inn hotel offers family-friendly accommodations with comfortable rooms and unlimited Wi-Fi.  Ôøº
‚Ä¢	Additional Amenities: Facilities such as accessible toilets, baby changing facilities, a Changing Places facility, free Wi-Fi, and a petrol station with both accessible and standard fuel pumps.  Ôøº

The services are open 24 hours a day, providing convenience for travelers at any time.

For more detailed information, including accessibility features and specific services, you can refer to the AccessAble guide for Welcome Break Fleet Southbound.  Ôøº

locations.address: ÓÉàHickling, A46, A606, Melton Mowbray LE14 3QG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Female lorry driver
Been using the services since it opened
It a brilliant spot on the A46
Lovely services still kept nice and clean
Staff very friendly and you can see they enjoy there job
Toilets for very clean in the ladies nice to see the flowers in there

Now for the disappointing bit female showers ..... lovely room high standard finish üëå showers are cold been informing staff from the beginning and Unfortunately been in today after not using for 3 weeks weather not has warm now which will make a big difference, not so bad in shower having cold showers üòÄ but still cold to the point of freezing
Tap water from sink when on full hot, i can leave my hand under it running

I'm afraid I won't be using the shower facility again till this is adjusted
Wouldn't mind put its a temperate control on the shower to adjust to your own liking

College has been in today 15/10/25 to use the showers (male showers) to which i was emailed stating the male showers where the same and have been sorted to which im informed they are too cold ü•∂
So looks like a problem has you will be loosing custome when drivers cant get a hot shower after a long day on the roads
showerReviews.author: JOANNE BOOTH

locations.title: Hull Trinity Backpackers
locations.address: ÓÉà51-52 Market Pl, Hull HU1 1RQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The establishment was easy to find and is close to a Tesco express which is great to buy a ready meal to heat up in the microwave.
The staff were lovely and showed me around. The rooms were nice and the bunks had curtains for those that like privacy.
My bed was comfortable and I was able to hire a towel.
There is tea, milk and sugar in the kitchen and stuff for breakfast and they ask for a donation towards breakfast. I was disappointed there was no coffee. The Tesco express has a Costa Coffee machine though. Coffee is advertised in reception but I think I was up too early as there was no one in reception.
Will definitely stay here again.
showerReviews.author: Lee-Ann

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed a night after picking up a camper van. (Hence no stars for rooms - it's not applicable).

The facilities are great - spacious shower cubicles and nice hot water! The site has good space between pitches and they have a black chicken who guards reception and 3 turkeys who are free ranging across the site. There are moorhens around the pond and the site is in a country location.

The warden was really helpful. He lent us a kettle as we had no gas and was great, with advice and offers of help. A BIG thank you to him. Also we chatted with another staff member who was really nice and very friendly.

Take aways can be delivered (we needed one as we had no gas!) - we had Indian but I believe there was also Chinese and Kebabs available. We enjoyed our meal & ate in the bar where there is TV.

Shame we were only there for the night
showerReviews.author: Vivien Hughes-Jones

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText: we had a camper place. it is not a quiet campsite, there is a busy road along it where cars drive far too fast. The website says ADULTS ONLY. But there were still a lot of children!! And it was busy until late at night with all kinds of guests who came for parties that were held there. Furthermore, we found the shower/toilet areas not really clean. After 4 days, one toilet still contained a feeding bottle with a baby's milk. After 4 days there was still a mop bucket with dirty water, which had not been emptied once, and you then have to mop the shower floor with it, not really fresh. You could throw away the waste separately, but no one observed this, it was a big mess, everything was mixed up. no control at all
showerReviews.author: T van de Geest.

locations.title: WoodLake Campsite & Caravan Park
locations.address: ÓÉàMoat farm, Mappleton Rd, Great Hatfield, Hull HU11 4UP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Had a brilliant 4 nights at this campsite. Everything was spot on, toilets and showers were immaculate, and red hot with a lovely warm radiator for the cold mornings. Lovely peaceful surroundings with rabbits and deer in the field. Had a crow visit us every day looking for food. The dog park was amazing and very popular but not over crowded, and the woodland walk was great for dogs too. Sheryl the owner even gave our little dog a pigs ear, which he loved. Five star site, we will be back, thank you.
showerReviews.author: Susan Haigh

showerReviews.reviewText: We booked this place as it sounded ok, we were surprised to find it was a very new site and everything looked new and pristine condition, the owners met us and explained where all the facilities were, the cubicles all had a shower, toilet and wash basin all excellent condition and cleaned regularly. A bus service just nearby takes you to the nearest town and seaside, a local beach is about 10 minutes walk away, we actually saw a seal that came up onto the beach where we were standing. Nice site and highly recommended by me.

The outside seating area is very swanky and again spotless. Such attention to detail in all areas, it really is stunning. So looking forward to our next visit.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This site is a peaceful gem, we stayed for 5 nights and had a great time. Very spacious hard standing pitches with grass sides and back ,all with electric hook up 16amp, your own water point ,free wifi. Spacious wheel chair friendly Toilet block with 6 immaculate rooms ,shower toilet wash basin mirror coat hooks bench and hand dryer, all cleaned to top standard. Terri and Rob go to the next level to make your stay special. We were greeted on arrival with an information sheet and a lovely smile. We chose which pitch we wanted, all excellent and flat.Theres an onsite bar  with tvs ,its 'The Keg Shed' beautiful comfortable lounge with  a modern twist. Comfy sofas or trendy table and chairs, a log fire and a games room. Theres an outside covered area also with a tv. Its Dog friendly with a dog wash , grey waste and elson point. There is also a holiday home for hire on site. Theres a flat camping field for the tenters with electric or without.
The beach is 10min walk on the pavement , ideal for exercising your dog before hosing them down back at the dog wash. Theres a pub five mins off site ideal for meals out., although Fridays and Saturdays theres food available in the Keg Shed onsite.. massive thankyou to Terri and Rob  ,look forward to returning soon.
showerReviews.author: Stephen Bulcock

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a lovely campsite on the East Coast.

The owners are friendly and very accommodating. The pitches are all hardstanding in the main camp area, with a few being fully serviced. Every pitch has a water supply though.

A smaller camping area is available as grass pitches, although I think these may be reserved for smaller campervans only. I've not seen any caravans in there.

The toilet/shower block is always immaculate. The owners never stop! The rubbish bins are emptied daily and there are plenty situated around the camp.

The site is dog friendly and there is even a dog bath, should you need it.

The site is a 10min walk from Cowden Beach. This is a dog friendly beach made up of sand and sparadic pebbled bits. At the top of the road is a cafe that sells a bit of everything needed, should you forget dog things or beach toys.

5min drive to Hornsea in one direction and 20mins from withernsea the other.

The campsite does have a bar called The Keg Shed. Very reasonable pricing on all drinks. This is open Friday/Saturday! Sunday evenings from around 4pm

A large screen TV usually shows one sport or another and a game of bingo on Saturday evening. Prize is well worth playing for.
showerReviews.author: Matthew Till

showerReviews.reviewText: I would highly recommend this gem of a campsite so much so we are returning in a few weeks with a group of friends. locations.title: Sand le Mere Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉàSouthfield Ln, Tunstall, Hull HU12 0JN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I booked a family break for the October half term.   I booked a gold plus dog friendly caravan as we had 2 dogs with us.  We checked in at 4 we did arrived a little earlier and had a drink in the bar but no dogs aloud inside so had to sit out in the cold.   When we went in the caravan was so dirty, we had mould growing up the walls,  radiators full of dirt and hairs.  Under the cooker hasn‚Äôt been looked at for months had hairs food and even dog teats under there.   The carpet had stains and the sofa had stains. The bathroom was full of mould around the shower and smelt of wee. The water was white no matter how long it was run for they just said it was an issue with Yorkshire water , we had no bottled water and no offer of any water either.    It was the worst caravan I had ever stayed in and I‚Äôve stayed in bronze and never had a problem.   My husband went to reception Tuesday and complained as we didn‚Äôt have a frying pan either so they sent one eventually and the lady who brought it came in with bleach spray and cleaned it was uncomfortable and didn‚Äôt work.   On Thursday I asked to speak to the manager who basically told me a gold plus just means we have heating and double glazing!! I said after my cleanliness problems I looked at the reviews which I should have before I went maybe and she said take them with a pinch of salt people like to moan! Well my review is honest.   I have never stayed somewhere so dirty.
Even the swimming pool was shut most of our break could only use is once.
showerReviews.author: Lisa Massey

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very good location  when visiting  Beverley as we did on the 13th December 25 for the Christmas market, very close to Liddle Morrisons express, petrol station  and Costa coffee.
Stayed for three days in a touring caravan, unfortunately this site is not geared up to accept tourers.
The pitches are constructed for mobile homes and as such  are  totally inappropriate. High kerbs,difficult to get on the pitch even with motormovers, despite  a very helpful young man who dragged plates onto the grass to help monouver over the grass.
Toilet/ shower block excellent, unfortunately  couldn't use the showers as only tokens accepted but not made aware of this when  checking in, in fact no on site information given.
Site office unmanned despite posting hours between 1.00 and 5.00pm, security none existent and main gate left open, the whole site was exceptionally quiet, at this time of year, wonder why?
Will not return
showerReviews.author: Garry Warrington

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very good location  when visiting  Beverley as we did on the 13th December 25 for the Christmas market, very close to Liddle Morrisons express, petrol station  and Costa coffee.
Stayed for three days in a touring caravan, unfortunately this site is not geared up to accept tourers.
The pitches are constructed for mobile homes and as such  are  totally inappropriate. High kerbs,difficult to get on the pitch even with motormovers, despite  a very helpful young man who dragged plates onto the grass to help monouver over the grass.
Toilet/ shower block excellent, unfortunately  couldn't use the showers as only tokens accepted but not made aware of this when  checking in, in fact no on site information given.
Site office unmanned despite posting hours between 1.00 and 5.00pm, security none existent and main gate left open, the whole site was exceptionally quiet, at this time of year, wonder why?
Will not return
showerReviews.author: Garry Warrington

showerReviews.reviewText: This review is for the touring part... Excellent location, within walking distance of the wonderful Beverley Minster, and Beverley town centre, Hull and the east coast resorts, are close by. The site is still being developed but the usable part is well maintained. The touring pitches are static bases, so large. When booking make sure your pitch has all the services, not all of them have. The pitches are a bit fiddly poisoning the caravan on the pitch,  if you have a motor mover its fine. Toilets and showers are clean and cleaned twice a day. The showers are the most expensive I've come across  at ¬£2.50    tokens only, purchased  at reception, the electric is included so maybe that balances it out. Overall, a quiet site good location and friendly helpful staff.
showerReviews.author: Richard P

locations.title: Cherry Burton Leisure Park
locations.address: ÓÉàLeconfield Road, Cherry Burton, Beverley HU17 7LJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed for 4 nights. Came close to leaving after the first night due to lack of sleep.
Site was clean and well kept. Toilet and shower facilities spotless so all was looking good for a nice stay.
Pitch was near road that didn't look very busy and coming from a big city we are used to road noise.
At approx 8 to 9 pm the road becomes a race track with boy races with very loud exhausts flying past next to caravan at crazy speeds to the early hours. Then at 6.30 the morning traffic starts.
The site was quiet and apart from several seasonal pitches that were not being used. We on saw 3 other couple using the site.
Why when site was so quiet the owners didn't put us on the pitches away from the road I don't know. This would have been quieter for us and encouraged us to come back to what could be a very nice site. The owners cannot be responsible for the road noise or the boy racers but the are responsible for placing you on a pitch next to the road when others are available. We had set the caravan up by the time we found out about the noise so didn't want the hassle of moving again.We will not be returning to this site unfortunately.
showerReviews.author: brian doyle

showerReviews.reviewText: Fabulous campsite with friendly people. I would definitely stop here again. Clean shower and toilet facilities. The only downside is the hard standing pitches are just wide enough for your caravan and therefore entry to your caravan is on the grass, in rainy conditions it became very boggy. So dont forget your wellies! A lovely place though and can't wait to return.
